loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun K. is 48 years old. She is married and has six children, four of whom help their parents farming. The others are attending a local public school. This family is living in Ping Pong village in Takeo province.  She and her husband, Mr. Yor Chen, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land on which to grow rice. For their farming business, they own a plowing machine. Sometimes they can earn a small income from other villagers by hiring out the plowing machine. They now face a problem because their rice field has infertile soil. They do have enough money to fix the soil. Thus, Mrs. Aun K. has decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support their rice field and to increase their rice yield this current year. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Vatt

texts.en: Mrs. Vatt C. and her family are villagers in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. She has 23 years old. She is a fruits seller to follow a season and her husband, Mr. Neat Kev, is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family living. This family has some problem because their rice field is infertile soil, it is far from irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects, but they did not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Vatt C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel and pesticide. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel and pesticide.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en: Enhbaatar A. is 33 years old and lives with his wife, Lhamsuren, and three-month-old baby boy, Nyambayar. Two years ago, Enhbaatar started a new business with his friend building his own ger and furniture. He was married that same year. The profit from their little business is the only income his little family has. It takes him anywhere from one to three months to finish the wood for a ger, and it sells for 1.5 to 2.5 million tugrugs (about $1,200 to $1,500). Usually the gers are then sent to UB to be sold. The wood is extremely expensive, so Enhbaatar would like a loan to help him buy the wood that he needs. He wants his business to do well so he can acquire his own building out of which he will work. In the meantime, he also drives a taxi to make ends meet. His wife doesn’t work, so she can stay home and take care of their new baby. Enhbaatar is an industrious, hardworking young man. He is very accommodating and a very pleasant person to be around.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Vache

texts.en: Vache Jhanginyan is 37 years old. He is a painter and he lives in Kapan with his wife and two daughters. One of his daughters is 18 months, and the other is newborn. Vache’s wife doesn’t work; she takes care of their babies. Vache works at the “Coca-Cola” Company as a hawker, and at the same time, he manages his own café and Internet club in a rented place. His café and Internet club is open until late at night seven days a week. Vache asks for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy new furniture for his café, which helps him seat more clients.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for his café

loans.name: Antero

texts.en: Antero A. is from the village of Centro Hulpa, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Antero is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Antero owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Antero has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Antero joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antero has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Antero is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Antero from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Timon

texts.en: Timon D. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Timon is single. To make a living, Timon operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing space rental services to local community members. Timon has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Timon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Timon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Timon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Timon from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Lyn Ang's Group

texts.en: Lyn A. is from the village of Culpan. She is 65 years old. Lyn is the group leader of a 2 member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lyn is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lyn owns & operates a snack vending business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Lyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Mrs. M. is 27 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. Here she built a salon shop next to her house where she has some beauty and decorative accessories to provide a service. People need to hire her accessories to decorate themselves for their parties. She also provides a face make-up service for additional profit. M. is married with a young child who is enrolled in school. She has a partner in her husband, who drives a truck for a small firm. M. requested a loan which she will use to improve her salon business. She will buy extra amounts of her beauty accessories in order to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy extra amounts of her beauty accessories

loans.name: Ney

texts.en: Mrs. Ney K. is a villager in Ping Pong village, located in Takeo Province. She is 61 years old and a grocer in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Tuk Torng, is a farmer who owns 2-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support their family. This family has some problem with their rice field being infertile soil and they do not have enough money to improve it. Mrs. Ney K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and pay for labour expanses. This couple is married and have two children, one is a laborer in Thailand country and the other helps Mrs. K. sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and labour expenses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary R. is 36 years old and married to Martin Karanja. They have three school going children.  She has been manufacturing detergent soaps which she sells to her neighbors and friends in Naivasha town for the last year.  She now wants to open a cereals shop to run side by side with the detergent business hence increasing her income.

Mary was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She plans to use this money start another business of selling cereals in  the town of Naivasha. She plans to increase her soap detergent making business and start producing on a larger scale thereby serving more clients and increasing her future income.

loans.use: To open a retail shop to sell cereals as well as continue making detergents to sell

loans.name: Uzeyir

texts.en:
Uzeyir was born in 1979. Uzeyir S. is married and his family lives in the Fuzuli region. This young man has been in the cattle business for 4 years. 

Now Uzeyir is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 23 years old and has been operating his motorbike as a taxi for the last two years in the Mukilit area, which is on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy a new motorcycle with the proceeds from the loan.  He will employ someone to run the old bike for him hence increasing his income base.

His future hopes are to buy a lorry which will be used to transport food stuff from the area to the nearby Naivasha market.  Mukulit is a very productive agricultural area and he knows that with a lorry he will have a booming business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Choeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeng S. T., 29, is a professional farmer who has worked in her farming business for more than ten years. She also sells a few cooking ingredients to make extra profit. She has been married for many years to Sok Som, 43, who helps support the family by working in construction. The couple has three school-aged children who are dependent on their income.
Choeng S. T. lives in an old house that often requires repairs, and her living situation is affected by this. To solve the problem, she is applying for a loan to repair and decorate her house. She will use any remainder of the loan to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

loans.use: To repair and decorate her house

loans.name: Tath

texts.en:
Tath S. was born in 1951. She is a widow whose husband died several years ago. She now has three teenage children who are working at different jobs. Two work in the garment industry and other one stays home and works on the farm to earn a living.

Tath S. cultivates several types of crops on her own farmland, located nearby her house. Recently she has lacked supplies and does not have the capital to buy all the supplies she needs for the farm. Tath requests a loan to buy fertilizer which will enable her to improve and increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old, married to Serah Wanjiku, and has one school-aged child. For the last three years, Peter has run a carpentry business, making home furniture for his clients in Naivasha town. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy more timber to make furniture, such as beds as they are currently in demand, and especially wants to make more furniture for display purposes.
Peter's future hopes are to expand his workshop so that he can cater for more clients, employ more people in the process, and open a timber yard to sell timber to other carpenters in the area.

loans.use: To buy timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene G. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old and the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.
Irene is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old, married to Margaret Muthoni, and has three school-aged children. He has been offering motorbike transport for the last five months. A friend introduced Paul to Kiva partner, KADET, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a helmet for his passenger and also purchase a PSV (Public Service Vehicle) license for his motorbike with this loan.
In the future, Paul hopes to buy a car for a taxi business – this will increase his net income and help him take good care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a new helmet and a PSV license

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio Y. is from the village of Taguima in the Tudela municipality of Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old. Gregorio is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Gregorio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Gregorio has been engaged in his business for over seven years, and he earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Gregorio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gregorio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Gregorio is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gregorio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his immediate family members.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.en:
Catalina M. is from the village of Cabunga-an in the Clarin municipality. She is 47 years old. Catalina is the group leader of a two-member group offered a loan by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the fellow group member, in the event the other member is delinquent or defaults.

Catalina is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Catalina owns and operates a business by raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over ten years, and she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Catalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

texts.en:

To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase another transport vehicle for the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and married to Paul Kamau. She has been in the motorcycle taxi business for three years now and wants to buy another new motorbike. 

Josephine was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy the new motorcycle to operate just like the other one she owns a taxi. She also will employ someone else to do the riding for her.

In the future, she plans to buy a pick-up van which she will use to transport food stuffs to and from the markets within Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Calixta's Group

texts.en:
Calixta E. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old and the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if he or she is delinquent or defaults.
Calixta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, candies, biscuits, eggs, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Calixta has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2007, Calixta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Calixta is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and meet their daily needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 30 years old and married to Annastacia Kanini. He has been employed as a rider in the motorcycle taxi business for the last two years, and now he wants to buy his own motorcycle. Wilson was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy his own motorcycle to use in the same taxi business. This will enable him not only to increase his income, but also make his income steady.
Wilson's future plan is to grow his transport business by purchasing a minibus for transporting customers over long distances, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Maria Nelfie

texts.en:
Maria Nelfie P. is from the village of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks, such as Coke, in the local community. Maria Nelfie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Maria Nelfie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Nelfie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Meteur

texts.en:
Meteur is 48 years old, married to Nemama ene Meteur, and they have six school-going children.  He has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years, operating on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy a new motorcycle to continue operating his taxi business.

He hopes to grow in the transport industry in the future by owning a mini bus and a lorry.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Merlyn's Group

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from the village of Labinay, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Merlyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merlyn is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business of raising pigs for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $70 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $87 a month from this activity.

loans.name: Esterlita's Group

texts.en:
Esterlita S. is from the village of Lilo-an Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Esterlita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilou R. is from Culo, Molave, Zamboanga del sur. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She manages a food-vending business at Molave public market. Her husband is a farmer. Each of them earns an income every month. Marilou has managed her business for more than three years and earns about $135 a month. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan of 8,000 PHP. Now, she is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 55-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Moussa has owned a grocery store for two years. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, pasta and rice, bread, home cleaning products, etc…as well as fruits and vegetables. Moussa is good at his work because of his experience. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. When Moussa first started his business, he had some financial issues and he had to face competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work, and because he had experience in the field. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mouhamad has been working as a home painter and interior designer since 2004. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work, as well as to purchase some decoration accessories. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his region and from the surrounding villages. When Mouhamad first started his business, he wasn’t well known by the people in his region, so he didn’t have a lot of networking in place. He decided on this business because of his experience; he learned when he was young. In the future, he plans to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools and decoration accessories.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 30-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Basem has been working as a curtain sewer and installer for two years now. He sells his own curtain fabric, but his clients are also free to come with their own. His clients are people from his region. Basem is known for his good and talented work. 

He decided on opening his curtain sewing factory after he gained experience. When he first started, he had some financial issues because of the cost of his sewing machines and fabrics, and the rent of the place was high, but as soon as he started working and making himself known, he increased his number of clients. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase curtain fabrics and to repair one of his sewing machines. This is the first time that Basem has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase curtain fabric and to repair one of his sewing machines.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 28 years old, married to Jane Wanjiru, and they have two school-going children.  He has been operating a retail shop in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He also had a posho mill (grinds maize into maize flour) that got spoiled a while back and used to act as his secondary income business.
 
He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to buy a new mortar for his posho mill with proceeds from this loan so as to revive its services as a secondary business.

He also has a transport business on the side, operating his car as a taxi. In the future he wants to see this business grow and buy a mini bus for the same business.

loans.use: Buy a mortar for his posho mill

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 20-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife; they are newly married. Mouhamad has owned a mobile phone shop for two years now. He sells and repairs old and new phones, as well as sells mobile accessories like covers, chargers, earphones and more, and also sells mobile rechargeable phone cards. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase mobile phones and their accessories for his work. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his work, he had some financial issues because he wanted to purchase all the merchandise he was expecting to sell. He decided to start this business because of his experience in sales, as well the fact that he took computer studies in school. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by selling computers and more.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and their accessories for his work.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 50 years old, married to Ruth Wairimu, and has two children who have finished the higher level of schooling and are now employed. For the last seven years, Isaac has sold construction supplies, especially wall paint, in Naivasha town. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his second loan. With his loan, he plans to buy more paint for sale and boost his stock.
Isaac plans to continue with his business in the future as it is very profitable. He hopes that he will be able to expand his business to sell paint wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more paint for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old, married to Hannah Muthoni, and has a one-year-old baby. He has been operating a motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the last three years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a new helmet for his passengers that complies with the new PSV transport regulation recently set by the government.
In the future, Michael hopes to buy a car and operate it as a taxi, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle helmet

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret E. sells shoes and palm-kernel oil at Elmina. She is married with six dependents and her husband is a cleaner. She has received no formal educational background.

Margaret has been making and selling palm-kernel oil for some time now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more shoes as well as palm-kernel to make oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

To prepare her palm kernel oil Margaret removes the shells form the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut to separate the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation has been largely superseded by the use of nut-cracking machines.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply to heat the dried kernels to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is periodically skimmed from the top as the heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed from the palm kernels.

Margaret was not making oil at the time the photo was taken. She was therefore asked to stand by the palm kernel nuts which she uses for the manufacturing of the oil.

loans.use: To buy more shoes as well as palm-kernel to make oil for sale

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Mrs. Hum N. is 49 years old and lives in Dak Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller and her husband, Mr. Chantha Kheng, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family living. This couple has a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

Although this family tries to work hard with their businesses, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus they want to start a new business breeding a cow but they do not have enough money to buy it. So Mrs. Hum N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Noeng

texts.en:
Mr. Noeng U. is a villager in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. He is 51 years old and is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family living. He is a widower with two children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory while the other one is supporting his father’s farming.

In this farming, Mr. Noeng U. now faces some problems because his rice field has infertile soil and also has a lot of insects. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. The rest of the loan he would use to hire laborers to harvest the rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. sells dried salted fish, maize and other food supplies at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is married and has three children and her husband is a driver.

Comfort has been selling food supplies for some time now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, salted fish and other food supplies for resale. In the photo, she is displaying the variety of fish she sells.

Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to improve the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, salted fish other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who are located in Chrouy Poun village in Takeo province. They each will use the loan for a different purpose. Mr. Chhay B. is the group leader who has selected by the members.

Mr. Chhay B. is 29 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Choy, are farmers who own 1.3-hectarE. (3.25-acrE.) of land they use to cultivate rice to support their family living.

In their rice field, they have some problems because it is far from the irrigation system but they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Chhay B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for the water pump. The rest of the loan he will use to buy rice to support their family living in this period until he obtains his rice crop.

This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy fuel for the irrigation pump and rice for family consumption

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is single and has one child. She has received senior high education.

Josephine sells frozen chicken and other varieties of meat and also sells jewelry at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income in payment of utility bills and other expenses.

Josephine will use the loan to purchase more frozen meat for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business she plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

In front of her in the photo is a variety of frozen fish and meat.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen meat to sell

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked. Mrs. Hon L. is the village bank president who has selected by the members.
 
Mrs. Hon L. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the other is too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Meou Chhen, is a construction worker in the local village.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their family living. So they would like to start a new business selling tamarinds (a local fruit) but they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Hon L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more tamarinds to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tamarinds to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food products

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar A. is a young man, 32 years old, who is married and has one child. He and his family live in Fuzuli region.

Yashar has been in his clothing business for six years. Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand his sales area to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand his sales area

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. is a single parent who has two children and is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Cecilia has received junior high education.

Cecilia has been selling bananas, plantains and provisions such as soap, Milo (a milk beverage), milk and canned tomatoes at Elmina for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions, bananas, plantains, cassava and other food supplies to sell.

Cecilia hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, bananas, plantains, cassava and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik N. was born in 1968 in Kapan. He is an electrician, and worked for several years at his specialty. Now he works in an oxygen filling station as an operator.

At the same time, Valerik is engaged in stock farming and growing crops, which he manages with his own funds. He breeds cows and chickens on his farm and raises oats, which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. Valerik needs 350,000 AMD to buy diesel oil and seed for his farm.

Valerik is married and has two children: his son is school-aged and his daughter is a student. Valerik uses part of his profit for his daughter's education at an institute.

loans.use: To buy diesel oil and seed for his farm

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Comfort has received junior high education.

Comfort cooks banku and okro (okra) stew, and also sells fried eggs and bread at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Comfort will use the loan to buy more maize for the preparation of banku and also buy raw eggs to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business.

To prepare her banku, Comfort first makes sure she gets her corn dough. She uses maize that has been milled and left to prove (rise). Usually, after milling it, it is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used. She then makes  cassava dough.

Comfort then makes a mixture with the cassava and corn doughs in a porridge form and stirs it on a fairly high heat for some time to get a firm but fine texture, a texture firm enough to be eaten.

The dish accompanying her banku can either be any kind of soup or sauce to your taste, such as palm-nut soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, okra soup or hot pepper sauce, or fish of any kind.

Comfort wasn't cooking at the time the photo was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how banku is prepared.

loans.use: To buy more maize for the preparation of banku and raw eggs to fry

loans.name: Marittes

texts.en:
Marittes N. is a 40-year-old hardworking mother. She and her husband, Raul, who is a fisherman, are blessed with three beautiful daughters.

Marittes recently joined ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines, to be able to have access to a loan which she will use to start a food-selling business. Income she will then make will augment that of her husband and therefore they will be able to support the basic needs of her children, especially their education until they graduate from college.

Filipino people are fond of eating. In a day, they have three regular meals and two snacks in-between meals. This is actually true, especially for those people who live in the provinces and work hard the whole day like farmers and other laborers - just like the people in the village where Marittes and her family live.

Thus, Marittes thought that the business she planned would be appropriate to the needs of the people around her. Some of the food items she is going to cook and sell such as “bananaque” (bananas deep-fried and sweetened) will be directly sold house to house during snack-break while others will be sold in front of her house.

loans.use: To start a food-preparation and sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ladies' and gents' wear in bulk

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion A. is a typical wife who wants to help her husband earn money to improve the lives of their six children, whose ages range from one to 16 years. Her husband is a small-time laborer who earns just a small about of income.

With her husband’s income alone, Consolacion’s dream of giving their children a better life is impossible. Therefore, together with her supportive family, she joined ASHI just recently so that she can request a loan which she will use to start up a small business raising pigs.

The nature of this business is that either you will slaughter the hog or you will sell it live after four months fattening. The larger the volume of hogs sold, the greater the profit. However, starting up with a small amount of capital, Consolacion would still be happy to see her small profit responding to her family’s basic needs.

With ASHI and its partner Kiva, Consolacion believes that someday her small business will grow and its profit will sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
28-year-old Maryrose A. has lived with her partner, Francis Jericho, for nine years. Together with Francis, she battled to survive her heart ailment. Somehow she felt sad for not having a child and also because she has no money to spend for the required treatment. But because of the love and motivation of her partner, she remains strong and hopeful that someday she will be cured and will have a child.

Just recently, Maryrose found an answer to her prayer. She knew about ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines and she decided to join. After her recognition as a member, she requested a loan to start a business. Aside from the profit she will earn from it, the important things for her are her happiness and mental preoccupation. She doesn’t like to just sit down in her house and wait for her partner to come home from work while thinking about her ailment and how to get better and have a child.

Having a small sari-sari (variety) store in their own house, she will have something to keep busy with physically and mentally. With ASHI and Kiva assisting with her needs for financial business capital, someday she will grow her “sari-sari” store into a larger grocery store and will improve the economic status of her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastics in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of beans, local rice, and groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en: Erickson is a 31-year-old man who runs a butcher shop that employs four people. His other source of income is a barber shop, which he also operates. With the Kes. 80,000 loan, Erickson wants to open other outlets of his butcher shop. He hopes to someday open a meat processing plant. Erickson describes himself as an aggressive businessman.

loans.use: To open other outlets of his butcher shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 35-year-old married woman with two sons. She has been running a beauty salon for four years. Previously, she was employed as a hair stylist. With the Kes.80,000 loan, she hopes to improve her business by adding beauty supplies. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for enabling her to expand her business to the point where she now employs two workers. She wants to open another salon in town in the future. She hopes to be a leading supplier of hair products someday. Beatrice describes herself as friendly, aggressive, and competitive.

loans.use: To purchase beauty supplies for salon

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with a two-year-old son. He has been running a restaurant for three years and employs two people. He is also a painter. He was previously employed in a restaurant as a waiter. With the 40,000 KES loan, Peter wants to expand his business and purchase another refrigerator. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him discipline in money management. The repayment of the loan has also challenged him to plan ahead financially. In the future, Peter hopes to open another restaurant, serving both the local and international markets. He describes himself as calm and competitive.

loans.use: To expand restaurant and purchase another refrigerator

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raykan's Group

texts.en:
T. Raykan is one of the women who can be a model for everyone. She lives in Balykchi, which is located at the seaside of our beautiful lake, Issyk–Kyl. In general, Balykchi is a town where you can find nothing. There is no satisfactory job or any chance to survive. The desire of every citizen is just to come to the capital of Kyrgyzstan and look for any job. As it was mentioned above, T. Raykan is self–confident because about 10 years ago, she decided that she could not waste her time loafing. She opened up a little business. Nowadays she has a small grocery shop. So her hardworking husband leased a minibus to take passengers, but a few years later he got a loan , bought a minibus and continues today.  Her profit from selling is about 3,000 soms ($65) and her husband’s is 15,000 ($340) soms. Their total revenue is 18,000 ($405) soms. So a few days later, they decided to get a loan to buy two small sheep to breed and then sell in the future. Their plan for future is to increase their livestock.

O. Nerkul is a 57-year-old woman who is divorced. She has a mother who is on a pension; she receives 3,000 ($65) soms from the government. Nerkul is a staff member in the company “IPAR”, which is a multilevel marketing company and earns money from selling probiotics. She had to run this business to improve her health and distribute information about this company. Now she has a leadership level position and opened an informational center in Balykchi. Her profit is about 10,000 or 15,000 soms. She wants to get a loan to increase turnover and to extend her own staff. Her aim is to achieve another fourth degree and to go away to international business.

Davletova G. is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a citizen of Balykchi. Her husband works as a chief administrator of social security in Balykchi. They have a daughter who is a student. G. works in the multilevel marketing company "IPAR”. Once she improved her health by taking the probiotics and having good results, she started to work for the company. She started with 5,500 soms. With the help of the probiotics, she has cured her grandsons’ burn, she was cured from high blood pressure and now she is on the way to getting her second degree. Her aim is to achieve high degrees and to extend her trade turnover and staff.

Suyundukova T. is 45 years old. She is married. Her husband works as an electrician in telecasting. His salary is 15,000. She works in the multilevel marketing company “IPAR”. Her profit is about 1,500 soms per month. Her health was improved by probiotics and after getting good results, she started her business in “IPAR”. She started with 2,000 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover. Their plan for future is to buy livestock.  

Tazabekova R. is a 57-year-old woman. She improved her health by using the probiotics and after getting good results, she started to work for the company. She has a leadership level position. Her profit is 10,000 soms per month. However, she began her business with 5,500 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover and her staff. Her main aim is to buy a flat in Bishkek.

Akmatova A. works in the multilevel marketing company “IPAR”. She is 55 years old. She is a widow who has a daughter who is 20 years old. She improved her health by using the probiotics and after getting good results, she started to work distributing information about this company. She earns each month about 2,000 soms; she started her business with 5,500 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover and her staff. Her main aim is to buy a flat in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two small sheep for breeding and selling

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.ru:
Арпачиева Бурул – лидер данной группы. Бурул – из г. Балыкчи. Она живёт с двумя сыновьями. Несколько лет тому назад она потеряла мужа. С тех пор ей одной пришлось воспитывать детей, расти их и давать образование. Сейчас дети уже подросли. Старший сын временно безработный, а младший, устроился работать в пекарню. Чтобы обеспечивать семью, Бурул в свои пятьдесят пять лет работает в городской больнице санитаркой и получает за это ежемесячную зарплату в размере трёх тысяч ($68) сомов.  Так как она имеет многолетний стаж работы, она параллельно получает пенсию в размере полтора тысячи ($34) сомов. А также она нашла себе приемлемое занятие, которое позволяет ей зарабатывать деньги в свободное от работы время, даже не выходя из дому. Она шьёт национальные изделия, продажа которых приносит ей ежемесячно около полтора тысячи ($34) сомов. Это ремесло Бурул освоила еще, будучи школьницей. Тогда она и представить себе не могла, как это ей пригодится в будущем. Клиенты Бурул сами приходят к ней домой, и делают заказы. Бурул обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь сыну начать собственное дело. Он поделился с ней планами начать бизнес с торговли полиэтиленовыми пакетами. Бурул уверена, что сын хорошо устроит этот бизнес, и будет получать неплохую прибыль. В дальнейшем Бурул с сыном хотят открыть постоянные точки реализации таких пакетов. 

У Бурул три партнёра по группе: 

Баякеевой Рыскул сорок три года. У Рыскул двое детей. Старший сын учится в институте, а младшая дочь –школьница. Муж Рыскул работает водителем грузового авто. Сама Рыскул устроилась работать продавщицей в магазине, который принадлежит родственникам. Рыскул нуждается в кредите. Она хочет приобрести товар и реализовывать его в том же магазине.

Жузубакуновой Мээрим двадцать три года. Она не замужем и в данное время нигде не работает. Мээрим хочет заняться торговлей чулочно – носочными изделиями. Она хочет закупить товар в Бишкеке и сдавать в магазины г. Балыкчи. Для этого она и обратилась за этим кредитом. 

Каныкееву Азамату двадцать два года. Он уже женат и у него есть один сын. Азамат планирует заняться торговлей рулонными пакетами. В данное время он поёт в кафе со своими друзьями и зарабатывает в среднем триста сомов в день. Ему нужен кредит, чтобы закупить товар.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burul A. is the leader of the group. Burul is from Balykchi. She lives with her two sons. Several years ago she lost her husband. Since then, she had to provide for her children and educate them by herself. Now her children are grown. The eldest son is temporarily unemployed, and younger, found work at a bakery. To provide for the family at the age of fifty-five, Burul works in a city hospital as a nurse and receives a monthly salary of three thousand Som ($68) per month. As she has a long history of employment, she is also entitled to receive a pension of fifteen hundred Som ($34) per month. She was even able to turn her hobby into a source of income. In her free time, she makes close to fifteen hundred Som ($34) sewing national, cultural products. She learned this craft while she was at school. She could not imagine at that time that the skill would prove useful in the future. The customers come to her home to place orders. Burul is asking for a loan to help her son start his own business. He shared with her his plans to start his business of selling plastic bags. Burul believes that her son will be successful at this business, and will be able to make a profit. Later, Burul and her son want to open a permanent point of sale stand of such packages.

Burul has three partners in the group:

Ryskul Bayakeevoy is forty-three years old and has two children. The eldest son is studying in the university, and the youngest daughter, a schoolgirl. Her husband works as a truck driver. Ryskul works as a clerk in the store, which belongs to her relatives. Ryskul is asking for a loan to purchase goods to sell in the same store.

Meerim Zhuzubakunovoy is twenty-three years old. She is single and currently unemployed. Meerim wants to do trade in socks and hosiery. She would like to purchase goods in Bishkek and sell to shops Balykchi. To be able to do this, she is asking for a loan.

Azamat K. is twenty-two years old. He is married and has one son. Azamat would like to sell plastic packaging materials. Currently, he sings in a cafe with his friends and makes close to three hundred Som per day. He is asking for a loan to purchase goods.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to help her son to open his own start-up business of trade in plastic bags

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
J. Nurjamal is the leader of this group. Nurjamal works as an electrician. Her monthly salary is about 95 dollars. She realized that her salary would never be enough to provide her daughter with a quality education and happy childhood, and she started looking for extra sources of income. Besides, for the last several years she has been divorced. Finally, she entered the multilevel marketing company Oriflame, as a saleswoman. Due to having an open and amiable personality and communication skills, Nurjamal quickly attracted customers and reached a monthly salary of 230 dollars. Later, she entered another company, selling its products by means of multilevel marketing, and she now receives 25% from the sales. Thus, she has accomplished her aim of additional earnings, enabling her daughter to go to a good high school and get a good education. She has also been able to make a repair to her flat and even go to a resort for two weeks of rest last year. Nurjamal has applied for this loan as she needs funds to buy kitchen furniture.

Nurjamal’s partners:

K. Aizada, age 30, is married. She is raising one daughter. Aizada's husband works as an operator at a gas station, while Aizada stays home and looks after cattle. Aizada has applied for this loan to purchase cattle and send them to pasture.

A. Zarema, age 39, has one son. Her husband is a builder. Zarema works as a leading specialist in the Migration and Employment Service of the Kyrgyz Republic. She has applied for this loan to install some furniture at home. Zarema’s dream is to send her son to study abroad.

M. Mairamkul, age 47, is the mother of two children. Her husband works as a driver for a gold mining company. Mairamkul works as a school teacher. She teaches chemistry. Mairamkul hopes to obtain this loan in order to make some repairs at home. Her children have grown up, and Mairamkul hopes to help them find good jobs and get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.zstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy kitchen furniture for home use

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly se dedica a la confección de polleras y este producto lo vende en las ferias y también deja al crédito en las tiendas.
 
Vive en el callejon 2, Zona Santiago I de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Su esposo trabaja como maestro de albañil y trabaja en distintas zonas en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
 Tiene dos  hijos  los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  material de construcción, con lo cual hará levantar una habitación donde pueda vivir ella y su familia. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Nelly makes skirts and sells them at the fairs. She also leaves them on credit at stores. She lives at Callejon 2 in the Santiago I area in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a master bricklayer in different areas of the city of La Paz. She has two school-age children. The loan is to buy construction material to raise a room where she and her family can live. It is her first loan from Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks, cement, and stucco to build a room

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene se dedica a la compra de chompas y las vende en la ciudad de  Cochabamba; ahí es donde tiene un  puesto fijo de venta de sus productos.

Vive en la calle 5 de Agosto Zona Pasanqueri de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Su esposo trabaja como maestro de albañil y trabaja en distintas zonas en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
 Tiene dos  hijos  los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la  compra de faldas para niñas, que por estas fechas son demandadas en el mercado, por que ya empieza el año escolar.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Irene buys sweaters and sells them in the city of Cochabamba. That is where she has a small fixed stand to sell her products. She lives on 5 de Agosto Street on the Pasanqueri area of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a master bricklayer in the different areas of the city of La Paz. She has two school-age children. The loan is to buy girls’ skirts. They are now in demand at the market because the school year is starting. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy girls' skirts to sell during this back to school time

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es tejedora de camas y estos productos los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en la calle Ch. zona El Progreso de la ciudad de El Alto

 Tiene tres hijos los cuales todos ya son independientes y casados. 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de lana para tejer más camas y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Paula makes weavings, and she sells her products in the fairs in the city of El Alto. She lives on Che Stree in the El Progresso area of El Alto. She has three children who are all married and independent. The loan is to buy more wool to make more weavings to be able to improve her income. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Waigumo

texts.en: Waigumo is a 60 year old married woman with two daughters and three sons. She has been running Waigumo Catering Services, which provides catering for social gatherings, for the past 11 years and employs four people. With this 40,000 KES loan, she hopes to buy more serving equipment. She hopes to become a leading provider of catering services for large occasions in the future. She also hopes to start a restaurant serving both local and international clients. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her expand her business by providing her with loans. Waigumo describes herself as aggressive and competitive.

loans.use: To purchase serving equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama P. est âgée de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 2007 et a eu 7 expériences avec le crédit. Elle est vendeuse de fruits (oranges et mandarines) et du mil. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama P., 57, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of TOULY since 2007 and has already received 7 prior loans. She sells fruit (oranges and mandarins) and millet. Her goal is to participate in supporting her family and helping improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to develop her income-generating business

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es: Mario , es un joven de 28 años, que como él dice, aprendió a ser electricista a en la escuela de la vida y logró perfeccionar este oficio cuando realizó su carrera en el SENA a los 22 años como técnico; por largo tiempo y desde muy temprana edad, trabajó como ayudante de electricidad en talleres informales donde ganó una importante experiencia cuando se arriesgó a hacer trabajos personales y fue así como se dio a conocer; por cosas del destino, salió de su pueblo ubicado en el departamento del Magdalena con su esposa hace 4 años a vivir en Soledad, buscando una vida tranquila y productiva; inicialmente recibió del Gobierno Nacional un primer crédito de $1.000.000, con ese dinero compró repuestos y gradualmente fue agregando, una vitrina que poco a poco fue llenando de mercancías y en este momento cuenta con vitrinas, estantería, un escritorio de trabajo y gran variedad de herramientas para el trabajo diversificado que realiza; pues además de ofrecer sus servicios como electricista, también realiza mantenimiento, reparaciones y adecuaciones domiciliarias, es decir se le mide a todo. Mario está casado y tiene 3 hijos menores entre los 8 y 11 años, su esposa lo acompaña y también trabaja en su pequeña miscelánea que atiende desde su casa y que le da la oportunidad de estar al cuidado personal de sus pequeños hijos, porque eso es lo que proporciona el tener un negocio en el mismo lugar donde se habita. Se inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a través de una amiga, que conoce muy bien a esta organización y se ha convertido en promotora de sus beneficios; ella lo recomendó ante el asesor Milgen Sánchez, porque ella sabe que él y su esposa son muy responsables. Esta pareja siempre está en la búsqueda de su crecimiento personal, por eso cuando el Sena trae capacitaciones a su barrio, participan teniendo en cuenta que sea funcional para administrar mejor su negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación por valor de $ 1.600.000 con el planea comprar una vitrina y surtir el negocio; a Mario le ha gustado estar en la Fundación por la sensibilidad social de sus asesores con ellos pueden ser sinceros para que la ayuda sea más efectiva. Sus sueño es especializarse en electrónica cuando el negocio tome un mayor auge, aumente su mercado y por consiguiente las ventas. Su mayor desafío es obtener una vivienda porque en la actualidad vive en arriendo y tiene la esperanza de acogerse a los programas del estado para adquirirla y no tener que pagar más arriendo. Considera que vive en un barrio muy bueno, porque sus vecinos se quieren y se ayudan mutuamente, además existen muchas organizaciones de base que apoyan a las familias y especialmente está la escuela de sus hijos donde tienen una beca y él es muy agradecido con la escuela, pues la ayuda con lo que el sabe la pinta, le arregla las paredes, hace reparaciones eléctricas, lo que le ha ganado el buen nombre de su directora y del profesorado que apoyan la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario, is 28 years old, and as he says, he learned to be an electrician in the school of life. He managed to improve his skills when he received a technical degree from SENA when he was 22. For a long time, and since he was very young, he worked as an electrician's assistant in informal shops. There he gained valuable experience for when he risked jobs on his own and this was how he learned. For reasons of destiny, he left his hometown located in the department of Magdalena with his wife of four years, to live in Soledad, looking for a calm and productive life. Initially Mario received his first credit of $1,000,000 COP from the National Government. With this money he bought spare parts, which he gradually accumulated, he bought a display case, and little by little he filled it with merchandise. Now he has display cases, shelves, a work bench and a great variety of tools for the various jobs that he does. In addition to the services he offers as an electrician, he also does maintenance work, repairs and remodeling, which he to say he does everything. Mario and his wife have 3 young children between the ages of 8-11 years old. His wife accompanies him and also does her own miscellaneous jobs that she can attend to from their home and which allows her the opportunity to care for their small children, this is the benefit of having a business in the home. They began with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because of a friend that knew the organization well and had become a promoter of its benefits. This friend recommended them to the loan officer, Milgen Sánchez, because she knew that Mario and his wife were very responsible and that the couple is always seeking ways to improve themselves. When SENA brought trainings to their neighborhood, Mario and his wife participated knowing that it would help them to better manage their business. This will be the second credit with the Fundación for the amount of $ 1.600.000 COP. Mario plans to buy a display case and to support the business. Mario has liked working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the social sensitivity of the loan officers because Mario can be sincere with them so that they can help him most effectively. His dream is to specialize in electronics once the business takes off, increasing his inventory and as a result his sales. His greatest challenge is to obtain a home because his family is leasing. He hopes to qualify for the state programs to obtain homes so that he will no longer have to lease. Mario lives in a good neighborhood because his neighbors like his family and they all help each other, what's more there are many organizations that are based there to support families and especially his childrens' school where they receive a scholarship and Mario is very grateful for the school and he helps with the things that he knows how to do like paint, repair the walls and do electrical repairs. He has earned a good reputation with the director of the school and the faculty that educates his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case and improve the business with various merchandise

loans.name: Tarif

texts.en: Tarif is a 37 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Tarif has been an electrician since 1998. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and financial issues in order to purchase all the tools and electrical wires needed for his work. Tarif is talented; he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and repair his business car which allows him to go to his clients. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools and repair his business car

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 33 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been working in sanitation since 1996. He is talented in his work; he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Hussein decided to go into this business because he learned it at a young age. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the required tools. Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa F. est une femme de 70 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison (des oranges et mandarines) depuis plus de 4 ans. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
Awa F., 70, is married and the mother of 4 children whom she is still supporting. She has been selling seasonal fruit (oranges and mandarins) for more than 4 years. Her goal is to help support the family and add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chair and make some decorative changes in his shop

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 42 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Silvana has been selling scrap metal for two years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Silvana has requested a loan. 
Silvana is talented in her work because she does her best to suit her clients' demands and is very friendly. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues and didn’t have all the material needed for her sales. Silvana decided on going into this work because it was her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis García Martínez tiene 37 años y vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, caracterizado por ser semillero de agrupaciones musicales que conservan la música tradicional de gaitas y tambores heredada del indígena, africano y español; Jorge Luis está casado y tiene tres hijos en las edades de 11, 8 y 7 meses, es propietario de una microempresa donde vende refrescos, leche, queso y presta el servicio de comunicación por minutos a través de celulares. Su negocio nació porque el sector en que vive no tenia oferta de refrescos y las tiendas de víveres están distantes; en él trabajan Jorge y su esposa desde una habitación de su vivienda, la cual ha construido con sus propios esfuerzos; Jorge y su esposa son una pareja trabajadora y muy conocida por la comunidad sanjacintera; los dos tienen una historia crediticia saludable pues han recibido créditos con diversas entidades que han cancelado puntualmente, como cuando financió la compra en su moto, para ofrecerla como medio de transporte y generar otro ingreso, aprovechando que es la forma más utilizada en el municipio para trasladarse de un lugar a otro; asimismo Jorge ha recibido financiamiento por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el que ha logrado comprar parte de sus activos fijos como la nevera cuando inició su negocio de venta de gaseosas y los planes para iniciar su negocio de comunicaciones.

Actualmente aplica a un crédito de $1.600.000 que quiere invertir en la compra de víveres y acondicionamiento de su local; el considera que su pequeño negocio le ha permitido aumentar sus ingresos familiares con el fin de mejorar su bienestar y de terminar la construcción de su casa. Jorge se muestra muy agradecido con la ayuda otorgada por la Fundación porque empezó de cero, pero con el apoyo que recibe va creciendo poco a poco. Más adelante, Jorge quiere ampliar su negocio, aprovechando que no hay tiendas cercanas y por eso quiere convertirlo en un autoservicio de víveres con oferta variada para que sus clientes reales y potenciales encuentren fácilmente lo que necesiten y deseen. Su proyecto principal es aumentar sus ingresos provenientes de su negocio mediante el trabajo, pues quiere ahorrar para llevar a sus hijos a la universidad ayudándolos a ampliar el panorama de opciones de bienestar futuro
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto in the department of Bolivar, characterized by the hotbed of musical groups that preserve the musical traditions of bagpipes and drums inherited from indigenous groups, Africans and the Spanish. Jorge Luis is married and has three children, ages 11, 8 and 7 months. He is the owner of a micro-business that sells soft drinks, milk, cheese and minutes for cellular phones. His business began because the area that he lives in does not have a store that offers soft drinks and food stores are far away. Jorge and his wife run the store from a room in their house, which they have built themselves. Jorge and his wife are hardworking and are well known throughout their community. They both have a healthy credit history due to prior credits they have received from various lending entities that they have repaid punctually, as when they financed the purchase of their motor bike. The motor bike serves as a mode of transportation and generates income, considering it is the most common form of transportation in the region to commute from one place to another. Jorge has received financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he used to buy part of his assets like the refrigerator for his soft drink sale business and to begin his communications business. Jorge has applied for a credit of $1,600,000 COP that he wants to invest in the purchase of food and packaging.
