He believes that his small business has allowed him to increase his family's income in order to improve their well being and complete the construction of their house. Jorge is very grateful for the help that is authorized via Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because he began with nothing, but with the support that he received he continues growing little by little. What's more, Jorge wants to increase his business, considering that there aren't stores nearby, he wants to convert to a self-service grocery store that can offer a variety for his customers and potentials to find easily what they need and desire. His principle project is to increase his income from his business and work, because he wants to save to send his children to college, helping them to broaden their outlook and well being in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and packaging

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait un commerce de fruits de saison, elle vend des mandarines et des oranges. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy D., 55, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for three and a half years. She has a little business selling seasonal fruit; she sells mandarins and oranges. She helps improve the living conditions and health of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little income-generating business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohamad has owned a bakery since 2000. He makes all types of Lebanese pastries, including the following: “Fatayers” - spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Manakich” - pastry baked with thyme, olive oil, spices and sesame seeds; “Sfiha” - pies made from fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes; “Sambousik” - pastries with meat and pine nuts; and “Rakaek Jibne” - thin flour dough, stuffed with combination cheese, then fried to golden perfection.

Mohamad has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his bakery. He is talented at his work because he offers good quality and very tasty pastries. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends and neighbors. Mohamad decided on going into this business because he is a very good cook and has experience. He plans to keep on improving his business as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise for his bakery

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. For the past two years, she has been running a shop, where she sells cereals, maize and beans. With this 30,000 KES loan, she plans to purchase beans and cereals. She hopes to open a wholesale cereals shop someday. Esther describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase beans and cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est âgée de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Depuis 3 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit commerce de fruits. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son commerce lui permet de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is a 59-year old woman who is married and has eight children. For the past three and a half years she has been a member of the village bank in TOULY. Her loan will allow her to develp a small fruit business. The profits she makes from the business will allow her to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her income-generating activity

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es:
Argemiro M. tiene 64 años y vive en Cartagena de Indias,  trabaja con su hijo de 29 años y juntos venden herramientas, repuestos y accesorios para vehículos de carga pesada en un tenderete en el barrio de El Bosque cerca de la oficina de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en Cartagena. Argemiro  solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 y quiere invertirlo en aumentar las compras de  cadenas, raches, grilletes y gatos para tractomulas que son los artículos que más le piden y de los que tienen mayor costo.

Comenzó su negocio vendiendo puerta a puerta por las calles del barrio El Bosque acompañado de su único hijo. Al inicio vendía productos como candados, relojes y gafas, pero a medida que se fue capitalizando comenzó a vender las mercancías que maneja actualmente. Ha tenido cuatro créditos anteriores con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le ayudaron a capitalizar su negocio y así pudo ubicarse de manera estacionaria en una esquina en el mismo barrio que queda cerca de varias empresas de transporte de carga pesada. Por su buen trato, amabilidad y responsabilidad fue conquistando la clientela ubicada a su alrededor, que son en su mayoría dueños de las tractomulas y así posicionó su negocio en el punto donde se encuentra hoy. Los créditos de la Fundación le han dejado más ganancias y más ingresos familiares con los que ha podido mejorar su vivienda y generar ingresos que mantenga   trabajando a él, su  hijo,  nuera  y nietos.

Como su tenderete está en un espacio público,  que siempre mantiene limpio y ordenado y cuenta con el apoyo de las empresas a sus alrededores, siente temor que puedan quitarlo de este sitio. Por eso su meta es conseguir un local donde sus ingresos puedan cubrir el arriendo, que esté ubicado en un sitio amplio y cercano  para mantener más variedad de productos y adquirir otras líneas que tengan conexión con el mercado con el que trabaja actualmente. Otro sueño suyo es de seguir mejorando la vivienda donde viven su familia y él.
texts.en:
Argemiro is 64 years old and lives in Cartagena de Indias. He works with his 29 year old son and together they sell tools, parts and accessories for heavy cargo vehicles in a stall in the neighborhood of El Bosque near the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo office in Cartagena. Argemiro seeks a credit of $2.000.000 COP and wants to invest in a large purchase of chains, belts, shackles and tracks for tractor-trailers because they are the articles that are most asked for and most expensive. He began his business selling door to door in the streets of the neighborhood of El Bosque accompanied by his only son. At the beginning he sold products like padlocks, watches and glasses, but as a capitalizing man, he began to sell the merchandise that he currently sells. He has had four previous credits with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that have helped him to capitalize his business and this is how he was able to establish himself on a single corner in the same neighborhood that is close to various transportation and heavy cargo businesses. For his good treatment, kindness and responsibility he has won over the clientele in his area, the majority of whom are owners of tractor-trailers and this his how he positioned his business as it is today. The credits from Fundación have given him greater earnings and more family income with which he has been able to improve his household and to generate income to maintain the work of he and his son and daughter and grandchildren. As his stall is in a public space, he always keeps it clean and orderly and has the support of the businesses in the area, he is afraid that they would make him leave this site. Because of this, his goal is to find a place where he can afford the lease and that is located in a place that is spacious and close so that he can maintain more variety in products and to acquire other lines that have connection with the market that he works with. Another dream is to continue improving the house in which he and his family live.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the purchase of chains, belts, shackles and tracks for tractor-trailers.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 38 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Tomasa, tienen 2 niños: Isela de 15 años en 4to año de secundaria y Hector de 7 añitos en 3er grado de primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa y por las tardes se dedica a vender productos cosmeticos que le brindadn ingresos adicionales que le permiten apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  Hector trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 20 años como operario de limpieza. Esta solicitando su 3er credito a AFODENIC para la construccion de un sumidero en su casa ya que desea brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia instalando los servicios higienicos en su casa.
texts.en:
Hector is 38 years old, he is married to the Senora Tomasa, they have two children, Isela is 15 years old and in her fourth year of secondary school and Hector is 7 years old in the third grade. Hector's wife is in charge of the household and in the afternoons she sells cosmetics which brings additional income that help support her husband in paying the household expenses. Hector has worked for the mayor of Juigalpa as a janitor for twenty years. He is seeking his third credit from AFODENIC for the construction of a sink in his house because he wants to provide the most comfort for his family by installing hygienic services in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a sink and hygenic services.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 3 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY et y a eu 7 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle participe aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 59-year old woman who is married and has six children. For the past three and a half years she has been a member of the village bank in TOULY, and she has had seven loans which she has managed well and repaid. She has a small business selling seasonal fruits. She contributes to the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her income-generating activity

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama P. est âgée de 74 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi. Son crédit lui permet de mener un commerce de fruits de saison, grâce à cette activité elle participe au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama P. is 74 years old, married and has five children. She has been a member of the village bank in TOULY for three and a half years. Her loan will allow her to run a seasonal fruits business, and thanks to this business she can contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her commercial activity

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy vive en la zona  25 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto, en su casita propia.

Trabaja como albañil de manera independiente en diferentes zonas de la ciudad y su esposa trabaja como educadora de un colegio de la zona. Todos sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar.
  
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de medicamentos para una de sus pequeñas hijas la cual se encuentra delicada de salud.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo que va vía Kiva, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in the “25 de julio” (25 of July) zone of El Alto in his own cottage. He works independently as a bricklayer in different areas of the city, and his wife works as a teacher in a neighborhood high school. All their children are of school age.

The loan will be used for the purchase of medications for one of their small daughters who is experiencing health problems. This his second loan with Impro and the second obtained through Kiva. He is rated as qualified to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medications for one of his daughters who has health problems.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Mariétou D. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle vend des fruits de saison telles que des oranges et mandarines. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à a prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariétou D. is a 39-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in TOULY for the past three and a half years. She sells seasonal fruits such as oranges and mandarins. Her aim is to boost her savings and to help to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her income-generating activity

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene vive en la zona  Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto, en su casita propia. 

Trabaja en una pequeña imprenta la cual es de su propiedad y se encuentra ubicada en una de las zonas céntricas de la ciudad.

Su esposa le colabora en sus trabajos diarios en el taller.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materiales (papel, tinta) para el buen desempeño de sus trabajos.

Es el séptimo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rene live in the Villa Dolores zone of the city of El Alto, in his own home. He works in a small printing shop which he owns and which is located in one of the central zone of the city. His wife helps him in his daily work in his shop. He will use the loan for the purchase of materials (paper, ink) to perform his work well. This is his seventh loan from Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials such as paper and ink for his print shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es: Rosalpina es soltera, tiene 2 hijos: Pierina de 25 años quien esta casada pero vive con su mamá y esta cursando el ultimo año de Administracion de Empresas en la universidad, y Rafael de 21 años cursando el 4to año de mercadotecnia. Rosalpina trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años. Está solicitando su 9no crédito para comprar una computadora para que sus hijos puedan hacer sus trabajos e investigaciones que les dejan en la universidad, asi mismo le serviria para realizar trabajos que no puede terminar en la oficina, pues como hay reduccion de horas laborales, no puede completar algunos informes en el tiempo establecido. Los créditos anteriores han sido utilizados para mejorar su vivienda. Es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, se caracteriza por ser honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Rosalpina is single and has two children: Pierina is 25 years old, married, but lives with her mother and is in her final year of Business Administration at university; and Rafael who is 21 years old and is in his fourth year of a course in Marketing. Rosalpina has worked for the Mayor’s Office in the municipality of Juigalpa for seven years. She is asking for her ninth loan and will use it to buy a computer so that her children can do their university work and research on it. As well, Rosalpina would use it to do work that she hasn’t been able to finish in the office because a reduction in hours has meant that she can’t complete reports in the time allotted. Her past loans have been used to improve her house. She is much-liked by her work colleagues and is known to be honest and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa G. est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Son crédit lui permet de développer son activité de vente de fruits de saison tel que des oranges et des mandarines.  Cette activité lui génère des bénéfices lui permettant de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa G. is 49 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank for the past three and a half years. Her loan will allow her to build up her business selling seasonal fruits such as oranges and mandarins. This business generates profits which allow her to contribute to the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her income-generating activity

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la zona  21 de Diciembre de la ciudad de El Alto, en su casita propia.

Trabaja junto a su esposo y sus hijos en la confección de buzos deportivos en poca escala, los cuales lleva a vender a la frontera con el Perú.

Tiene un pequeño taller  ubicado en su propio domicilio, el cual se encuentra en una zona peri urbana de la ciudad.
  
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de telas y otros insumos para un mayor volumen de su producción.

 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo que va vía Kiva, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the “21 de diciembre” (21 of December) zone of El Alto in her own cottage. She works together with her husband and children in a small scale operation making track suits which she takes to sell on the border with Peru. She has a small workshop located in her home, which is in an area on the edge of the city.

The loan will be used for the purchase of fabrics and other raw materials so that she can increase the volume of her production. This is her second loan with Impro and the second obtained through Kiva. She is rated as qualified to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, zippers, and other raw materials for her business manufacturing track suits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plumbing materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche la cual lo comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad  de Sullcata localidad Laja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Su esposo, aparte de colaborar con el trabajo del cuidado del ganado, trabaja como conductor de tractores agrícolas en la zona.

Vive junto a sus hijos menores los cuales se encuentran estudiando en el colegio del poblado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Marina raises cattle and sells the milk to Pil Andina, a dairy plant. She lives in Sullcata in Laja in the Los Andes province, 3 hours from the city of the La Paz. Her husband, in addition to helping raise the cattle, works as a tractor driver in the area. They live with their young children, who study at the local school. This loan will be used to purchase a milk cow and thereby increase milk production and their income. This is their first loan with Impro, the evaluation they carried out qualified them to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo vive en la “Avenida  Buenos Aires”  de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en un pequeño departamento el cual esta en alquiler junto su esposa, su pequeño hijo de 3 años y un bebe por nacer.
 
Trabaja como maestro mecánico en automóviles en un taller ubicado en la misma zona.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de una maquina compresora para el pintado de vehículos, puesto que la actual esta deteriorada y a punto de quedar inutilizable.
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ubaldo lives on the Avenida Buenos Aires in the San Jose de Yunguyo neighborhood in El Alto. He lives in a small apartment, which he rents with his wife, who will soon give birth, and his three-year-old son. He works as a master mechanic in a workshop in the same neighborhood. This loan will be used to purchase a paint compressor for painting vehicles, as the one he currently has is very old and nearly unusable. This is his first loan with Impro, the evaluation they carried out qualified him to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a paint compressor for vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
R. Dinara is the leader of this group. She was married at 20 and her life changed once dramatically – her family life didn't turn out as well as she had expected.  She planned to divorce her husband; however, they got accustomed to their circumstances and together started their own small business with 1,000 ($22) soms. Now their revenue per month is 10,000 - 11,000 ($225 - $250) soms. Soon after solving their family problems, Dinara bought a horse and cow and diversified her business. Now Dinara is 39, a fantastic mother of three children and a brilliant wife. Her eldest daughter, Jayna, 16, is a nice girl who is in 10th grade. Dinara also has a smart boy of 13, who is in 7th grade. And last, but not least, she has a cute little princess named Aydinay,a joyful 3-year-old who is the delight of her parents. Dinara's husband always helps her with selling. They both work at the market and sell flour, fodder and salt, considered to be the most useful and healthiest additives for cattle. This loan which they desire will be used for expanding their range of goods and opening a grocery store later, but their main purpose is to educate their children.

I. Svetlana is 56, a mother of four children and a wife. She works at the petrol station. Her husband transports passengers. Her eldest daughter, Aynura, 30, works at the candy shop; Gulnura, 22, is not working now; Kuban, 20, studies at the university, and Ayday is 14. With this loan, Svetlana will pay her son’s tuition.

S. Bahatgul is a heroic mother of four children and brave wife of her husband, who is 49. Aynura, her eldest daughter, works as a chef in a café, Her son, Aybek, works in Russia. Her youngest son, Altynbe, stays with his parents and helps them bake flat cakes. They began this business with 1,250 soms, but now they earn 15,000 soms per month. They want to get a loan to buy flour and coal for stock. Their plans are to marry their son and build a structure for the summer season in order to bake their flat cakes in comfort.

A. Rahat is single and dreams about marriage. Her plans are to buy a house and a car. She works in Bishkek as a masseur and earns 6,000 - 7,000 soms.  However, three years ago she started a little business with 3,0000 soms, where her mother, Rosa, sells vegetables. The profit from selling vegetables is 7,500 soms. She wants to get a loan to increase their sales circulation and to extend their assortment of goods.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to expand the range of goods and open a grocery store later

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma P. est mariée elle est âgée de 70 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu 7 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle Fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diouma P. is 70-years-old and married. She has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » loan group of TOULY for three and a half years and had seven prior successful experiences with loans. She runs a small commerce of seasonal fruit. The activity provides her with income that enables her to participate in improving the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Maria Fidelina,  tiene 55 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, junto a su esposo quien la apoyado en su larga vida para salir a delante, el trabaja como supervisor de la Alcaldía de Managua, en la colecta de basura y su negocio de Maria es la venta de productos Omnilife y  lotería la cual vende ambulante frente a la lotería una carretera bien concurrida ya que hay mucho trafico y movimiento de personas por que están los bancos enfrente lo cual le permite vender sus productos a si como sus clientes permanente que usan omnilife para una mejor salud. Con este préstamo comprara  lotería y omnilife que son caros para seguir aumentado su inventario en venta como la captación de nuevos clientes. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa aunque es de bloque falta ponerle el piso, pintarla, y por falta de dinero no ha hecho las mejoras ya que sus créditos que es la única manera de poder mejorar su vivienda lo ha invertido solo en su negocio para no descapitalizarse y mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas y poder sastifacer las necesidades diarias.
texts.en:
Maria Fidelina is 55 years old and has 3 children with her husband, who has supported her in her efforts to make progress. He works in Managua, supervising trash collection. Maria sells Omnilife products and lottery tickets on a busy street where there is much traffic and many pedestrians, because it is near the banks. This allows her to sell her products to her regular customers who use Omnilife to improve their health. With this loan she will purchase the Omnilife products and lottery tickets, which are expensive, in order to increase her sales inventory and gain new customers. She hopes to make improvements to her home, which still needs a floor and to be painted. With little money she has not been able to make these improvements, and these loans are the only way she can improve her home. She has invested solely in her business so as not to lose capital and in order to maintain balance in her sales and meet her day-to-day needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products and lottery tickets, to increase sales

loans.name: Cristo Viene 3&4 Group

texts.en:
Rosaline is the coordinator of her group, CriS. Viene (ChriS.is Coming), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, an area known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband and their child.

Rosaline is excited to be taking her firS.loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner. She plans to use this loan to inveS.in her business of selling used clothing by purchasing assorted used clothing that comes in bulk packages from places like the Salvation Army in the United States. She will use the profits to inveS.in her family in the short term by purchasing clothing and food for her child. Her long-term dream is to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Packages of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a foal for feeding and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: La señora Maria Andrea tiene 39 años de edad, madre soltera de  tres hijos, muy trabajadora desde su juventud ha trabajado en servicios domestico ya que no logro culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Es por eso tiene estudiando a sus hijos para que puedan culminar sus estudios. Para ella ha sido difícil sola poder hacer las mejoras de su vivienda pero ha ido poco a poco con la el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado mediante sus financiamientos ya que ahora con todo caro y ganando poco no se puede hacer una obra. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para poder hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás ya que su casa es de bloque pequeña pero el cuarto y la cocina es de zinc y viejo ya, el cual desea comenzar a construir y poder tener mejor comodidad como mejor higiene para esta obra comprara: bloques, arena, hierro, cemento para comenzar. Su meta es poder terminar toda su casa de concreto ya que la delincuencia asecha a diario. Esta motivada con los financiamiento que gracias a estos esta haciendo posible una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Andrea is 39 years old, a single, hard-working mother of three children. Since her youth she has worked in domestic services, since she did succeed in completing her schooling due to lack of economic resources. It is for this reason that she has her children studying, so that they can complete their schooling.

For her, it has been difficult to make improvements in her house by herself, but she has progressed little by little with the support that Afodenic has given her through her loans, since now, with everything expensive and her earning little, it isn't possible to do a project. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to make a room in the back part of her house. Since her small house is made of blocks but the room (to be replaced) and the kitchen are of zinc and are already old, what she wants is to begin building and to be able to have more comfort as well as better hygiene. For this project, she will buy blocks, sand, iron, and cement to begin. Her goal is to complete all of her house in concrete, since (with the present zinc construction of the room and the kitchen) she is on the watch for crime every day. She is motivated by the loans, thanks to which she is is able to make a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blocks, sand, iron and cement to begin construction of a room

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Protector 1 Group

texts.en:
Micheline is the coordinator of her group Jehova es Mi Protector (God is my protector), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, a city known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their child.

Micheline is excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling children's clothing and bedsheets by purchasing more merchandise for her ambulatory business. She will use the profits to pay her tuition, she is studying engineering at university. Her long term goal is to see both herself and her child become engineers. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing, sheets etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia VIOLETA. Pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 21 años. Y  trabaja vendiendo cerveza, ella tiene un depósito de cerveza y ahora con la inundación que sufrió la semana pasada la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia perdió un muro  de su depósito, ahora ella requiere l préstamo para poder arreglar el muro y comprar un poco de mercadería para seguir con su negocio que está en la carretera Cusco Arequipa..

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Violeta belongs to the community bank "Ricchary Purisun-Oropesa". She lives in the district of Oropesa within the municipality of Cusco, 30 minutes from the imperial city of the Incas. Violeta is 40 years old, a single mother and has a son aged 21 years. She sells beer for a living and has a small beer-selling shop. However, the floods last week in Cusco caused one of the walls of the shop to collapse, and Violeta needs a loan in order to fix the wall and to purchase a little merchandise to help her business along. Her shop is located on the Cusco-Arequipa highway. Violeta is grateful for such an opportunity to improve her business. She is committed to the terms and agreements of the loan and to timely repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix a wall and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Nilda Consuelo

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Nilda es docente jubilada y ahora se dedica a su negocio D. venta D. comestibles en su domicilio. Nilda alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención D. su pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. La socia nos cuenta que acomodo una habitación D. su domicilio para expender sus productos. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nilda requiere el préstamo para comprar más  azúcar y útiles escolares.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Nilda pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old, married and has three children. Nilda is retired and now dedicates her time to selling groceries in her home. Nilda divides her time between her domestic responsibilities and her small grocery store. Nilda uses a room in her house to serve as an expansion of her store. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and it has been very successful thanks to the hard work and determination she puts in to it. Nilda needs a loan to buy more sugar and educational/school stationery material. Nilda expresses thanks for the opportunity given to her and is committed to the loan agreements. Nilda belongs to the community bank "Inti" from the Arariwa Association. ('Inti' is a Quechan word meaning 'sun' in English.)

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs the loan to buy more sugar and educational stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Tursun's Group

texts.en:
In general, women are considered stronger and more responsible than men are and their attitude to life is stable even in difficulties. Here is a story about one woman, another example of braveness and self–confidence whom everyone really can respect. Not far from Naryn, which is one of beautiful and mountainous towns in Kyrgyzstan, there is a little village, Kochkor, which is famous for its salt. Her name is S. Tursun, a leader of her group. She is a 64-year-old widow. She lost her husband in her early age; however, she has raised two children by herself. Her daughter is 12 and she goes to the local school. Her son is 37. He graduated from the university and now helps his mother fatten and then sell sheep. About 10 years ago after her husband's death she decided to move on, because she could not just give up the future of her children and let the cruel life decide what to do with them. So she bought five sheep to fatten and then to sell. She was successful and continues that business. Now their revenue per month is 5,000 ($113) soms. The life is, of course, better than before and she is planning to expand her business and buy a car in the future. She wants a loan of 5,000 soms. She will use it to buy two another lambs.  

A. Asel is 40 and she is married. She has a daughter who is 11. Her daughter is in fourth grade. Her son who is 10 years old is a smart guy who also studies. He is in third grade. Her husband works as a builder whose salary per month is 5,000 soms. About six years ago, she started a little business where she sells cattle in the local market. They are building a new house, which will be finished in the future. However, they want get a loan to buy four small cattle to breed, because cattle sell well in the market right now. 

A. Elmira is 45 and has a daughter who is 16. Her daughter helps her mother after school. Her husband works as a builder and earns 5,000 soms per month. Seven years ago, A. Elmira began a business. She sells products that are used daily. She started with 25,000 soms and now her profit is 7,000 soms per month. She already increased her turnover and improved her family's well being. With her loan, she wants to buy 100 kg of sugar, different cereals, vegetable oil and daily use goods. 

K. Musa is a 56-year old man whose wife is on a pension. He is going to expand his business by increasing his livestock. He has two children, but they live separately. He resells cattle in the market. He began this business three years ago with 18,000 soms and now he earns 3000 soms. With the loan. he wants to buy a bull to sell.
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two lambs

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, an area known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling work boots, women's shoes, assorted clothing and perfumes by purchasing merchandise to sell in her ambulatory business. She will use the profits to invest in food for her family and shoes for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy boots, shoes, clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia VICTORIA. Pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 6 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene una tienda abarrotes, y la inundación de la semana pasada que Cusco sufriese, se llevó sus cultivos de tierra, ella tenía maíz, también las paredes de su tienda están remojadas por el agua y teme que su casa se venga abajo, ahora desea seguir trabajando para mejorar su situación, ella agradece que en su caso los daños sean pocos frente a otros vecinos y a otras provincias de Cusco que lo perdieron absolutamente todo, el préstamo que la socia solicita lo invertirá en mercadería y refacción de su vivienda.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Victoria, is a member of the communal bank “Ricchary Purisun – Oropesa.” She lives in the district of Oropesa, in the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the imperial city. Our member is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children, ages 19,15, and 6. Our member alternates her time between doing her housework and her retail business. She has a grocery store and the storm that Cusco suffered last week carried away what she had planted – corn. It also soaked the walls of her store and she’s afraid that her house will fall down. She would like to keep working to improve her situation. She is grateful that, in her case, the damage wasn’t as much as that of some of her neighbors, and in some of Cusco’s other provinces where people lost absolutely everything. She will invest the loan money in merchandise and to fix up her home. She is grateful for, and values, the opportunity offered her in this way. At the same time, she promises to comply with the payment schedule of her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs a loan to  stock her business that was affected by the storm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  RAQUEL, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año; nuestra socia es ama de casa y también alternando las actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella vende cuyes, al por mayor y menor, la socia cría cuyes los engorda y luego los vende, la socia tenía cerca de 700 cuyes y se han procreado y ahora necesitan alimento más que nunca porque son gazapos (bebes), ella tenía un terreno, en el cual ella sembró alfa alfa (es un vegetal que contiene proteinas y sirve de alimento a los conejos), la socia proveía a sus animales alfa alfa de este terreno pero la semana pasada, llovió en 24 horas lo que correspondía a 1 mes de lluvias y 11 provincias de la ciudad del Cusco fueron inundadas, dejando graves daños, está zona no fue tan arrasada pero igual sufrió pérdidas económicas. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar alfalfa que es la comida de sus cuyes, la inundación se llevó el terreno de nuestra socia que tenía alfalfa ahora ella debe comprar el alimento a sus cuyes para seguir vendiéndolos.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our group member, Raquel, belongs to the "Ricchary Purisun-Oropesa" community bank. She lives in the district of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the capital city of Cuzco. She is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 4 and 1 year old. She is a housewife and alternates the activities of the home with working in a business. She sells guinea pigs in bulk and in smaller quantities. She raises the guinea pigs, fattens them, and later sells them. She has around 700 guinea pigs and they have reproduced and now she needs more food than ever for the babies. She has a plot of land where she planted alfalfa (a vegetable that can serve as food for rodents and other animals). She has always provided for her animals from this land but last week it rained very unexpectedly, and in 24 hours they got the equivalent of 1 month of rainfall. Eleven regions of the city flooded, leaving behind a lot of damage. This region was not as demolished, but it still suffered economic loss. Our member needs the loan to be able to buy alfalfa to feed to her guinea pigs. The flood that harmed the city of Cuzco carried away the alfalfa she had planted on her land and now she needs to buy food for her guinea pigs to keep selling them. She is thankful and values the opportunity given to her, and she promises to finish paying off the debt at the established rate.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pig food, as a flood carried away her alfalfa crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local rice in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en León, el señor Carlos L. se dedica arduamente a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Él es muy esforzado y ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda porque ha estado en malas condiciones y es por esta razón que está solicitando un crédito con el fin de mejorar dichas condiciones de su vivienda ya que le ha servido también para alquiler de algunas actividades porque tiene un espacio amplio donde se pueden realizar actividades festivas u otras y por esta razón debe de mejorarla y principalmente por brindarle un mejor lugar de vida a su familia. 
Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para dar lugar al mejoramiento y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos L. works hard every day to provide support for his home. He lives in El Sauce in León. He always makes an effort to improve and has decided to invest in home improvements because his house is in poor condition. He is requesting funding to do the needed repairs because he has also been able to rent out a large space he has in his house that is appropriate for events like parties and other activities. This is an incentive to improve the space but primarily it's to improve his family's living quarters. He hopes to be granted the loan so that he can improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: María Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora María Lisset R. es una dama muy trabajadora, soltera y con una hija en edad escolar el cual ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez ya que ha sabido brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias a su pequeño.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillo, arena u cemento porque está iniciando el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones pero al mejorarla tiene la oportunidad de brindarle un mejor local y un techo digno donde vivir a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Lisset R. is a very hard-working single lady with a school age daughter. She plays the role of father and mother at the same time and has known how to provide for the needs of her little one. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials like bricks, sand, and cement because she is beginning to make improvements to her home as it has been in poor condition. Improving it will allow her to provide a better home and roof over the head of her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Oscar René

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, el señor Oscar F. se ha destacado por tener su propio negocio de servicio de molino el que es atendido por el mismo y brinda el servicio de molino para moler maíz, carne, cacao, entre otros ofreciéndolo a los pobladores del caserío de San Ramón y San José que es cerca donde él vive.

Está solicitando un crédito para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas de moler y así continuar brindando un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the El Sauce region in León, Mr. Oscar F. has stood out by having his own business by working as a miller, and he provides a miller's services to grind corn, meat, and cocoa, among other things, and offers these services to the neighboring people in the villages of San Ramón and San José, which are close to where he lives. He is asking for a loan to perform maintenance on his grinding mills to be able to continue providing excellent service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenence for mills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Inés Verónica

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce, la señora Inés Veronica ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque está comprometida con el bienestar de sus tres hijos en edades escolares. Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora ya que desde hace 24 años se desempeña como maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad.
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros para llegar a culminar su obra y así sentirse satisfecha por haber logrado este gran trabajo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce, Mrs. Inés Verónica has begun to improve the condition of her house, since she is committed to the wellbeing of her 3 children, all of school age. She has stood out for being very hard-working since 24 years ago, when she began to teach students at primary level in a small community school. The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, and blocks, among others, to carry to conclusion her building effort, and thus, to feel satisfied for having achieved this grand task.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO IMPROVE HER HOUSE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: Marie Louise D. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne 1 depuis 2002 et y a bénéficié de 16 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Son objectif est de développer un petit commerce de citron, huile de palme, de balais et de poissons séchés. cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Marie Louise D. is a 49-year old woman who is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village bank in Sainte Anne since 2002 and has had 16 loans which she has repaid on a regular basis. Her objective is to build up a small business selling lemons, palm oil, brooms and dried fish. This business earns her sufficient profits to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run an income-generating business

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es:
La actividad de esta señora Aura Guardián consiste en la venta de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, sorgo, los cuales los adquiere en las diferentes comarcas del municipio de El Sauce para venderlos a los dueños de las pulpería al por mayor vendidos en sacos grandes.
Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los granos básicos y es por este motivo que está solicitando un crédito para adquirirlos y así continuar comercializándolos para obtener los ingresos de su hogar y así bendecir a su familia con el sustento de cada día.
texts.en:
Aura Guardián’s activity consists of selling basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum. She gets them in different regions in the El Sauce municipality. She sells them wholesale in large sacks to the owners of the mini-markets. She currently needs to invest in the purchase of basic grains. That is why she is asking for a loan to get them and continue selling them. This is to get income for her home and to bless her family with their daily sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains

loans.name: Brenda Lisset

texts.es: Brenda tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Este no es primer financiamiento que obtiene, por lo que ha sido algo muy importante en su vida para el desarrollo de su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, todos los días por la mañana elle recorre los diferentes lugares que tiene que visitar para ofrecer sus productos. Ella es un ejemplo a seguir para muchas mujeres que no tienen un trabajo estable para perseverar sus sueños. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, desodorantes y pinturas de uñas. El sueño de ella ha sido establecer una tienda en la que ofrezca una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Brenda is 33 years old and has spent 15 years in this business. She has received other loans in the past that have been a very important part of her life in that they helped develop her business. She sells cosmetics. Brenda is young and very active and dynamic. She likes to work and every morning she travels around to the various locations she sells her products. She sets an example for many women who don't have a steady job to go after their dreams. Brenda will use this loan as capital for her business to buy creams, perfumes, deodorants and nail polish. Her dream is to establish a store that offers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business captial

loans.name: Arlen María

texts.es:
Arlen G. es una dama muy trabajadora que se desempeña como maestra de primaria en una  escuela a unos 15 km del municipio de El Sauce, donde tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor porque siempre le ha gustado enseñar a los niños.

Ella ha iniciado a construir su casa de habitación porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ella está comprometida con el bienestar de su hijo en edad escolar y por ende debe de llevar a cabo la tarea de construcción de vivienda. Para ello está acudiendo a Ceprodel con el fin de recibir un crédito el que será otorgado para la  compra de los materiales de construcción y así suplir la necesidad a su hijo de tener un techo digno.
texts.en:
Arlen G. is a very hard-working lady who works as a primary teacher in a school that is 15 kilometers from the El Sauce municipality. She has done this work for eight years because she has always liked teaching children. She has started to build her house because it has been in bad condition. She is committed to the well being of her school age child, and she therefore needs to get working on the construction. She is coming to Ceprodel to get a loan to buy the construction materials. This way she will provide her son with a decent roof over his head.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Jaime Fernando

texts.es:
Jaime Márquez de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos en su casa, su esposa le ayuda en la zapatería, con ella tiene 3 hijos de 17, 14, 5 años estudiando.

Jaime trabajaba como empleado en una zapatería poco a poco reunió dinero para comparase las maquinas, suelas, goma y fibra.

Ahora Jaime tiene una zapatería en la que trabaja con dos empleados y su esposa desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días, arregla y hace zapatos. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tacos, fibra, goma para tener más implementos en su trabajo. En el futuro quiere expandir su taller con una sucursal.
texts.en:
Jaime Márquez, 42, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway. His house has all the basic utilities. His wife helps him in his shoe shop. They have three children, 17, 14, and 5 years old; all three are students. Jaime used to work as an employee in a shoe shop. Gradually, he saved enough money to buy the machinery, soles, adhesive and threads. Now, Jaime has a shoe shop where he works with two employees and his wife from 8am until 7pm every day; he repairs and manufactures shoes. One of the difficulties he faces is the high crime rate in the area where he lives. He wants to use the funds to buy heels, thread and adhesive in order to have more work tools. In the future, he would like to expand and open a branch of his shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Heels, threads, adhesive.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Julia tiene la edad de 39 años, es una persona muy luchadora a pesar de n tener todas las condiciones necesarias en sus vivienda, busca la manera de ganarse el pan de cada día.  Doña Julia se dedica a la actividad económica como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella siempre mantiene ese espíritu emprendedor ya que necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta las diferentes comarcas y también para la compara de cerdos. Los sueños de Julia son de establecer un restaurante que sea propio.
texts.en:
Julia, 39, is a real fighter. Even though she doesn't have all the basic conditions in her home, every day she looks for ways to earn her living. Julia butchers pigs. She has been in this line of work for over 16 years. She always kept her enterprising spirit in play because she had to meet household expenses, so she decided to go into this business. She is asking for funding to be able to move to the various districts and to buy pigs. Julia's dream is to set up her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Sarai Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarai está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es  María José Gomez quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Está señora de 32 años inicio vendiendo gaseosa pero ella necesitaba un negocio que le brindara mayores ganancias es así que gracias a los créditos empieza a comercializar cosméticos y accesorios.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Melba del Socorro B. quien vende helados, frescos y hielo, María Aydee M. vende gaseosas, frescos y comida los fines de semana y María Inecilia Elizabebeth S. tiene una pulperia.
texts.en:
The Sarai group is made up of four hard-working women. One of them is María José Gomez, 32, who is the group coordinator. She started out selling soft-drinks but she needed a business that produced higher profits. Thanks to the financing she was able to go into cosmetics and accessories sales. The other members of the group are: Melba del Socorro B., who sells frozen treats, ice and frescos (smoothie-like fruit drink), María Aydee M., who sells soft-drinks, frescos and prepared food on the weekend, and María Inecilia Elizabebeth S., who has a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GUADALUPE, pertenecen al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en la provincia de  Oropesa situado en el departamento de Cusco a 30 minutos en expreso local.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos de 18, 17, 12, 10, 5 años de edad, la socia vive en el distrito de Saylla y tiene su negocio de venta de panes en Oropesa, la socia alternando con sus actividades del hogar puso un stand en junto al paradero de Oropesa de venta de panes, ella misma prepara los panes y los vende en este stand, nuestra socia está ahora muy triste porque debido a las intensas lluvias que sufrió Cusco la semana pasada, ella tuvo la pérdida de su stand en Oropesa, y su casita en Saylla está a punto de caer, las paredes del primer piso se remojaron a tal punto que está inclinándose la casa, nuestra socia pide el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para seguir elaborando panes hasta poder reunir un fondo y empezar de nuevo, ella está ahora alojada con una compañera de trabajo.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guadalupe belongs to the Ricchary Purisun Oropesa village bank and lives in the Oropesa province, located about 30 minutes away from Cusco. She is 44 years old, a single mother, with 5 children who are 18, 17, 12, 10, and 5 years old. She lives in the Saylla district and runs a business selling bread in Oropesa. She runs her business while also taking care of her home and family expenses. She put up a stand next to a busstop in Oropesa where she sells the bread that she makes. She is very sad because, due to the heavy rains in Cusco last week, she lost her stand in Oropesa and her house in Saylla is about to fall down. The walls on the first floor got so wet that the house is leaning to one side. She is seeking a loan in order to buy ingredients to keep making bread and to eventually put together enough money to start over. Currently she lives with a friend from work. She is very grateful for the opportunity she will receive through this loan and she commits to pay it back in the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Nindiri Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nindiri está integrado por Carla Yahosca L. A., Rosa Mireya M., Domingo Humberto M. y Roberto Antonio H.. Ellos son muy trabajadores, esforsados y dedicados. 

La joven de 21 años Carla Yahosca L. A. se dedica al comercio de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace dos años. Con ello apoya a su compañero de vida y le proporciona una mjor vida a sus dos pequeños de 3 y 2 años de edad.

Mientras Rosa Mireya M. vende enchiladas, Domingo Humberto M. vende varios productos desde leña, frijoles, cigarros, arroz entre otros y Roberto Antonio H. tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The Nindiri group is made up of Carla Yahosca L. A., Rosa Mireya M., Domingo Humberto M. and Roberto Antonio H.. They are very hard-workers and are dedicated to their businesses. Carla Yahosca Lopez Aleman, a young 21 year old woman, has worked selling clothes as a traveling saleswoman for the past 2 years. With the money she earns, she is able to help support her husband and provide a better life for her two small children who are 3 and 2 years old. Meanwhile, Rosa Mireya M. sells enchildadas; Domingo Humberto M. sells various products like firewood, beans, cigars, rice, etc., and Roberto Antonio Hernandez runs a small store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es: La joven Nuris tiene 25 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada para mejorar su negocio cada día, casada y con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como conductor en el mercado oriental, junto han construido su casa de concreto pero le falta el repello, poner piso ya que es de tierra y quisiera poder hacer estas mejoras pronto para dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes ya que llega todo tipo de cliente por que su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos como también frutas y verduras. Inicio este negocio con dinero que ahorro de su trabajo por que se fue a trabajar a España en servicios domestico para poder ganar y terminar de hacer su casa como traer dinero, fueron días difíciles por que estaba sin su familia, y trabajando mucho pero se siente contenta por haber logrado el objetivo ya que aquí en nuestro país hay mucho desempleo y como domestica es poco lo que se gana y se trabaja demasiado, que por mucha necesidad lo hacemos. Con este préstamo quiere comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, jabón, lácteos, carne, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, pan, productos enlatados como: sardinas, atún, chorizo entre otros para aumentar las ventas y poder ir ahorrando para poner el piso. Gracias a estos préstamos puede aumentar su inventario el cual esta muy contenta por los beneficios.
texts.en:
Nuris is 25 years old and is a very hard-working woman who puts forth a lot of effort to improve her business day by day. She is married with two children; her husband is a driver in the eastern market and together they have been able to build a good, concrete home but they have not yet plastered the walls nor put in a floor. They would like to make these improvements soon to provide a better environment for the customers of their small store which they run out of their home. They sell a variety of products including fruit and vegetables. They started the business with money she saved from her prior work; she went to work in Spain as a housekeeper to earn more money to finish her home but it was a difficult time for her since she was away from her family and she worked long hours. Nonetheless, she is happy that she accomplished her goal because in our country there is a lot of unemployment and housekeepers don't earn much especially given how long they work but people do it because they have to. With this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, soap, dairy products, beef, chicken, sodas, juices, snacks, bread, and canned goods like sardines, tuna, chorizo, etc. in order to increase her sales and keep saving for her home. Thanks to these loans, she is able to increase her inventory; she is very grateful for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, beef, chicken in order to increase sales and provide better service to her customers

loans.name: G.s . Los Cocos Group

texts.es: Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela conforman el grupo solidario Los Cocos. Cada una tiene diferentes actividades económicas. Maria de se dedica a la venta de leche, Eulalia a la venta de tortillas, Cristina a ofrecer los servicios de costura, Rosario a la venta de leche y leña y Ángela a un taller de costura. Son personas muy trabajadoras y con muchos intereses de salir adelante con cada uno de sus negocios, cada una busca la manera de sufragar los gastos del hogar. Todas tienen muchos sueños y esperanzas que desean cumplir pues todas son madres y quieren proporcionarles a sus hijos sus estudios, ya que todas ellas trabajan fuertemente todos los días. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario and Ángela make up the Los Cocos communal bank. Each has her own commercial activity. Maria sells milk, Eulalis sells tortillas, Cristina is a seamstress, Rosario sells milk and firewood and Ángela has a sewing shop. They are very hard-working people who are very interested in gettting ahead in life through their businesses. Each one seeks ways to meet her household expenses. All of them have dreams and hopes that they hope will come to pass because they are all mothers and want to provide their children with an education because each of them works very hard every day. The funding will be used to buy raw materials and supplies for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, de 19 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Mayra (18), y aunque es muy joven le sobran ganas de progresar en la vida.

Cuando era muy pequeño observaba atentamente a su abuela cómo atendía en su panadería, y esa imagen se le quedó grabada en la memoria; tanto así que al pasar los años cuando tuvo que pensar en invertir en un negocio no dudó en implementar en su casa un taller panadero.
Desde entonces, junto a dos ayudantes prepara toda clase de panes y luego con tres vendedores los reparte por las calles en varios triciclos. 
A Julio le gusta mucho su negocio porque es rentable, le permite pagarle a sus trabajadores y aun así ahorra; pero lo que no le gusta es que salir a vender, es agotador, pero vale la pena el esfuerzo comenta. Su trabajo lo realiza durante toda la mañana y posteriormente de 7 a 10 de la noche.
Para el futuro, tiene planes de estudiar educación, además de instalar una panadería en un local adecuado, donde también pueda vender los panes que elabora.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que le brindado su confianza. Con el dinero que solicita comprará varios sacos de harina, aceite y manteca, ingredientes para seguir preparando sus deliciosos panes.
texts.en:
Julio, 19, lives in his own house with his partner, Mayra, 18. Although very young, he doesn't lack the will to progress in life. When he was still a little boy, he would watch how his grandmother tended to her bakery. That image stayed engraved in his memory, so much so that, as time passed, when it came time for him to invest in a line of work, he didn't hesitate in setting up a bakery in his house. Since then, together with two assistants, he makes all kinds of bread and then, with three salespeople, he distributs it throughout the streets on several three-wheeled vehicles. Julio likes his work very much because it is profitable; it allows him to pay his workers and still have some savings. What he doesn't like about the job is having to go out to sell; it's exhausting, but worth it. He works all morning and then again from 7 to 10 at night. For the future, he plans to study education and to set up a bakery in a proper setting where he can sell the bread he makes. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay his loan in a timely fashion because he doesn't want to disappoint the people who have placed their trust in him. He will use the funds to buy several sacks of flour, cooking oil, lard and other ingredients needed to prepare his delicious bread.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread-baking ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Sheila Valesca

texts.es: La joven Sheila tiene 21 años de edad, soltera y vive junto con sus padres, en un barrio que se llama Tenderi, como toda joven con deseo de superación sus padres an apoyado para que culmine sus estudios, en la carrera de Administración de Empresa. Pero se le ha presentado problemas económicos, es por eso busco un trabajo el cual se le hizo difícil al principio encontrar, pero lo encontró en un banco dando practicas en donde no ganaba un salario fijo lo cual solo le daban un viático, lo cual se paso a estudiar los Domingos ya su ultimo año, aunque difícil ya se ayudaba con los pasajes y los estudio. Por la necesidad busca empleo en otra parte y encuentra en donde hace diversas actividades, como atención al cliente, archivos, procesa información y le  pagan mejor ya que esta comenzando, lo cual espera poder ubicarse fija. Con esta solicitud que hace es para poder entrar al curso de la defensa y pagar los gastos de titilación para poder optar  aun futuro de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, en donde quiere ayudar a sus padres y comenzar a comprar sus cosas personales. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el dinero en efectivo para optar a la titilación y lo hizo posible.
texts.en:
Sheila, 21, is single and lives with her parents in a neighborhood called Tenderi. Like all young persons wanting to do well in life, her parents have supported her efforts to complete her professional studies in Business Administration. However, financial obstacles forced her to look for work. It was difficult at first. However, she found work in a bank as a trainer. She received no salary for this work, only per-diems. She moved her class schedule to Sundays during her final year. Although this was very difficult, she was preparing for finals and she studied. Economic need pushed her into looking for work elsewhere. She found a position doing various activities like: customer service, filing, data processing. She's paid better, although she's just in training, but she hopes to become permanent. She is requesting funding to pay the fees for her thesis defense and her graduation costs so that she can have better employment opportunities in the future. She wants to help out her parents and start to buy herself some personal items. She thanks the institution for making this funding possible because it made her graduation possible when she did not have the funds available to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her Business Administration thesis defense and graduation expenses

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento QUERER ES PODER, viene trabajando con nuestra Institución desD. el 2007, este banco se caracteriza por ser antiguo,la mayoria D. las socias se dedica al comercio  en la venta D. bolsas nylon , plásticos, CDs, pasankalla, frutas,pantalones,embutidos y otras socias tienen tienda y pensión. 

La Sra. SALOME ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, ella se constituye en jefe D. su hogar ya que se encuentra separada D. su esposo y tiene que mantener a la familia ella sola, con el prestamo comprara por cantidad pasankalla para que aumenten sus pedidos, también ampliara su tienda diversificando sus productos, con estos negocios tiene pensado ahorrar para los estudios D. sus hijos.

La Sra. JENNY Es una nueva socia que tiene como negocio una tienda, con el prestamo comprara material escolar y D. esta manera aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. CONSUELO ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, ella tiene una familia numerosa, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. embutidos, con el prestamo aumentado su producción y sus ingresos D. su familia.  

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas qu trabajan duro para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y sacar a su familia adelante en muchos casos solas.

El credito lo utilizaran para la compra D. mercaderia e incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
The QUERER ES PODER communal bank has been collaborating with our institution since 2007. It is one of the oldest communal banks; most of its members sell nylon bags, plastics, CDs, pasankalla (a variety of quinoa), fruits, pants, canned meats; others have grocery stores or sell prepared meals. SALOME is the group president. She is head of her household since she is separated from her husband. She must support her family alone. She will use the loan to buy pasankalla to increase her orders and she will also expand her store diversifying her stock inventory. She hopes this business will produce enough to be able to pay for her children’s education. JENNY is a new member; she has a store. She will use the funds to buy school supplies to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. CONSUELO is group treasurer. She has a large family and she cures meats for sale. She will use the funds to increase production and her family’s income. All of the members are responsible and dynamic; they work hard to help meet household expenses and get their families ahead in life, in many cases, alone. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and increase their working capital. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La sra. Wilma es una cliente antigua, muy puntual y responsable de nuestra institución, ella se dedica a las manualidades, elabora trabajos de pintura en tela, bordados, y muñecos en soft, es muy conocida por la zona y por eso tiene bastanates pedidos de manteles juegos de baño y demás adornos, para las fiestas de fin de año tuvo pedidos de adornos navideños y estuvo también distando clases. Tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes y cada uno ya tiene su familia, pero siempre están con ella, vive en la zona de Pampahasi en una casa en alquiler, en la misma casa vive también su hija, por lo que ella está con sus nietos. 
El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para dictar clases de pintura en madera.						
						
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wilma is a long-standing, punctual and responsible client of our institution. She makes handicrafts. She paints on fabric, does embroidery, makes plush toys. She is very well-known in her neighborhood so she has many orders for tablecloths, bathroom sets and other home decorations. At the end of the year festivities, she had many orders for Christmas decorations and she also taught some crafts classes. She has three children who are all independent and have their own families. However, they are always with her. She lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood in a leased house. Her daughter also lives in the same house so Wilma cares for her grandchildren. She will use the funds to buy supplies for her paint-on-wood crafts classes. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly, de 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y su pequeño hijo Justin (3), en una populosa zona de la ciudad de Lima.
Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar duro, y cuando tuvo que salir adelante con su hijo sola, no dudó en hacerlo. Por esta razón desde hace dos años trabaja en una inmobiliaria vendiendo terrenos y le va muy bien, ya que su sueldo bueno.
