Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual ofrece a sus amigos y vecinos, quienes le hacen pedidos de acuerdo a la temporada. Con este negocio también obtiene buenas ganancias porque ella se preocupa en comprar y ofrecer prendas de buena calidad y de atractivos modelos, los cuales deja a sus clientes al crédito, para posteriormente pasar a cobrarles en sus casas.
Así pasa sus días Nataly, cuidando a su hijo y trabajando muy duro para brindarle lo mejor; por ello planea en el futuro instalar una tienda de ropa en un local de algún centro comercial.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que pagará puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con su grupo de trabajo. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y le faltaba el capital para adquirirlos.
texts.en:
Nataly is 22 years is old and she lives with her parents and her 3 year-old son, Justin, in a densely populated neighborhood of Lima. From the time she was very young, she learned to work hard. When she had to provide for her son, alone, she had no doubts about doing it. She has been working for the past two years at a real estate company selling land. The job is going well for her and she earns a good income. Along with this work, she also sells clothing, which she offers to her friends and neighbors, who make orders according to the season. She also has good earnings with this job because she is careful to offer clothing that is good quality and attractive. She sells to her customers on credit and then comes by their houses to collect payments. This is how Nataly spends her days, taking care of her son and working very hard to provide for him. To this end, she has future plans to open a clothing store in a shopping center. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva Field Partner] and she is sure she will be able to pay all of her payments punctually because she doesn’t want to disappoint her loan group. She plans to use the requested loan to buy a larger amount of clothing because she has several current orders but she didn’t have the capital to purchase the clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí, de 23 años, es una joven muy emprendedora que vive al lado de sus padres, su hermana y sus dos pequeños hijos: José (7) y Adrián (5).
Desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio, cada día se despierta muy temprano para realizar la venta ambulante de diversos artículos, tales como útiles de escritorio, juguetes, adornos, etc. No tiene un lugar fijo, pero sí tiene muchas ganas de trabajar para salir adelante, esta actividad la hace sola, ya que sus hijos estudian y su madre se encuentra enferma.
Lo difícil es tener que caminar largas horas bajo el intenso sol, pero vende bien y esto le genera las ganancias que le permiten mantener a sus hijos y a su madre. Por otro lado, sabe que puede llegar a obtener lo que quiera con mucho esfuerzo; y como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro desea instalar una librería en su casa y así ofrecer sus útiles en un lugar estable y con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá en el pago puntual de todas sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería en útiles para la campaña escolar que empieza en estos meses, sabe que las ganas de salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia es el motor que la impulsa cada día.
texts.en:
Noemí is 23 years old and is a very enterprising young woman who lives alongside her parents, sister and her two young children: José (7) and Adrián (5). For the past two years she has made a living as a merchant. Every morning she gets up very early in the morning to carry out her ambulatory sales of diverse items, such as office supplies, toys, decorations, etc. She doesn't have a fixed site, but she has a strong desire to keep working and making headway. She does her job alone since her kids are in school and her mother is ill. The most difficult part is having to walk many hours under the intense sun, but she sells well and it earns the income that allows her to provide for her children and mother. She knows that she can achieve what she wants with a lot of hard work, and, as an enterprising young woman, her wish is to set up a bookstore out of her home so she can offer her products in a more stable site under much calmer conditions. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is certain she will comply with all her payments because she has a strong desire to keep making progress. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase more merchandise, specifically school supplies for the upcoming months. She knows that the desire to keep making headway for her family's well being is what drives her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda se dedica a la venta de materiales escolares ya que ella tiene un librería - bazar en la zona de Alto San Antonio. Es una persona muy alegre y amable, y es muy conocida en su vecindario. Sus amigos y familiares cuentan que es una persona muy dedicada a su familia y su trabajo. Ella tiene dos hijas, una de unos 16 años y la otra de 4 años. Viven en la Av. Mujía. 

La señora Yolanda tiene, además, un trabajo de medio tiempo como profesora en el Colegio Mariaca. Mientras ella enseña en el colegio su padre es quien le ayuda en atender la librería. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que su mayor anhelo es poder hacer crecer su negocio y de esa manera ayudar a que sus hijas tengan una buena educación. 

El destino del credito sera para la compra de material escolar ya que pronto comenzaran las clases en los distintos colegios y ella quiere surtir su libreria.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Yolanda makes a living selling school supplies out of her bookstore-bazaar in the area of Alto San Antonio. She is a very happy and friendly person and is very well-known in her neighborhood. Her friends and relatives say she is a person who is very dedicated to her family and her work. Yolanda has two daughters, ages 16 and 4. Furthermore, Yolanda works part time as a teacher at a local school. While she is teaching at the school, her father helps her tend to the bookstore. Yolanda is a very hard-working person, and her main goal is to be able to grow her business and in this way help her children get a good education. She plans to use the loan to purchase more school supplies since classes at the distinct local schools will be starting soon and she wants to stock her store. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in authorizing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Vida Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo Vida y Esperanza está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jovenes han salido a ganarse el pan de cada día.  Rosa Amanda C. R. en el 2004 invirtió unos ahorros que tenia en la venta de leche agria actualmente gracias a los préstamos comercializa variedad de productos lacteos. Mientra sus compañeras Ángela del Carmen A. de 50 años tiene una pequeña y humilde venta y Vida Luz C. A. tiene una tortilleria.
texts.en:
The Vida y Esperanza group is made up of three, hard-working women who have been earning their livelihood since they were very young. In 1004, Rosa Amanda C. R. invested some of her savings to sell sour milk. Currently, thanks to the loans, she sells a variety of dairy products. Meanwhile, her fellow member Ángela del Carmen A., 50, has a small, unassuming store and Vida Luz C. A. has a tortilla shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Máximo (58). Ellos tienen 5 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno de ellos, Yaniré (25), su esposo y su pequeño hijo.

Desde hace 8 años Olga se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado. En este negocio le va muy bien,  ya que tiene clientela fija que siempre le piden variedad y lo último de la moda. Su método de venta es al crédito, una vez llegado el plazo de pago, Olga visita a sus clientes en sus casas o trabajos. Por esta actividad obtiene las ganancias que le permiten ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel internacional, por los que también obtiene buenos dividendos.
Para el futuro tiene pensado instalar una tienda de ropa en un local estable para vender más tranquila y en un solo lugar; a su vez, desea descansar de tantas caminatas durante tantos años de su vida.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que será responsable y puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Olga tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en mercadería (ropa), ya que tiene muchos pedidos para el verano. También mandará construir el piso de su casa, que es donde ofrece su mercadería y quiere que proyecte una mejor imagen.
texts.en:
Olga, 58, lives in her own home with her life partner Máximo, 58. They have 5 children but only their daughter, Yaniré, 25, her husband and small son, live with them. For the past 8 years, Olga has sold clothing and footwear. She does well in this business because she has regular customers that always ask for the latest fashions and for variety. She sells on credit. When payments are due, Olga visits her customers in their homes or at their work. She makes enough profit to be able to help meet household expenses. She also sells beauty products of an internationally-known brand; this also produces good dividends. For the future, Olga plans to set up a clothing store in a stable setting so that she can sell more comfortably in only one place; she would like to rest from the innumerable walks she has undertaken over these years. This is her third loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be responsible and punctual with her payments. Olga plans to invest the money requested in more clothing because she has many orders placed for Summer. She will also have flooring installed in her house, which is where she conducts her sales, so that it will be more presentable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva, de 51 años, vive con su esposo Arzobiz (51) y sus 4 hijos; Tula (27), Lisbeth (23), Giovanna (17) y Julián (15), juntos habitan en su casa, que es propia.
Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en la tienda que acondicionó en su vivienda. El año pasado terminó de construir ese espacio de material noble, pues antes era de madera, ahora espera poder ampliar su tienda.
A Primitiva le gusta mucho realizar esta actividad porque es tranquila y muy cómoda, pues permanece en su hogar, además que le genera muy buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la familia. 
Su tienda abre sus puertas desde muy temprano, y cierra entrada la noche, generalmente atiende sola a sus clientes, pero durante los fines la apoyan sus hijos y ella puede descansar un poco. Lo que no le agrada del negocio es que no puede salir, porque debe atender todo el día para que las ventas no bajen. 
Para el futuro, quiere seguir mejorando su tienda y surtirla con mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual y responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará gran cantidad de mercadería para surtir su bodega, ya que quiere ampliarla para generarse mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 51, and lives with her husband, Arzobiz (51), and their 4 children: Tula (27), Lisbeth (23), Giovanna (17) and Julián (15), together in their own home. For the past year she has worked selling food products in a store that she set up in her home. Last year she finished building the area out of good materials, because before it was made of wood. Now she hopes to be able to enlarge her store. Primitiva likes this work because it’s quiet and very comfortable. She is able to stay home, and besides it brings in a good income that has helped her husband with the household expenses. She opens the doors very early, and closes up at night. Usually she waits on the customers herself, but on weekends, her children help her and she can rest a little. What she doesn’t like about the business is that she can’t go out, because she needs to take care of customers all day so that sales don’t drop. In the future she would like to improve her store and supply it with a larger quantity of products to offer the best to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual and responsible with each payment. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy more merchandise to supply her store, now that she wants to enlarge it to generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Rosalida

texts.es:
Rosalida, D. 45 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo Almir (47) y sus tres hijos; dos D. ellos jóvenes trabajadores que le ayudan en el sustento D. la casa y su último hijo Jean Pierre (8). Todos juntos habitan en su acogedora casa (propia).

Esta luchadora  mujer tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante, es por eso que siempre trabaja en diversas actividades. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. quesos que traía D. otras ciudades al interior del país; pero ahora decidió vender comida, por lo que desD. algunos meses atrás acondiciona un pequeño puesto afuera D. su casa para la venta D. salchipapas (plato compuesto D. salchichas y papas fritas)
Rosalida inicia este negocio a raíz D. que su hijo mayor le regaló un carrito salchipapero (móvil especializado para la preparación D. comida rápida). Sus platillos tienen mucha demanda entre sus asiduos comensales, y lo que le gusta es que con su trabajo obtiene sus propias ganancias y pueD. ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
En adelante, quiere ofrecer bebidas que acompañen sus salchipapas, en especial ahora por la época D. verano. 

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en cada una D. sus cuotas porque quiere acceder a más préstamos y así seguir progresando. Rosalida tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en abastecer su negocio con mayor cantidad D. ingredientes para sus platillos, así como D. debidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Rosalida is 45 years old and lives with her husband, Almir (47 years old), and their three children. Two of them work to help support the household and the youngest son, Jean Pierre (8 years old). They all live together in their charming house (which they own). This hardworking woman wants very much to get ahead, so she always works at various jobs. She used to sell cheese that she brought from cities in the interior of the country. Now she sells food, which is why a few months ago she set up a small stand outsiD. her house to sell salchipapas (sausage with French fries). Rosalida began this business because her oldest son gave her a cart from which to sell salchipapas (a cart that is maD. for the purpose preparing fast food). Her food is in high demand by her fellow diners. She likes the fact that with this job she can have her own income and help out with the household expenses. She would like to start offering drinks to go with her salchipapas, especially now that it’s the summer season. This is the first loan she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva Field Partner] and she promises to be punctual with each of her payments because she would like to receive more loans so she can continue to make progress in her business. Rosalida plans to use the money she is requesting to stock her business with a greater quantity of ingredients for the food she makes, and also to buy soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she prepares

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos; Manuel (13) y María (11) en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles tapizados; de muy joven aprendió este oficio de una prima que tenía un taller, empezó ayudándole y observando las técnicas hasta que pudo instalar su propio taller en su vivienda e independizarse.
En la actualidad elabora sillones tapizados de muy buena calidad, este trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de 5 personas, ella es la encargada de coser las telas y sus ayudantes de arman los muebles. Rosana considera que esta es una actividad muy rentable, ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pues cuenta con clientes fijos que le hacen grandes pedidos debido a la calidad y comodidad de sus muebles.
Aunque el negocio es cansado, le gusta, porque puede trabajar en la comodidad de su casa. Para el futuro tiene planeado contratar más personal, ya que a veces faltan manos para cumplir con todos los pedidos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, pues desea seguir siendo parte de su grupo. Rosana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más tela para el tapizado de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Rosana, 35, lives in her own house with her two children, Manuel (13) and María (11), in a densly populated neighborhood of Lima. For the last 6 years she has manufactured upholstered furniture. She learned this skill at a very young age from a cousin who had a workshop. She started off helping her and observing the techniques until she was able to set up her own workshop in her home and become independent. Currently she makes high-quality, upholstered armchairs. She has five helpers; she cuts and sews the fabric, her helpers build the furniture. Rosana feels that this is a very profitable business because it generates good profits; she has regular customers that place large orders with her thanks to the quality and comfort of her furniture. Although it is tiring work, she likes it because she can work in the comfort of her home. For the future, she plans to hire more staff because she sometimes doesn't have enough personnel to complete all the orders. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she wants to continue to form part of her group. Rosana plans to use the money to buy more fabric to upholster her furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to upholster her furniture.

loans.name: Los Cerros Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Cerros está integrado por Ana Clemencia A. de 47 años trabaja arduamente desde las 5:00am en que empiezan a llegar sus clientes a para hacer las compras del desayuno hasta la 9:00 pm.  Ella está contenta por como su negocio ha crecido y mejorado notablemente.
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Yesica R.  de 38 años la cual comenzó vendiendo repochetas en su casa  y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una fritanga y Martha R. de 29 años tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace siete años.
texts.en:
The "Los Cerros" (The Hills) Group consists of Ana Clemencia A., 47, who works arduously from 5 a.m., when her customers start arriving to buy their breakfasts, until 9 p.m. She is pleased because her business has grown and improved notably. Her fellow group members are Yesica R., 38, who started out selling snacks out of her home and little by little grew it until now she has a fried food stand; and Martha R., 29, who has had a small sewing shop for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, soap, detergent, meat, milk products, soft drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Señor De Mayo Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO DE SEÑOR DE MAYO SE COMPONE POR UNA MESA DIRECTIVA :

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SEÑORITA SUSY NACIO EN COCHABAMBA SE DEDICA A LA ATENCION DE UN PUNTO VIVA , QUE VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PAPAS  EN LA ZONA DE TAMBORADA BARRIO 1º DE MAYO; 

LA SECRETARIA  ES LA SEÑORA LAURA QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE SANDALIAS, COSMETICOS Y DE TEMPORADA DE LUNES A DOMINGO Y VIVE EN CASA DE ALQUILER EN LA ZONA DE TAMBORADA  BARRIO 1º DE MAYO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO Y SUS 2 HIJOS; 

LA  TESORERA ES LA SEÑORA DIANA  QUE SE DEDICA  A LA  VENTA DE COSMETICOS YA SE ENCUENTRA EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD DURANTE 2 AÑOS DE LUNES A SABADO VIVE EN CASA DE ALQUILER  EN LA ZONA DE TAMBORADA  BARRIO 1º DE MAYO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO Y SU HIJO, GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA CON CERO MORA , SE APOYA, COLABORA ENTRE ELLOS PARA QUE LA CUOTA ENTRE COMPLETA.

EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA DE MERCADERIA.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y DINAMICAS QU TRABAJAN DURO PARA AYUDAR EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE EN MUCHOS CASOS SOLAS.					
						
TODAS LAS SOCIAS ESTAN AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa Del Carmen tiene 59 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería y venta de verduras, por lo que hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, como es una pulpera, ella es una mujer muy responsable. Por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia, ya que tenía 3 hijos de los cuales tenía que brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de limones, huevos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, aguacate y naranjas.
texts.en:
Luisa Del Carmen is 59 years old and makes a living tending to her convenience store and selling vegetables, which she has been doing for more than four years. As a shopkeeper, Luisa is a very responsible person. She has always been concerned about improving her family's income because she has three children for whom she wants to provide an opportunity for an education. Currently she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, which she plans to use to purchase lemons, eggs, snacks, natural beverages, avocados and oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lemons, eggs, snacks, natural beverages, avocados and oranges

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  CATALINA, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de 16, 12, 9, 7, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tenía sus animalitos, ella se dedicaba a la compra y venta de animales como son: cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, solía comprar a los animalitos tiernos para hacerlos engordar y así una vez que alcanzasen el tamaño y peso buenos los vendiera, pero con la inundación que sufrió la ciudad del Cusco hace una semana casi, la socia perdió a todos sus animalitos, muchos de los que quedaban con vida se están enfermando y mueren a causa de la humedad y de los parásitos que está genera; nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir y comprar animalitos y volver a comprar jaulas para sus animales nuevos y los que aún pudo rescatar de las aguas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member CATALINA, belongs to the “ricchary purisun - oropesa” communal bank. She lives in the Oropesa district, within the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the imperial city.

Our member is 33 years old. She has 5 children who are 16, 12, 9, 7 and 5 years old. Our member alternates her household activities with her retail business. She had animals and she worked buying and selling of animals like: guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She usually bought young animals in order to raise them. Once they reached a good size and weight, she would sell them. However, with the flood that the city of Cusco suffered from, almost a week ago, the member lost all of her animals. The animals that are still living are getting sick and dying from the humidity and the parasites. Our member is requesting a loan in order to reinvest and buy animals and to buy cages for her new animals and those she can still save from the water.

She is grateful for and values the opportunity offered to her through this resource and she promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy animals because they were lost and died in last week's flood

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  CIRILA, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos los cuales cinco de ellos son mayores e independientes, tienen sus propias familias, la socia vive con su hijo de 23 años el cual aún recibe el apoyo de sus padres en la educación superior, nuestra socia es nueva dentro del banco comunal, ella se dedica a preparar panes, nuestra socia compra sus ingredientes en la provincia de Juliaca ubicada en el departamento de Puno, nuestra socia compra los ingredientes como la harina, levaduras, y otros, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar los diferentes panes  venderlos en la provincia de Oropesa.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the “Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa” community bank and lives in the district of Oropesa within the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the city. She is 49 years old, married and has six children, five of whom are grown up and have their own families. She lives with her 23-year-old son, who still receives support from his parents for his higher education. Cirila is new to her community bank. She makes a living baking breads. She buys her ingredients from the province of Juliaca, department of Puno, including flour, yeast and other items. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to bake different breads to sell in Oropesa. Cirila is grateful and values the opportunity made available from this medium and thus promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JUAN, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, El socio vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestro socio tiene 48 años de edad, El es casado con la socia Alejandrina, nuestro socio es de oficio taxista, pero también siempre que puede ayuda a su esposa a vender o a comprar los ingredientes para que ella elabore los panes, nuestro socio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo viven con ellos 3 de 25,23,19 años de edad, nuestro socio está solicitando el préstamo para poder ayudar a comprar a su esposa harina, manteca, levadura entre otros ingredientes, para así continuar con el negocio familiar.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa” community bank and lives in the district of Oropesa within the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the city. He is 48 years old and married to another member of the community bank, Alejandrina. Juan is a taxi driver, but he always helps out his wife when he can by buying ingredients for her to make bread or selling the product. Juan has five children, three of whom, ages 25, 23 and 19, live with him. He is requesting a loan to help buy flour, lard, yeast and other ingredients for his wife so they can continue the family business. Juan is grateful and values the opportunity made available through this medium, and thus promises to fulfill his payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his wife's bakery

loans.name: Lázaro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Lázaro Antonio E. G., es soltero tiene 26 años y vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, él se dedica a la albañilería y dentro de los mayores anhelos del señor esta la adquisición de un terreno en donde edificar su propia casa, dentro de las dificultades que se la han presentado esta la inestabilidad laboral que presenta en estos últimos años en Nicaragua, pero dentro de sus planes futuros están la creación de una pequeña empresa que brinde los servicios de albañilería.

Por ahora desea reconstruir la casa en donde actualmente habita construyendo un muro en el frente de la casa de su madre, esto con el objetivo en primer lugar de darle seguridad, debido a que en la zona en la que habita presenta un alto índice de delincuencia, así como también mejórale la fachada a la vivienda.

Con esto él quiere honrar a su madre devolviéndole un poco de todo el esfuerzo que su madre ha hecho por él.
texts.en:
Lázaro Antonio E. G. is single, 26 years old and lives in Barrio Laureles Norte. He makes a living as a construction worker, and one of his biggest goals is to buy some land where he can build his own home. Among the difficulties he has encountered is the instability of labor that has taken place in Nicaragua over the past few years, but among his plans for the future is to create a small business that provides construction services. For now, he wants to upgrade his mom's house, where he currently lives. He wants to build a wall in front of his mother's home, chiefly for security since the area where they lives has a high crime rate and also to improve the facade. In this way he wants to honor his mother, returning in some small way all that she has done for him.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of his mother's home

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MUJERES D. ÉXITO” esta conformado por 11 socias todas vecinas y amigas del mismo lugar.
L. Sra. Yovanna, es L. tesorera del grupo y trata D. desempeñar su labor D. L. mejor manera elL. es enfermera D. profesión antes trabajaba como tal en una clínica en algunas ocasiones hacia guardias particulares para tener otros ingresos, su esposo es marino y por  lo mismo siempre lo enviaban D. un lugar a otro por lo que siempre dejaba sus trabajos, es así que por el bienestar D. su familia deciD. tener un negocio por cuenta propia y empieza en L. venta D. cosméticos elL. tiene muchas amistades a quienes ofrece sus productos actualmente venD. 6 marcas diferentes D. esta forma tiene mas ganancias, también  hace chocotejas y las venD.. Con su trabajo elL. pueD. ayudar en  los estudios a uno D. sus hijos, Mas adelante elL. quiere cambiar  D. rubro y lo que mas ansia es tener un restaurante turístico y preparar platos típicos D. L. región, su préstamo en esta ocasión lo usara para comprar mas productos para venderlos sabe que poco a poco lograra todo lo que se ha propuesto.

* L. Sra. yovanna esta sentada es L. tercera D. L. derecha
texts.en:
The group 'Mujeres D. Éxito' is maD. up of 11 associates, all neighbours and friends from the same place. Yovanna is the treasurer of the group and tries to perform her work to the best of her ability. She is a nurse by profession and used to work as such in a clinic. On some occasions Yovanna performed other particular duties to obtain more earnings. Her husband is a sailor and used to be sent from one place to the other, for which she always had to leave her jobs. For the well-being of her family Yovanna decided to have her own business and began selling cosmetics. She has many friends to whom she offers her products, and sells 6 different brands. In this way she earns more, and she also makes and sells chocotejas (a type of sweet). With her business Yovanna can contribute to her childrens' studies. In the future she wants to change direction and what she is most anxious to have is a tourist restaurant and prepare tipical regional food. Yovanna's loan on this occasion will be used to buy more products to sell. She knows that little by little she will achieve what she has proposed. *Yovanna is seated third from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza Imelda B. M., vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte  es madre soltera y sus hijos actualmente estudian la escuela secundaria, ella tiene 43 añso de edad y ha laborado 5 años para la Bicatura Arzobispal de Bluefield. 

Dentro de los Planes de la señora está el abrir un negocio de venta de artículos domésticos y personales, para esto primero desea construir un muro atrás de su casa para cerrar la entrada y con esto dar mayor seguridad a todos, con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo este objetivo.

Ella espera que se le apoye pues no tiene apoyo de nadie y es una mujer muy humilde quien desea tener los recursos necesarios para brindarles a sus hijos un espacio óptimo en donde habiten en un lugar seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Esperanza Imelda B. M. lives in the suburb Laureles Norte. She is a single mother and her children study in secondary school. She is 43 years old and has worked for 5 years for the Archbishop of Bluefield. Amongst her plans Esperanza is opening a business selling domestic and personal items. For this she first wishes to construct a wall behind her house to close the entrance and create greater security for everyone. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to realise this objective. Esperanza hopes that she receives support as she doesn't have anyone's support, and she is a very humble woman who wishes to have the necessary resources to give her children optimal space in a safe and comfortable place.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ALEJANDRINA, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales vive con 3 de 25, 23,19 años nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene un pequeño stand donde ella vende panes, ella misma prepara los panes y los vende, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar harina, levadura y los otros ingredientes al por mayor para poder preparan gran cantidad de panes y de este modo abastecer a más tiendas a ella le apoya su esposo Juan y se ha vuelto este un negocio familiar, lo que la socia quiere es seguir ayudando a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar su casita .

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank 'Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa'. She lives in the Oropesa district, in the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the imperial city. Alejandrina is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom live with her (25, 23 and 19 years old). Our member alternates her household activities with a small business. She has a small stand where she sells bread which she prepares herself. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy flour, yeast and other ingredients to prepare large quantities of bread and in this way supply more shops. Her husband Juan supports her and he has turned it into a family business. What Alejandrina wishes is to continue helping her children with their studies and improve her house. Alejandrina is thankful for and values the opportunity given at this moment, and she promises to meet her debt repayments within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Rumbo Al Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz, tiene 59 años y junto a sus amigas conforman el nuevo grupo “RUMBO AL ÉXITO” ella es la  presidenta y tiene muchas expectativas para que su grupo progrese.
Luz siempre ha trabajado, hizo de todo para ayudar en la economía familiar  actualmente ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en un mercado de su ciudad su negocio esta prosperando poco a poco vende ropa para niños y adultos tanto de primera como de segunda, también alquila habitaciones en su casa lo cual le genera otros ingresos adicionales, gracias a esto ha podido ayudar en la construcción de su casa  y lograr que su hija pueda estudiar, ella quiere superarse un poco mas. por eso desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que este crezca,  el  préstamo de EDAPROSPO lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa para vender  a toda su clientela.

* La Sra. Luz es la segunda de la derecha (parada) con polo a rayas
texts.en:
Luz is 59 years old and together with her friends forms the new group 'Rumbo al Éxito'. She is the president and has lots of experience, for which reason the group progresses. Luz has always worked. She did everything she could to help with the household finances. She has a clothing sale business in a market in her city. Her business is prospering little by little. She sells children's and adult's clothing, as much of the first as the latter, and also rents rooms in her house, which generate additional income. Thanks to this she has been able to help in the construction of her house, and ensure that her daughter can study. She wants to improve a little more, and for this wants to continue investing in her business so that it grows. The loan from Edaprospo will be used to purchase more clothes to sell to her clientele. Luz is the second from the right (standing up) with the striped polo.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Arely De Fátima

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Arelys del Carmen S. se desempeña como maestra de un pequeño colegio impartiendo clases a niños y ha logrado desempeñarse y sobresalir como una excelente maestra en el municipio.
Ella es casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar y la razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es porque ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde habitar. Es por estas razones que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillos de piso y así mejorará dichas condiciones que es lo que anhela.
texts.en:
In the municipality El Sauce in León, Arelys del Carmen S. carries out the duties as a teacher in a small school, imparting classes to children. She has managed this very well and excells as an excellent teacher in the municipality. Arelys is married with 2 school-age children and the reason why she is seeking a loan is because she has begun improving the condition of her house, in order to give her children a dignified roof over their heads. It is for this reason that the loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as floor bricks. In this way Arelys will improve the said conditions, which is what she longs for.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce, la señora María Teresa M. se desempeña en el secretariado con el fin de llevar a cabo su sueño de construir su casa de habitación que tanto lo requiere porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ella anhela brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde habitar. Por estas razones es que está solicitando el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, cemento y arena y así continuar con dicha labor para brindarle a su familia las condiciones de vida necesarias.
Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así hará realidad su sueño de tener un local digno donde habitar en familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa M. works as a secretary in the town of El Sauce. Her dream is to complete building her home, which has been in poor condition. She wants to provide her family with a worthy home in which to live. She is asking for funding to buy building materials like bricks, cement and sand so that she can continue with her project and provide her family with life's basic needs. She hopes to have the loan granted so that her dream of a worthy home for her family may come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSITA, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7, 8 meses de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades el hogar con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende papa y maíz, ella trae de los mismo agricultores la papa y el maíz al por mayor y los lleva al mercado de Cusco vino canchón, en el distrito de san jerónimo, la socia trabaja desde hace un par de años en este negocio y ahora con las pérdidas de terrenos agrícolas ella dice que subirá el precio de estos productos, entonces ahora ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir y abastecerse de estos productos.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
ROSITA, 30, is a member of the "Ricchary Purisun-Oropesa" communal bank. She lives in Oropesa district, Cusco department, which is 30 minutes from the imperial city. She lives with her life partner and their three children, who are 10 and 7 years old, and 8 months old. She is both a housewife and a retail merchant. She buys and sells potatoes and corn. She gets the potatoes and corn from the farmers themselves at wholesale and takes them to Cusco's Vino Canchón market, in the San Jerónimo district. She has been in this line of work for a couple of years now. With the loss of agricultural lands, she knows that prices will rise. She, therefore, is asking for funding to reinvest and restock. She is grateful for and appreciative of the opportunity offered her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and corn to sell in the market.

loans.name: Tania Yanira

texts.es:
La señora Tania Yanira P. L., es soltera de 27 años de edad, ella vive en el barrio San Ignacio y se dedica desde hace 16 años a la agricultura. 

Uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado en su negocio, es la falta de apoyo económico de las empresas financiadoras  de este país. A raíz de eso su mama le ha apoyado para que ella tenga un sustento económico, gracias a sus cultivos, pero ahora ella desea no seguir dándole molestias a su mama y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y material vegetativo para diversificar su cosecha. Esto le permitiría vender una producción de buena calidad y tener el capital de trabajo para futuros proyectos que se le presentasen.
texts.en:
Tania Yanira P. L., 27, is single and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood. She has been a farmer for the last 16 years. One of the main problems her business has faced is the lack of financial support from financial institutions in this country. Because of this, her mother has assisted her so that she could have economic support. Thanks to her crops, she would like to no longer be a burden to her mother and is asking for funding to buy supplies, fertilizers and vegetative material to diversify her harvest. This will allow her to sell a high-quality product and have working capital for future projects that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito tiene la edad de 42 años, el tiene 2 hijos  y ambos está a su cargo.  Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Porque él tiene que buscar la forma de cómo llevar dinero suficiente a su hogar para sus 2 hijos, fue así que empezó por cuenta propia y compro 2 terneros para venderlos a un precio accesible así fue que con el paso del tiempo logro obtener este medio vida . Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que es la compra de ganado. El deseo de José es obtener otro negocio como es una  distribuidora.
texts.en:
José Benito, 42, has two children under his care. He has been a cattleman for over 15 years. Because he has to find ways to earn money to support his household and his two children, he started on his own initiative and bought two calves to sell at a reasonable price. This is how, as time went by, he fashioned a way of life for himself. He calls upon Fundación León 2000, whose sister organizations offer help, and asks for funding to buy cattle. José's desire is to acquire another business, perhaps a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Francisco De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Francisco
texts.en: Francisco

loans.use: To buy refreshing fungicides.

loans.name: Julia Martina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Martina R. M., es madre soltera de 46 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos trabajan y apoyan a los gastos del hogar, y los r dos menores actualmente estudian, ella desde hace 16 años labora como conserje. Y dentro de las dificultades económicas que se le han presentado ha sido la falta de recursos económicos para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.

La vivienda de la señora R. la construyo su ex marido y está construida de madera, pero con el pasar  de los años representa una amenaza de derrumbamiento, es por esta razón que la señora desea este préstamo, para reconstruir su hogar, con el préstamo compraría los materiales para comenzar con la cimentación, esto le traería mejores condiciones para su familia y sobre todo habitarían en un lugar que les brindase a todos seguridad. 

Ella es una mujer que con su humilde trabajo a salido adelante sin el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, quien los abandono hace unos años atrás, pero esto no la detuvo y con su esfuerzo, ella les ha brindado   a todos sus hijos salud y educación.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Martina R. M. is a 46-year-old single mother. She has 4 children, of whom two work and help with the household expenses, and the younger two are in school. For 16 years she has worked as a caretaker. Among the economic difficulties that she has experienced has been the lack of economic resources to improve the structure of her house.

Señora R.'s house was constructed by her ex-husband and is built of wood, but with the passage of time it is threatening to collapse. It is for this reason that Señora R. wants this loan, to reconstruct her home. With the loan, she would buy the materials to begin the foundation. This would bring better conditions for her family, and above all, they would live in a place that would offer them all security.

She is a woman who with her humble work has advanced without the support of the father of her children, who abandoned them some years ago, but this did not stop her and with her efforts she has offered all her children health and education.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Juntas Progresaremos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS”

“JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS” es una alcancía comunal conformada por vecinas que vieron la oportunidad en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD de solicitar préstamos, de los cuales dispondrán para mejorar y hacer crecer sus negocios, con ello lograr obtener algún progreso tanto en su negocio como en su profesión.
La señora Guisela tiene 24 años, es miembro de esta alcancía, ella se dedica a ser consultora de belleza para ayudarse en sus estudios de administración de turismo y a la vez criar sola a su único hijo. También tiene un pequeño bazar en casa donde lo llena con productos de catálogo que ella vende, además de otros productos para regalo.
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios, con ayuda de su papá, pagar su curso de inglés, sacar su título y poner su propia empresa turística.
texts.en:
"Juntas Progresaremos" ("Together We Progress") is a community bank composed of neighbors who saw an opportunity in Edaprospo-Prosperidad to solicit mO. loans, all of which allow them to build and better their businesses. With the loans they are able to achieve progress in their businesses as well as their careers. Mrs. Guisela is a 24 years old of this community bank. She works as a beautician to help pay for her studies in tourism administration. She also raises her only son alone. She has a small stO. in her house, which she fills with products from a catalog to sell as well as others to gift. Her dream is--with her father's help--to finish her studies, pay for an English course, get a degree, and have her own tourism business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Huinco Group

texts.es:
En esta alcancía comunal participan diez personas cada uno de ellos son muy emprendedores y responsables, es así que lo demuestran día a dia en sus negocios. El salir adelante y mejorar su situación económica es el objetivo primordial de estas personas, así tenemos a:
Lucila Juana vende en las tarde frituras como los anticuchos, mollejitas, salchipapas en su carrito sandwichero que pudo comprar de su anterior negocio de venta de papa con huevo, choclo sancochado, papa rellena; y su kiosco de este último negocio y de algunos préstamos que invirtió en  mercadería. Esto le ayudó a evolucionar de ambulane a tener su propio puesto estable donde actualmente le va mejor económicamente, pues ha sabido administrar bien su negocio, así mismo adquirió posteriormente una cocina y equipo de sonido para su hogar, antes no era posible tenerlo. Espera seguir creciendo, ha pensado instalar otro kiosco para generar más ingresos para su familia.

Gorge Luis no tenía antes ningún tipo de negocio, comenzó a vender golosinas de a poquitos, después adquirió un crédito que le ayudó a crecer su negocio, actualmente tine su propio kiosco donde vende todo tipo de golosinas, además de comida como papa rellena, gelatinas, choclo, papa y huevo sancochado, gaseosas, lo cual genera regulares ventas, su negocio se ubica en la carretera central paradero donde los carros paran por unos minutos para comprar comida. Este negocio además le da tiempo para apoyar a su padre en su restaurante por ser una persona de avanzada edad. Requiere del préstamo para comprar mercadería de golosinas e insumos que necesita. Él comparte los gastos de su familia con su esposa.
texts.en:
Ten people participate in this communal bank; each one is very responsible and enterprising, a fact that they prove daily in their various businesses. Their primary objective is to go forward and to improve their economic situation. Among them we have: Lucila Juana, who sells fried fast food like anticuchos, mollejitas, salchipapas from her sandwich cart (which she was able to buy from her previous business of selling potatoes and eggs, choclo sancochado, stuffed potato) in the afternoons and her stall from her last business and some loans that she invested in supplies. This helped her to evolve from being a peddler to having her own fixed location where she does better economically because she has learned how to administer her business well. She also bought a stove and a sound system for her house; prior it was impossible to have it. She hopes to continue to grow and has thought of perhaps setting up another stall to generate additional income for her family. Gorge Luis didn't used to have any kind of business. He began selling small amounts of sweets. Then, he got a loan that helped him to grow his business. Currently, he has his own stand where he sells all kinds of sweets and prepared food like stuffed potatoes, gelatin treats, choclo, fried egg and potato, soft-drinks, which generate regular income. His business is located on the main highway's rest stop where vehicles stop for a few minutes to buy food. This business also leaves him with time left over to help his elderly father in his restaurant. He needs the funding to buy stock inventory. He shares the family's expenses with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and ingredients.

loans.name: Alieva Aigul`s Group

texts.en:
Aigul, 30, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and has no children. She lives with her younger sister in her own house. Aigul is a farmer. In 1995, the local government assigned her family agricultural land and since then, she has been in this business. The land is about 0.63 hectares. In the upcoming spring, she is planning to plant cotton and potatoes. This loan will be used to buy one ton of potato seeds. At tthe present time, her seasonal income of farming exceeds $1,500. Besides this, she works in the local cement factory as a cook. Her salary is about $150. This is her first loan in Mol Bulak Finance.

Anarahon, 30, is a mother of four little children. Her husband is a guest worker in Russia. She also has some land, where she usually plants cotton, corn and potatoes. This year, she is going to plant cotton. She needs a loan to buy potato seeds. In the future, she hopes to save some money that will be enough to buy a car for her husband.

Nursuluu, 23, is also a farmer. She is married. Her family has a total of 0.46 hectare of land. She cultivates potatoes, rice and tobacco there. She needs a loan to prepare for spring sow, which is to plough and buy potato seeds.

Chingiz is 29 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a school principal in a local school. Chingiz will use this loan to buy one ton of potato seeds. His annual income per month is about $150. He is planning to open a little clothes shop in the future. When he has time, he provides passenger transportation services in Aravan village. For this purpose, he bought a Daewoo Tico.

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy one ton of potato seeds

loans.name: Amarsaikhan

texts.en: Amarsaikhan is 44 years old and lives in Baganuur, a small town about an hour or so drive from UB (Ulan Bator).  He moved to Baganuur in 2007 with his family. He lives in an apartment with his wife, Narantuya, and his daughter and son, Anu and Anand.  He and his wife have been working together in their pants shop since 2008.  Right now, they rent a one-room apartment to sell their pants. With the loan, Amarsaikhan wants to open another shop that he will be able to have at the busy market where more people will be able to buy his stuff.  Amarsaikhan doesn’t drink, is humble, almost to a fault, honest, and very responsible with money. He hopes to be able to open many branches of his business someday.

loans.use: To open another shop

loans.name: Bayartsengel

texts.en: Bayartsengel is 43 years old and has been running her own clothes shop for the past two years.  Her husband passed away some years ago and in 2000, she started working for her sister at her sister’s shop. Bayartsengel mostly sells shirts and such things for men and women at her shop. She wants to expand and sell coats as well. She needs a loan to buy the coats and get them to her place. Bayartsengel lives with her two daughters, Ankhnaran and Ankhjargal, both in high school. They live in Baganuur, a small town an hour or so drive away from UB (Ulan Bator). In the winter, she bags coal and sells it and in the summer, she gathers glass and plastic bottles to make ends meet.  With her husband gone, her goal now is to make enough money that she can send both her girls to college. Bayartsengel is fiscally responsible, honest and humble.

loans.use: To buy coats to sell

loans.name: Doljindolgor

texts.en:
Doljindolgor is a 33-year-old very busy mother of three. Ten years ago, she started making felt shoes and boot liners for winter.  She used to live in the countryside but two years ago she moved to town.  Since moving, she has become very busy.  She has started making several new styles and has started to gather a growing clientele.  In order to keep her business growing, she needs some equipment and materials. She needs wool and combing and shaking machines to make the felt.  She also needs materials and detergent to wash the wool and felt.  She has also recently bought a knitting machine and is learning to use it.  As her patterns and product appearance get better, she wants to take on partners and maybe even teach other people how to make it. 
	Doljindolgor lives with her husband and three sons (6, 9, and 12) in Uvurkhangai province.  During the winter her husband drives a taxi and in the summer he goes to the countryside with the boys to tend to the livestock. Doljindolgor is meticulous in her work, hard working, and humble to a fault.  Since she was little, Doljindolgor has always finished what she started and seeing something she has accomplished makes her happy.  “There is a lot I want to do!” she says.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment to make felt

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 75 years old. Alfredo is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Alfredo raises pigs for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for house repairs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alfredo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repairs

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vĩnh Thị Kiều is 52 years old. (id: 010103080006). She has three children. She lives in Nghia Vu village, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and her children. She and her husband are farmers. They also breed pigs and poultry. They have a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She feels happy when she is taking part in SEDA because  ,she can save money daily, weekly easily. This time, she needs 5,450,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
  About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Lụt Thị Nguyễn is 56 years old. (id: 010103080010).  She is breeding pigs. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Lượng Thị Nguyễn is 58 years old. (id: 010103080008). She sells vegetable and pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VDN  for her small business.
 Nguyên Thị Lê is 49 years old. (id: 010103080012). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Lan Ngọc Nguyễn is 39 years old. (id: 010103080011).  She sells electric equipment. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her electric shop.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Norma is married and has three adult-aged and two school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for twelve years and makes approximately $88 a month.

In 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nemeno

texts.en:
Mr. Nemeno H. is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 58 years old and married with seven children. He owns a business selling spare parts. Aside from this business he owns a rice field of more than three hectares. He has managed his business for more than three years, earning approximately $220 a month. 

Nemeno successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. He has a new loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC which will be used for additional capital to purchase new spare parts to sell.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

  *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Hà Thị Trương is 27 years old. (id: 010103080001). She is married and has one child. She has a store at home from which she sells goods like candy, cake, beer, soft drinks, fruit and so on. Her husband makes iron doors to sell. They have been working these jobs for about three years. They have a monthly income of about $220. 

She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, SEDA.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

She has been with Seda for six years and has repaid her loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or $295) to buy goods to sell, and also to buy iron for her husband's door-making business. 

About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Mai Thị Nguyễn is 26 years old. (id: 010103080003). She sells groceries. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to buy more goods to sell.
 Ngọc Thị Bích Bùi is 34 years old. (id: 010103080004). She sells pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in her small business.
 Lý Thị Lê is 44 years old. (id: 010103080002). She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or $225) for her small business.
 Nam Thị Ngô is 25 years old. (id: 010103080007). She breeds pigs and poultry. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to buy food for her animals.
 Phuong T. T. P. is 26 years old. (id: 010103080005). She sells groceries at home. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in her store.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell and iron to make doors

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Joumana makes soap. She even took training in order to improve the quality of her soap and to design her soap packaging. Joumana is an active woman who does her best to improve her family’s income, and she is a hardworking lady. 

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase materials like tissue for wrapping her soap, and to buy other accessories and materials. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Joumana is well-known in her business because she offers good quality merchandise and does good work. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. 

Joumana decided to start her business because when she was young she learned about doing handicrafts, and she likes her job. She plans to keep on improving her business as well as her financial situation by taking more training and learning more.

loans.use: To purchase materials for packaging her soap.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S. was born in 1983; she is a married woman and has been blessed with two children. Both of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Kong Phon. He is 26 years old, and he is a partner who helps her conduct the business. 

Currently San S. grows vegetables to sell and raises pigs, which she will sell when they mature. She plans to improve her business, but in order to do this she needs more land to grow crops. Because she doesn’t have money yet, she requested a loan to buy a piece of a neighbor’s farmland.

loans.use: To buy a piece of her neighbor’s farmland.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 60-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Sanaa has been working in agriculture since 1995. She owns livestock that allows her to produce dairy products. She also breeds poultry. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to increase her livestock. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. Sanaa is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t use to produce as much as she does today. Sanaa decided on doing her business because she took over her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the village of Tugas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  He is 59 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a general store and is also engaged in farming. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products in the local community. He also receives revenue from his rice production. Jose has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional stock for his retail business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

loans.name: Rizkallah

texts.en: Rizkallah is a 30-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Rizkallah has been working as a builder since 2000. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition, especially because he didn’t have a lot of networking. He also had some financial issues. Rizkallah is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. This is the first time that Rizkallah has requested a loan. Therefore, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji is a 39-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Naji has been working in construction. When he first started his business, he had competition and some financiA. issues. Naji is speciA. in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has been working as a house painter since 2006. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networks and making himself known to the public. He is special in his work because he is trustworthy and is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Deok

texts.en: Mrs. Deok P. is 34 years old and lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. Here she built a pigpen next to her house where she breeds many pigs. This is how she earns a living. Through this, she is able to raise and sell pigs at least two times per year. She has a partner in her husband, who always leaves home to work in the construction sector. The couple now has two kids who are enrolled in school. Deok P. is taking out her loan to buy more building accessories and will provide them to her husband to use for construction.

loans.use: To buy more building accessories.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 50 year old man who lives his wife and four children in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hussein has been working as a shoe repairer since 1979. When he started his business he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. His customers are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He is trustworthy and is well known for his good work. Hussein is a hardworking man who, on top of his job, has taken on extra work in different fields so that he can provide the best he can for his family. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan. He has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Tipan. She is 36 years old. Lourdes is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a hog raising business in the agricultural sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main income source for the business is raising pigs for sale. Lourdes has been running her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.
In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is a 42 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Oussama has been selling scrap metal for two years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop. Oussama has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.
Oussama offers a wide range of products. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends and neighbors. When he started his business he had some financial issues purchasing the required stock. Oussama decided to run his business because he took over his family’s business. In the future, he plans to keep improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 29-year-old, married woman with one child. She has been working as a private teacher in her town since 2002. She really likes her occupation because, as she said, it allows her to help the students of the region to obtain a good education. Today, Faten is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a desk, bookcase and a computer that will improve her work.

loans.use: to buy a desk, bookcase and a computer

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
M. is a 53 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife. M. has been working in agriculture since 1990. He owns livestock and produces dairy products. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a cow so that he can increase his dairy products and livestock. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.
M. is well known for his good products. His clients are people from his region. When he started his business he had to face competition as there is a lot of agriculture in his region. M. decided to run his business because of his experience: he took over his family’s business and learnt it when he was young. He plans to keep expanding his business by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Ruth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a mini-grocery store. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $66 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional grocery items for her business. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more groceries to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Wafa has been producing agro products since 2000. She produces different type of jams, spices and more. She is an active woman who does her best to improve her family’s income and is a hardworking lady. 

She is well-known in her work because she offers good quality and very tasty products. She always tries new recipes and health products to sell. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash.
