Wafa decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, especially since she has a big family and she wants to offer them the best she can.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.  She plans to keep on improving her business as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Path

texts.en: Mrs. Path P. is 28 years old and earns a living as a pig breeder. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and normally earns about $3 a day. In addition, she sometimes goes fishing with her husband in and around the river, where there are a lot of fishermen. She currently cares for two kids, who attend school. Path requests a loan to buy more pig food and piglets for her pig stall.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and piglets.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Said owns and operates a children's clothing shop. When he first started his business, he had to face competition, especially since he didn’t have a lot of networking, and he had some financial issues as well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Said is notable for his work because he is known for being welcoming and offering the best quality to his clients. 

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Said has requested a loan.  In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ibrahim has been working in construction, tiling floors since 2000. He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Said has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and he had some financial issues. He is well-known for his good work. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business and to purchase more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 36-year-old married lady with three children in school.  She owns a retail shop where she sells curtains, bedding and detergents. She has been in the business for four years and has one employee.   Previously, she was tailoring.  She intends to add to her stock of curtains and bedding with the loan of 40,000 KES. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her grow her business.  She hopes to expand her business so as to earn more income.  Virginia is aiming high for success.

loans.use: To buy more curtains and bedding to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia T. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old. Eufemia is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia owns and operates a manufacturing business, making and selling bamboo products like "amakan" (floor mats) to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Eufemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to expand her product offerings. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children. He has been selling spare parts from old used cars since 1995. He is well-known because he treats his clients well, and also because he repairs and prepares the used parts for selling before offering them for sale. His clients can be anybody from his region. Jihad requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan. 

When he first started his business, he had no difficulties. Jihad decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work. He used to work as a blacksmith, so he had some experience from his previous job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase old cars' spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Leonites

texts.en:
Leonites V. is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Leonites is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonites owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $58 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Leonites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Now she is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Mrs. Agapita L. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and married with one child. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store and her husband is a farmer. Her store serves as their second source of income because her husband supports their basic daily needs.  

Agapita joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in business activities. She has managed her business for more than five years and makes approximately $140 a month. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Now she wants a new loan of 14,000 PHP for the purpose of additional capital to cover the expansion of her sari-sari store. It will be her 4th cycle loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 31, who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child, has been selling paint since 1999.  Ahmad is requesting a loan, his first from Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more paint to sell.  Ahmad is special in his work because of his skill and his variety of product offerings. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as other painters. He decided on this business because he wanted to have an independent job and had experience with painting. However, when he first started his enterprise, he had to face the competition. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase some paint to sell.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek, 33, who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children, has been working in agriculture since 2004. He plants fruits and vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, orange, apples, mint and other products, depending on the season. He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase seeds and repair his car.

. Tarek's clients are his friends and neighbors as well as fruit and vegetable vendors. He decided upon this business as he took after his family’s business. He hopes for the future to keep improving his work and possibly buy a bigger plot of land for his agriculture.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and repair his car.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer, a 25-year-old who lives in the Bekaa, has been selling used metal and aluminum since 2008. He also sells old and used spare parts and accessories. Samer is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business.

He is special in his work because he is a hardworking man, and his clients are his family members, friends and neighbors, as well as traders. Although he didn’t have a great deal of start-up cash, Samer decided to establish his business because it is in high demand in the region. In the future, he plans on expanding his operation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Mrs. Am N., a widowed mother of four children, three married and one single, is a temporary laborer who is also hired by villagers to decorate or cook for their parties. She also relies on the income from two of her children, one a used-goods seller and the other a crop-planter in the village. Her single son is soon to wed, and Am N. is asking for a loan to help with the wedding party.

loans.use: Wedding party

loans.name: Mirwais

texts.en: Mirwais M. D., a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan, lives in a house requiring extensive repairs. Married with six children, he lacks sufficient personal funds to effect the repairs, and is therefore requesting a loan of 50000 Afghani for this purpose.  The repairs will allow him to live comfortably with his family members.  Mirwais is glad that this kind of effective process exists in Afghanistan to help support people.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru: Дустов Сулаймон проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Дустов Сулаймон в области животноводства работает более 16 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Дустов Сулаймон увеличивает их количество, чтобы получить большую прибыль. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
D. Sulayman lives in the A. Jomi region. He's forty-nine years old, married and has six children. He has worked in the field of animal husbandry for more than sixteen years. He fattens and then sells cattle. D. is now increasing the head count of his herd so that he may earn a profit. He's asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 38 year old married lady with one child.  She has been running a boutique for five years.   She has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and had previously taken a loan.

She wants a loan of 40,000 KES to buy materials for making clothes.  She hopes to be successful in her business in the future and even start importing goods.

loans.use: To purchase materials and clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay H. is 33 years old and lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. To earn a living, Lay H. covered a hedge around a piece of her own land where she raises many ducks to produce eggs for a profit. Through this, she is able to collect a lot of eggs a day and sells them to retailers in the market.

Lay H. is married with three teenage children who are either studying or working. Her husband is a palm tree climber who taps palm juice and turns it into palm wine for sale. Beside their current work, the family also cultivates rice crops.

Lay H. is looking for a loan to purchase more ducks to breed. She has skinny cows and she will use any remainder of the loan to fatten her animals.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to breed.

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
T. is a mechanic for a private automotive services company.  He lives with his mother (pictured), wife and two daughters.  Since purchasing the insulated ger (yurt) covering, he has noticed that his family is staying warmer longer and is saving at least 20% on his fuel costs.  He also appreciates that the product is helping him cut down on his own pollution.   

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital city in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To fund a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en:
Baasan is a taxi driver and lives with his wife and two children. He has lived in the ger (traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) districts of Ulaanbaatar for ten years.

Baasan purchased a ger insulation covering to help with the air pollution and to save money spent on fuel. He feels that he has saved so much money on fuel with the insulation that he recommended the product to his brother.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.name: Kakh Boland Group

texts.en:
This is Kakh Boland group which is made up of two female members. These two members would like to receive money for their husbands.

Shila is the group leader and she wants to receive money for her husband who has a cart which he uses to sell kitchen utensils. With the loan he wants to purchase more materials which are in demand so as to progress his business.

The second member of this group is Mah Gul who wants to receive the loan for her husband who has a cosmetics shop. With the loan he would like to buy good quality cosmetics to attract more clients.

Both members would like to thank Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for her husband's business

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man with five unemployed children. He has been working in furniture making for the past fifteen years. He makes furniture designs such as salons, bedrooms, etc., and he has also specialized in carving the furniture.

Ali likes his job because in his opinion it's an art and he's thankful for it; it allows him to raise his five children and provide a good life situation for them.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. wood to offer a variety of products and attract business from his clients.

loans.use: To buy additional wood

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
The pig-raising trade is the main source of income and there are many citizens depending on it. One of these people, Mrs. Hor C., has been engaged in this business since 1995. Additionally, her husband is always hired by neighbors to build their new houses for a fee.

Hor C., 41, lives with three children and her husband in a very old and small wooden house, located in Kompong Tom province. She hopes to build a new house but she doesn’t have enough money to begin the construction process.

Therefore, Hor C. requests a loan of 600 USD to add to her personal savings in order to build a new medium-sized wooden house. She intends to use any remaining money from the loan to invest in a recycling business for extra revenue.

loans.use: To build a new medium-sized wooden house

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Нуров Шерали проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Нуров Шерали животноводством занимается более 20 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Нуров Шерали разводит живоных в специально построенном месте. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Sherali N. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 42 years old; married with one child. Sherali has worked in animal husbandry for over 20 years. He fattens up and sells livestock. Sherali breeds the animals in a space build specifically for this purpose. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih is a 42-year-old single man. He has been working for the past thirteen years in refining water and in 2005, he took action and opened his own station for refining water after seeing a need for such services in his region.

Today, Nazih is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a refrigerator and plastic bottles in which to market the water.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and plastic bottles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell in his kiosk

loans.name: Shakila Farid Group

texts.en:
This is the Shakila Farid Group which has three members. M. Farid is the group leader.

M. Farid is a young boy of 23 and a hardworking and responsible person as well. He has a general store where he works seven days a week and all his family members benefit through the income he generates. With the loan he would like to expand his business.

The second member is Shakila who has a bead-working business and through this she is popular in her area as her clients like her work. With the Kiva loan she will purchase necessary materials for her business.

The third member is Norma who is a tailor. She sews different kinds of clothes and with the loan she would like to purchase a new sewing machine to work in a better way.

All three would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of cosmetic products for resale

loans.name: Vanchig

texts.en:
Vanchig makes wooden furniture and sells his pieces at the local bazaar. He lives with his wife and two sons who are students. He has lived in the city’s ger (traditional nomadic housing tent) districts for thirty-two years and considers himself an expert at surviving the cold harsh winter days.

Given his expertise, Vanchig admitted that he was surprised at how long and efficiently the ger (yurt) insulation keeps him and his family warm. He also believes that he saves at least twenty percent of fuel costs.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 21-year-old single woman who lives with her mother and her brother. Her father is traveling out of the country to work and earn income for the family.

Maha is still a student at the university but, since 2004, she decided to help her father by working as a private teacher. And that's how she earns extra money and is able to provide as much support as she can for her family.

Today, Maha is requesting $1,000 to buy a laptop computer to facilitate her work preparation for the students.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer

loans.use: Sale of foodstuffs and basic necessities

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married man and the father of five children

Mohamad has been working as a taxi driver since 1994 and with his business income he was able to raise his children alone. He works hard and he took up private transportation services upon request of clients, working day and night to earn a good income for his family.

Today, Mohamad is requesting $1,000 to perform maintenance on his taxi after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Bayanderlger

texts.en:
Bayanderlger is a water distributor in Ulaanbaatar. He lives with his wife and three little children (son pictured) in the northern section of the city where the pollution is the worst. He purchased an insulated ger (traditional nomadic tent) blanket in order to help reduce the air pollution. So far, he is really happy with the ger insulation and feels that he is saving money from spending less on fuel and is keeping warmer than before.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.
