loans.name: Karimova Labarhan's Group

texts.en: Labarhan, 57, is the leader of this group. She was born in Aravan village and has been living there since then. She is married and has three children, all of whom are married and live separately except her youngest son. Like Labarhan, her husband is also a farmer. Here, in our country, usually the youngest child stays with the parents and looks after them, especially when they become older. Her son is 29 years old and works as a taxi driver in the village. He has three children, and two sons are twins! Quite a rare case for almost everybody! Labarhan’s daughter-in-law is a housewife and also looks after the family business. Labarhan and her family have land where potatoes and cotton are cultivated. For this loan Labarhan is planning to buy seed potatoes, mineral fertilizer and get prepared for sowing. She has been in this business for sixteen years. In the future her family is planning to buy additional land and also to start livestock breeding. Maybe later loans will be disbursed for this purpose. Bahtiyor, 38, is the father of four children: three daughters and one son. The middle daughter is a disabled person but all the others go to school. Bahtiyor is a farmer and he will use the loan to buy cotton seed and fertilizer. Bahtiyor also keeps two bulls for breeding and wants to increase the number of his livestock. Sabahathan, 55, is also a farmer. Her family has a total of 0.5 hectares (1.25 acres) of land and she cultivates potatoes and wheat there. She needs a loan to prepare for spring sowing, which requires her to plow and buy seed potatoes. She is married with one son who in turn is married and has one son. All the family members, including Sabahathan’s husband, take an active role in the family business. This year Sabahathan is planning to make repairs to her house. Gulanarahon is 25 years old and the youngest member of this solidarity group, but not the least. She is married with one son. She will use this loan to buy textiles to start a new business. Before getting married she helped her mother and they had a little sewing workshop. So she is planning to open her own workshop to produce garments, coverings, etc. This is her number one priority as well as to bring up a good son! This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes, mineral fertilizer and to get prepared for sowing

loans.name: Jalolidin

texts.ru: Меликов Джалолидин проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Меликов Джалолидин имеет среднее образование. Животноводством занимается более 15 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Jalolidin M. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 46 years old; married with 4 children. Jalolidin has a high-school education. He has worked in animal husbandry for over 15 years. He fattens up and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 30-year-old married man and has one child. Since 2003 he has been working as a sanitary repairman repairing toilets and faucets, with a previous ten years of experience in this occupation. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of house projects in his region and its surroundings.

With the help of the requested loan of $600, Tarek managed to expand his business and take more projects by buying more tools that he needed.

loans.use: To buy more tools that he needed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cereals

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25-year-old married man with one child. He owns tractors that he uses for transportation projects. He has been involved in this business for the past 15 years, and his business productivity helps improve his economic situation. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD for maintenance work on his tractors and to buy tractor wheels. This will allow him to offer more transport services and satisfy the needs of the market.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance work on his tractors and new tractor wheels

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 33-year-old young man who is the father of two sons and one daughter. He owns a clothing store which he started fourteen years ago. He has gained very good experience in this field. He appears in the photo at his store.

Due to the current financial hardship in Palestine, Murad’s business has deteriorated. Therefore, he thought of taking a $1000 loan from FATEN to buy more clothes which will attract more customers to his store and increase his income.

Murad adds that his store is located in the heart of the commercial souq (market) of Jineen which gives him a better chance to sell more clothes than other stores.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a 47-year-old married man with two school-aged children. For the last nine years, with his wife's assistance, he has run a shop where he sells milk, bread and sugar. He earns extra income from his small farm. Gabriel appreciates Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for helping him improve his standard of living. In the future, he hopes to provide a better education for his children. Gabriel has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to boost his business.  He describes himself as an ambitious, honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To add stock to boost business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and married with four children, ages 19, 21, 25, and 28; two of her children are still attending school. She's a dairy farmer in the Nyamira area of Nyanza province of Kenya and has been farming since 1982. She sells milk locally and also earns income from tea farming. She says that the main challenge to her business is marketing her milk products.

She requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 40,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Grace says that the income from the added dairy cow will help her to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and 22. All of the children are attending school. She is a dairy farmer in the Nyamira area of Western Kenya. She's been farming for over twenty years and sells milk within the community. She also earns income from a small retail kiosk and employs one person. She says that the main challenges to her business are poor marketing of milk products and drought.

She has requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the added dairy cow will help her to be able to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she'd like to expand her dairy farming to produce 20 litres of milk a day.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmen Alomia

texts.es:
Carmen Fernández de 50 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es viuda con 3 hijos.

Carmen vendía comida en su casa poco a poco tuvo ingresos suficientes para tener su propio local y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00, haciendo platos como arroz con pollo, tallarines, caldos etc. Para hacer todos los platos compran arroz, verduras, tallarines, aceites etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene es cuando se enferma.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar quintales de arroz, mesas, sillas para mejorar su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otro comedor bien ampliado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen Fernández is 50 years old and is a widow with 3 children. She lives in the outskirts of the Paraíso district of Guayaquil, and she has all the basic services.

Carmen was selling food in her house, then little by little, she had sufficient income to have her own location and give better service to her customers.

Now she works every day from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m., making dishes such as rice with chicken, noodles, soups, etc. To make all these dishes, she buys rice, vegetables, noodles, oils, etc. One of the difficulties she has is when she is sick.

With the loan she wants to buy large quantities of rice and tables and chairs to improve her business. In the future, she wants to have another, considerably bigger dining area for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, tables and chairs

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old single man who lives alone. In 2005, he bought a crane and starting working in construction. Operating as a freelancer, he managed projects across the whole region he lives in. His business has grown dramatically and he has a large and increasing number of customers. In order to continue expanding his company, he has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy a new crane.

loans.use: to buy a new crane

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny trabaja de chofer asalariado en el grupo de trufis 88 que pertenece al sindicato Eduardo Avaroa.

Vive en  la ciudad de La Paz.  

Vive en la casa de sus padres. Es soltero.  

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de minibús ya que tiene el 80% y solo le falta el 20% y una vez obtenido el minibús trabajara con el mismo.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Jhonny works as a salaried driver with the Trufis 88 group, which belongs to the Eduardo Avaroa trade union. He lives in La Paz. Jhonny is single and lives in his parents' house. The loan will go towards buying a minibus. 80% has already been paid towards the cost of the minibus. Jhonny only has 20% more to pay, and plans to use the minibus for work purposes. This is his first loan with Impro; he was approved for the loan following an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a minibus to transport people around the city.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe adjudica licitaciones de obras públicas las cuales son publicadas por la Alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz.  

Vive en la Zona Estrellas de Belén de la ciudad de El Alto. 

Es casado; vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, quien tiene un  kiosco donde vende tucumanas (son salteñas, que en ingles se llaman turnovers) durante el día y salchipapas ( salchichas con papas fritas) por la noche.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra garaje y la refacción de una habitación que será ocupada por sus hijos. 

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Felipe puts out tenders for public works, which are published by the La Paz City Council. He lives in the Estrellas de Belén area in the city of El Alto. Felipe is married and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. His wife has a kiosk where she sells tucumanas (pasties) during the day and salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices) at night. The loan will go towards the purchase of a garage and renovation of a room, which when finished will be occupied by his children. This is his second loan with Impro; he qualified for the loan following an evaluation process.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a garage and renovate a room in his house for the benefit of his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la Artesanía en Macramé para confeccionar mantas de vicuña para su posterior  comercialización; su esposo trabaja como transportista interprovincial; estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de su familia. Tienen 1 hijo de 5 años de edad. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Retamas I camino a Viacha  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento y estuco) para refacción de su vivienda y así poder vivir mejor . 
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio-económico le permite solicitar este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Francisca does macrame making vicuña blankets for subsequent sale. Her husband works in interprovincial transport. These activities are their principal sources of income for the support of their family. They have one child who is 5 years old. Their home is located in the Retamas I zone on the road to Viacha from the city of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy construction material (sand, cement, and stucco) to repair their house and thus be able to live better.

This is her first loan with Impro. The socio-economic analysis permits her to apply for this new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and stucco to repair their house

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamd is 23 years old, single and lives with his mother and sister. He went into business seven years ago, when his father died and he became his family's sole means of support. He bought a compressor and started a company that prepares building sites for construction crews to work on. He has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy a car in which to transport items, because this will mean a big increase in his productivity.

loans.use: to increase the productivity of his business by buying a car

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora se dedica a la confección de mantas de vicuña para su posterior comercialización; su esposo es Policía, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia, no tienen hijos. Viven en Alquiler y su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de matera prima (lana de vicuña e hilo) para la confección de mantas de vicuña.
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Dora weaves blankets made from vicuna wool for subsequent marketing. Her husband is a police officer; his being the main income, which they use to cover household expenses. They do not have children. The couple rent accommodation, which is located in the Tahuantinsuyo area of the city of El Alto. The loan is destined for the purchase of vicuna wool and thread in order to make blankets. This is Dora's third loan with Impro. Her timely repayments mean she is able to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vicuna wool and thread for her blanket-making business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa trabaja como comerciante de material escolar en la ciudad de El Alto, el esposo trabaja como taxista y así complementan sus ingresos con los que se  mantienen a su familia; tienen tres hijos que están en las edades de 5, 12 y 15 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 16 de Febrero Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la compra mercadería (más material escolar, cuadernos, lápices, gomas de borrar, etc.) para la temporada de inicio de clases.
 
Es su tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Elsa sells school stationery supplies in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and by combining their salaries, they are able to pay household expenses and maintain their children. The couple have three children aged 5, 12 and 15 years respectively. Their home is located in the Zona 16 de Febrero, Río Seco area of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery supplies (notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc.) for the commencement of classes. This is Elsa's third loan with Impro. Her timely payments mean she is able to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc., for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es viuda y se dedica al comercio de comida (Vivandera), tiene un puesto de venta.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia; tiene 2 hijos y uno esta a su cargo con la  edad de 21 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Rio Seco Las Viviendas   de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de material de construcción (cemento, estuco) para la refacción de su vivienda para poder vivir mejor. 
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Teodora is a widow engaged in the business of selling food as a street vendor. She has a stall from which she sells. This business is her principal source of income with which she supports her family. She has two children. One, age 21, is in her care. Her home is located in the Rio Seco Las Viviendas zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used for the purchase of construction material (cement and stucco) for the renovation of her dwelling so that she will be able to live better. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good conduct in making payments permits her to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and stucco for the renovation of her home.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en: Samah is 19 years old and lives with her parents and four siblings. In 2008, she started working as a hairdresser at her friend’s salon. She began attracting many clients because of her ability to produce beautiful designs. Samah has decided to go into business for herself by accepting customers at home. She has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy the tools, accessories and beauty products she needs to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy the tools, accessories and beauty products she needs to start her own business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING MORE SHAWLS, SWEATERS, AND WOOL GLOVES TO SELL

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta es viuda; trabaja como comerciante de comida (vivandera), tiene 6 hijos y ninguno esta a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona villa Ingavi Alto Lima  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de  víveres por cantidad (arroz, fideo, papas, etc.) para su actividad del comercio de comida.
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Anacleta is a widow who works selling food; she has 6 children who are all adults and independent. Her home is located in the Villa Ingavi Alto Lima area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase large quantities of the ingredients she needs to prepare her food (rice, noodles, potatoes, etc.). This is the third loan she has received from Impro; she paid back her previous loans punctually which qualified her to receive this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients like rice, noodles, potatoes, etc. wholesale for her business selling food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: selling food and first necessity items

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy trabaja como empleado de la Empresa Embotelladora Mendocina, su esposa es comerciante de cosméticos; así complementan sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia. Tienen dos hijos con las edades de 10 y 12 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Villa Bolivar “D” de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la refacción de su vivienda para poder vivir mejor. Necesita comprar estuco, cemento y arena.
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Willy works as an employee of the Mendocina Bottling Company; his wife sells cosmetics. Their combined income helps to cover their family expenses. They have two children who are 10 and 12 years old. Their home is located in the Villa Bolivar "D" area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to refurbish their home to provide thjem a better place to live. They need to buy stucco, cement, and sand. This is their second loan through Impro; their punctual payments of their last loan qualified them to receive a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stucco, cement, sand to refurbish their home

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
VIRGEN D. CHAPI D. YANACOTO

Muy trabajadores y emprendedores son los diez integrantes D. esta alcancía comunal hasta el momento han demostrado responsabilidad en los créditos recibidos; tratan D. mejorar su condición D. vida. Conozcamos más a los integrantes D. esta alcancía.

El tener un negocio no fue tan fácil para Eileen, cada vez que recuerda como empezó sus ojos se acongojan; cincuenta soles era lo que tenía en su bolsillo dinero que utilizó para comprar mercadería pequeña (hilos, agujas, centímetros, esmaltes y algunos carritos D. plástico) utilizó como vitrina los cajones D. frutas que le regaló una señora. Su optimismo y la fuerza enorme que tenía por salir adelante por mantener a su única hija pequeña consiguió al final del mes vender su mercadería pagando el alquiler del puesto y conseguir pequeñas ganancias que le ayudaría más adelante a crecer D. a poquitos su pequeño bazar. Los préstamos que recibió lo invirtió compró ropa para bebé, juguetes, zapatos, adornos para la casa, cosméticos. Agradece a Dios por todas las bendiciones regaladas, no se queja con este pequeño negocio mantiene, educa, viste y da salud a su hija D. once años, lo que también pudo alquiler otro puesto donD. expenD. todo lo que son plásticos (baldes, teteras eléctricas, bolsas D. plásticos, escobillones, recogedores, platos descartables además compró un pequeño terreno en un asentamiento humano. El préstamo será destinado para mejorar su negocio e implementarlo más como juguetes.

Hilza en cambio se dedica al negocio D. cervezas, gaseosas en casa, con este negocio comparte los gastos con su esposo, solventa los gastos que tiene como el D. educar a sus hijos, comprarles sus útiles escolares, ropa; le da lo esencial porque no es mucho lo que genera D. ganancias. Aprovecha en vender el queso y mantequilla que le manda su mamá D. la sierra (Cajamarca) a sus amistades y conocidos. Tiene un hijo D. 19 años D. edad a quien lo apoya en su carrera técnica. Comprará cajas D. cervezas y gaseosas por paquetes con el dinero que será préstamo.
texts.en:
Virgin of Chapi of Yanacoto The 10 members of this village bank are very hard-working and enterprising individuals who have demonstrated their responsibility in the loans they have received to date; they work hard to improve their standard of living. Let's get to know the members of the group. It wasn't easy to start a business for Eileen; each time she recollects how it all started, she tears up. She had about 50 soles ($15 USD) in her pocket which she used to buy a little bit of merchandise to sell (thread, needles, nail polish, and a few plastic carts). She used some fruit boxes that her friend gave her as a display case. Her optimism and strength to progress and to proviD. for her young daughter helped her to sell all her merchandise by the end of the month, pay the rent for her stand, and earn a small amount of money to grow her small store. The loans she received were invested in the purchase of baby clothing, toys, shoes, home decorations, and cosmetics. She is grateful to God for the blessings she's received; she never complains with the small business that she runs as it helps to proviD. for, educate, and clothe her 11 year old daughter. She was also able to rent another small store where she sells plastic goods (buckets, teapots, plastic bags, brushes, dustpans, disposable plates, etc.) and to buy a small piece of land in a new area of town. This loan will be used to improve her business and supply it with more toys to sell. Hilza, on the other hand, runs a business selling beer and soft drinks from her home. With this business, she is able to help her husband proviD. for the family, especially their children's school and clothing expenses. She provides the basics for them because she doesn't earn a lot. When she can, she also sells cheese and butter that her mother sends her from Cajamarca (in the mountains) to her friends and neighbors. She has a 19 year old son who she supports in his technical studies. She will buy cases of beer and soft drinks with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys and soft drinks

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MICAELA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 50 años y es divorciada, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 14 años ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia alquila un stand en un colegio en el cuál puso una tienda escolar tipo abarrotes en donde ella vende todo tipo de golosinas, sándwich, bebidas calientes y frías, cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores y jugos de frutas. Nuestra socia también tiene en su casa propia departamentos los cuales los alquila y de ahí también tiene otro ingreso adicional, lo cual le permite viajar y pasear, ahora nuestra socia que está en el grupo desde hace 6 años atrás mantiene este grupo para seguir conectada a sus amigas del banco y también de este modo utilizar el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su stand escolar para la época vacacional, nuestra socia invertirá el dinero exclusivamente en esta tienda escolar.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Micaela belongs to the "Sol de Oro" (Golden Sun) communal bank. This member lives in the San Jerónimo neighborhood of Cuzco, about 15 minutes from the downtown area. This member is 50 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children, ages 19 and 14. She alternates her various activities with her retail business. She rents a stand at a school where she has set up a type of school grocery store and sells all kinds of sweets, sandwiches, hot and cold drinks, notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and fruit juices. She also rents out rooms in her house, from which she earns some extra income that allows her to get out and about. Our member has been in this lending group for six years. She keeps up with the group to stay connected to her friends from the bank and so she can obtain a loan to buy merchandise for her school stand for the vacation season. She will invest the money exclusively in the school store. She appreciates and values the opportunity given to her through this medium, so she promises to pay off her debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for school store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cosmetics, beauty products, and hairpieces

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en: Yasmine is 32 years old, married and the mother of two young children. In 2004, she went into business as a seamstress, making curtains and various items for furniture. Her work has allowed her to make enough money to provide a better life to her children. Yasmine has applied for a loan for $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine, a table and other accessories she needs to offer services to her customers and satisfy their growing demand for her goods.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine, a table and accessories which will allow her to meet growing customer demand

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia se dedica a la confección de mantas de lana para cholitas (mujeres con pollera) para su posterior comercialización; su esposo es Empleado Publico, siendo estas  sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de su familia. Tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 5 están a su cargo con las edades de 1, 3, 6, 9 y 13 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Villa Ingavi Alto Lima  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de lana para la confección de mantas de lana para cholitas.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Eugenia makes and eventually sells woolen ponchos for cholitas (native women) who wear traditional clothing ; her husband is a civil servant. With the income from these two jobs, they support their family. They have six children, five of whom (aged 1, 3, 6, 9, and 13 years) they still support. Their home is located in the neighbourhood of Villa Ingavi Alto Lima in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy wool to make woolen ponchos for cholitas. This is Eugenia’s second loan with Kiva partner Impro. Because she showed herself responsible with the repayments of the first loan, she has qualified for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool to make traditional ponchos

loans.name: El Hadji Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora G. est  un jeune pêcheur de 27 ans qui habite a Yoff Ndeugagne.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-Imcec Yoff depuis décembre 2007.Il exerce la pêche depuis 10 ans entre la localité de Yoff et de Kayes. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité de ses parents pêcheurs  mais qui le passionne beaucoup aussi. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et 8 ans. Son plus grand moment de bonheur est lorsqu’il attrape beaucoup de poissons. Monsieur Gning sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour l’achat d’un matériel de plongeon, d’une bouteille a air et d’un ensemble plongeur. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permet de garantir l’alimentation de sa famille et d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Monsieur Gora G. is a young fisherman (age 27) who lives in Yoff Ndeugagne. He has been a member of the l’U-Imcec Yoff bank since December 2007. For ten years, he has been fishing in the area between Yoff and Kayes. He was raised in a family of fisherman, and loves his profession. His happiest moments are when he has a big catch. Monsieur G. is married with two children, who are 6 and 8 years old. With the 300,000 frs loan he has requested, Monsieur G. will purchase diving equipment, including an oxygen tank and a diving suit. Increasing his profits will help guarantee he can feed his family and send his children to school.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase diving equipment

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita trabaja como comerciante de instrumentos musicales, el esposo es músico. Es  su fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su familia. Tienen 4 hijos y tres están a su cargo con las edades de 6, 12 y 15 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona  de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Elto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de  2 trompetas, 3 platillos y 2 tambores, para su venta a colegios en esta temporada de inicio de clases.
 
Es su cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita sells musical instruments; her husband is a musician. It is her income that supports the family. They have four children, three of whom (aged 6, 12, and 15 years) they still support. Their home is located in the neighbourhood of Rio Seco in the city of El Elto. The loan will be used to buy two trumpets, three sets of cymbals, and two drums to sell at this time of year when high school classes are just starting. This is Margarita’s fourth loan with Kiva partner Impro. Because she showed herself responsible with the repayments of the other loans, she has qualified for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy musical instruments to sell to students

loans.name: Claudia Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene mucha responsabilidad con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para llevara el pan de cada día su hogar. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa, ella tiene una hija de 13 años, es la razón más fundamental por la que ella lucha y trabaja fuertemente para proporcionarle a su hija estudios dignos, sufragar los gastos de su familia. Por lo que su esposo también contribuye mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues el brinda los servicios de mecánico juntos contribuyen a mejorar sus condiciones. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, tallas extra granes, vestidos, camisas formales y pantalones de vestir que es lo que más le solicitan sus clientes. Su deseo es tener una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina has many family responsibilities, but she has always enjoyed working to provide for her family. Her job is buying and selling clothing. She has a 13-year old daughter who is the main reason why she puts in a lot of effort and works hard to provide her with a decent education and pay for household expenses. Her husband, who is a mechanic, also contributes to household income. Together they are improving their lot in life. Marina is asking for a loan to buy pants, extra-large garments, dresses, dress shirts and pants--the items most requested by her customers. Her greatest wish is to have a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aderlli

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ADERLLI, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, El socio vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestro socio tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero, el estudia y en su tiempo libre puso un stand alquilado en el centro comercial paraíso, nuestro socio vende accesorios para celulares y celulares de diferentes modelos y marcas, nuestro socio cada cierto tiempo viaja a Bolivia para poder traer mercadería barata y poder ganar un poco más de la venta de cada producto, el socio desea a futuro tener su propia tienda de venta de celulares y ahora ella solicita el préstamo para poder viajar y traer más celulares y accesorios para todo tipo de celular.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Adderlli, is a member of the communal bank "Sol de Oro." This member lives in the city of Cusco, in the San Jeronimo neighborhood which is located 15 minutes from the city. Our member is 21 years old and single. He studies and in his free time sets up a rented stand in the Paraiso mall. Our member sells various models and brands of cell phones and cell phone accessories. Every now and again our member travels to Bolivia so he can bring back cheap merchandise and earn a little more from each sale. He wants to have this own cell phone store in the future. He is asking for a loan so he can travel and bring back more cell phones and accessories for every kind of cell phone. He is grateful for, and values, the opportunity offered him in this way and also promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member needs a loan to buy accessories for cell phone and other sets to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Adonis

texts.es: Carlos Adonis tiene 25 años, el negocio del Señor Carlos es una pulpería donde ofrece arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, detergentes jabón entre otros productos, son productos para el consumo del hogar. Además de esto Carlos es profesor ya que el poco salario que gana no es suficiente es por eso que con el poco dinero logra establecer muy pocos productos, es así que obtiene clientes en su propio vecindario, ya que no tenia mucha competencia en su cuadra poco a poco fue aumentando su inventario y así obtener su pulpería. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener la estabilidad económica necesaria para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Adonis is 25, and his business is a mini-market. He sells rice, beans, sugar, sweets, bread, juice, natural cold drinks, detergent, and soap, among other products. They are products to use in the home. Also, Carlos is a teacher. The small salary he earns is not enough. That is why he used this small amount of money and was only able to carry a few products. He gets customers from his own neighborhood. He did not have much competition on his block. Little by little, he started increasing his inventory and that is how he got his mini-market. The loan is to buy basic grains, sweets, cold drinks, and juices. His wish is to obtain the necessary economic stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merilin

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MERILIN, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12, 8 años, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene un stand propio en el centro comercial el paraíso, ella  vende todo tipo de accesorios de todos los celulares y también celulares, nuestra socia desea reinvertir en su propio negocio, ella solicita el préstamo para así poder viajar y traer mercadería en relación a los diferentes celulares que existen en el mercado, como mascaras de celulares, audífonos, memorias, fundas, etc.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Merilyn belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco in the San Jerónimo neighborhood, which is 15 minutes from the city. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has three children; 14, 12, and 8. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She has her own stand in the Paraíso commercial center. She sells all types of accessories for all cell phones. She also sells cell phones. She wants to reinvest in her own business. She is asking for the loan to be able to travel and get the different cell phone merchandise that exists in the market. She will get things like cell phone skins, headphones, memory cards, and covers, etc. She values and is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To procure electronic and electrical accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GABRIELA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 ella es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos el menor de sus hijos vive con ella, y tiene 7años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende ropa los días martes y sábados en Cusco en el centro comercial “comerciantes de Tahuantinsuyo” y los otros días lleva a la provincia de Urubamba a una hora de Cusco y a la provincia de Urcos a 1 hora y 15 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea seguir siendo madre y padre para sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios y cuidar de la educación y alimentación de su menor hijo, para lo cual ella solicita el préstamo y desea invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gabriela belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco in the San Jerónimo neighborhood, which is 15 minutes from the city. She is 39, and she is the single mother of four children. Her youngest child, 7, lives with her. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She sells clothes on Tuesdays and Saturdays at the commercial center in Cusco, “Comerciantes de Tahuantinsuyo”. The other days she takes the clothes to the Urubamba province, which is one hour from Cusco and the Urcos province, which is one hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Cusco. She is a very hard-working woman who wants to keep being mother and father to her children and support them in their education. She wants to take care of the education and the food for her youngest child. That is why she is asking for the loan. She wants to invest in buying wholesale merchandise. She values and is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Gudalupa Mercedes

texts.es: Guadalupe Mercedes tiene 40 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, como madre responsable debe buscar la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, ella tiene que proporcionarle lo necesario como es la vestimenta y el pan de cada día. Inicio hace 6 años por cuenta propia porque no tenía un trabajo ella poseía mucha fortaleza esto la motivo a establecer una pulpería, al inicio Guadalupe no tenía la experiencia en este negocio, pero eso lo fue obteniendo con el paso del tiempo. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Mercedes, 40, has a min-market. As a responsible mother, she needs to look for the way to improve their living conditions. She is raising two children. She needs to provide them with the necessities like clothing and their daily bread. She started on her own six years ago because she did not have a job. She had a lot of strength, and this motivated her to establish a mini-market. At the start, Guadalupe did not have experience in this business. But, with the passage of time she was acquiring experience. She is asking for this loan to buy raw material. She dreams of converting her mini-market into a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair his house

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio MIGUEL, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, El socio vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años de edad es soltero y trabaja vendiendo ropas, el socio trabaja de manera ambulatoria, no tiene stand, el trae ropa de Juliaca y de Bolivia y lo lleva a vender a la provincia de Calca y otra parte a la provincia de Urubamba, nuestro socio viaja cada 15 días para abastecerse de ropas según la temporada y trae ropa al por mayor en diversas tallas, y los lleva a vender a estas provincias, ahí lo conocen al Sr. Miguel, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y traer a vender a Cusco.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member MIGUEL belongs to the communal bank "SOL DE ORO". This member lives in the city of Cuzco, neighborhood of San Jeronimo located 15 minutes from the city. Our member is 23 years old. He is single and works selling clothes. He works as a street vendor; he does not have a stand. He brings clothes from Juliaca and Bolivia and takes it to sell in the province of Calca and a part of it to the province of Urubamba. Our member travels every two weeks to supply himself with clothes according to the season and he brings clothing wholesale in different sizes and takes them to sell in these provinces. They know Mr. Miguel there. He is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise and to bring clothes to sell in Cuzco. He is grateful for and values the opportunity offered through this means. He is also commited to pay his loan within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to purchase clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Geoconda Benita

texts.es: Geoconda Benita tiene 38 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella decidió iniciar este negocio con le propósitos de mantener a sus 4 hijos que son lo más importante y el motivo de su lucha, anteriormente se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida los fines de semana pero se vio muy afectada ya que por las mañanas tenía que dedicarse a la elaboración de los diferentes platillos para después ser vendidos y le afectaba mucho el cansancio, pero esto no la detuvo a dedicarse a otra actividad. Ella necesita el financiamiento pues sin él no podría comprar la materia prima necesaria. Ella desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geoconda Benita is 38 years old. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than 7 years. She decided to start this buisness with the purpose of supporting her 4 children who are the most important thing and the reason for her struggle. Previously she made and sold food on weekends but she was very affected by this. Mornings she had to prepare the different dishes and later sell them. The exhaustion affected her a lot, but this didn't stop her from doing something else. She needs the financing because without it she wouldn't be able to buy the necessary raw materials. She wishes to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia KATIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente, ella tiene 1 hijo de 25 años el cual aún está estudiando superior en la universidad, nuestra socia le apoya con los estudios y la alimentación, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y en su mismo local a implementado un espacio para el depósito de cervezas,, la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio, ella vende cervezas al por mayor y también al por menor, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la adquisición de cajas de cervezas y abastecer su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Katia belongs to the "Sol de Oro" (Golden Sun) communal bank. This member lives in the San Jerónimo neighborhood of Cuzco, about 15 minutes from the downtown area. She is 48 years old and has a live-in partner. She has one son, who is 25 years old and attending college. She supports him by feeding him and helping to pay his school expenses. She has a grocery store and has set aside a space in it for selling beer. She alternates her activities with her business. She sells beer both wholesale and retail, and she requests this loan to be able to invest in the acquisition of cases of beer to supply her business. She appreciates and values the opportunity given to her through this medium, so she promises to pay off her debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of beer

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: •	Madame Marieme S. est une vieille femme dynamique de 60 ans qui n’a pas opte le choix d’être inactive. Depuis 6 ans elle évolue dans l’achat et la vente de la friperie dans les marches hebdomadaires. Elle a choisi cette activité pour assister sa famille et surtout son mari qui est en retraite. Son objectif est de réaliser le maximum de bénéfices. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs en vue d’acquérir des couvertures, des peignoirs et des draps qui sont très sollicites pendant la période du froid. Elle est sociétaire a l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2004.Elle a déjà rembourse quatre prêts antérieurs. Elle a un enfant de 46 ans mais elle supporte la supporte la charge de deux autres membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Mariam S. is a 60 year old dynamic woman who chose to be active. For 6 years she's been into the buying and selling of second-hand clothes in the weekly markets. She chose this business to support her family and especially her husband who is on retirement. Her aim is to make maximum profits. She is requesting a loan of 300 000frs in view of purchasing blankets, wraps and sheets which are in high demand during the cold season. She's been a member of U-IMCEC since March 2004. She already repaid 4 previous loans. She has a 46 year old child but supports with the expenses of two other members of her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase  capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy artificial hair for her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Intiwara 2 Group

texts.es:
La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento esta conformado por la señoras: 

La Sra. Justina quien tiene como actividad la Venta D. Dulces y punto Viva en su Kiosco  ubicado en La plaza arandia Villa Fátima, ella quiere ampliar su puesto D. venta para mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. 

La Sra. Silvia es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. dulces en el colegio Hernando siles, es tambien portera del establesimiento tiene hijos que se encuentran en la misma escuela donD. ella trabaja.

La señora Natividad es la  secretaria  D. actas, se dedica a la venta en diferentes ferias D. la P. D. acuerdo a temporada y con Capital para la Ocación por ejemplo la feria D. Alasita ella ya cuenta con un puesto fijo durante esta feria y así trabaja durante todo el año.  Estas tres personas son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por Diez  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas porque se conocen  y  saben que no fallaran a su garantía solidaria, como Banco. 

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 10% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio y lo acomodan en clientes fijos que ellos tienen y no cuenta con domicilio propio, son muy trabajadoras, el negocio es el unico ingreso con el cual mantienen el hogar son  responsables con su credito ahora se encuentran el  cuarto credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema. Se conocen muy bien y se colaboran entre ellos.

El destino del credito es para la compra D. mercaderia y en algunos casos para el incremento D. capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The executive board of the Banco del Emprendimiento is composed of the following women: Señora Justina, sells sweets and knit items for her business. She lives in her sales kiosk, which is located in the Plaza Arandia Villa Fátima. She wishes to expand her kiosk so that she may increase her income, now that she has children of school age. Señora Silvia is the treasurer, and she sells sweets in the Hernando Siles school, where she is also the door-woman. She has children who are attend the same school where she works. Señora Natividad is the secretary, responsible for taking minutes of the board's proceedings. She works selling various items at different fairs throughout La P. depending on the season and how much capital she has at the time. For example, she has a regular post at the fair of Alasita that she can rely on working; in this manner, going from fair to fair, she supports herself throughout the entire year. These three people are the head of the Banco D. Empredimiento, which is maD. up of ten people who, because they all know each other, form a guarantee amongst themselves that they will not miss their payments, making the bank a reliable institution. A majority of the members rely on their own fixed place of business to earn money. The other 10% takes merchandise to peoples' homes, delivering goods to a regular group of customers, since they do not own their own homes from which they could work. All the members are very hard-working, and their businesses are their only source of income, which they rely upon to maintain their homes and families. They are responsible with their loans. Currently, they are working with their fourth loan from Kiva and have not had a single problem. They all know each other very well and work together to assist each other. The loan they now request is to be used for purchasing merchandise and, in a few cases, to increase capital to put towards improving work places. All of the members are very thankful to both Emprender and Kiva for the confidence those groups have displayed to them in offering loans to the members to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia DELIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años y está separada, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales vive con 4 de sus hijos de 23, 17, 14, 12 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades de su hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende ropa y calzados, ella compra al por mayor y distribuye la mercadería a diferentes clientes, la socia trae la mercadería desde Juliaca y Bolivia, ella viaja cada cierto tiempo para abastecer su mercadería. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y otra parte para ahorrarla y hacer capital de trabajo.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Delia, belongs to the group “Sun of Gold", she lives in the city of Cusco, in the neighborhood of San Jerónimo located 15 minutes from the city. She is 41 years old and is separated, she has five children, four of which live with her, ages 23, 17, 14, 12 years of age. Delia alternates activities at home with retail activities. She sells clothes and shoes that she buys and distributes the merchandise to different clients. Delia brings the merchandise from Juliaca and Bolivia, she travels at a certain time to get her supply of merchandise. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise and to save and to have capital for work. Delia is grateful for the loan and she is committed to complete the repayments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair plaiting accessories and other working materials in bulk.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro tiene 60 años, se dedica a la venta de pesca artesanal. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos de él y de sus 4 hijos desde muy joven a él le ha gustado su negocio, pues el mar es el lugar donde pasa la mayor parte de tiempo, porque algunas veces no obtiene los peces suficientes para comercializarlos además el tiene que recibir sol todos los días el nos dice que está acostumbrado y que esto no le impide seguir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de activos fijos. El sueña con tener su propio establecimiento y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Genaro is 60 years old and for more than 30 years he has sold fish. This profession has improved his income for he and his four children since they were very young. He has liked his business because the sea is a place where he passes the majority of his time, though sometimes he doesn't catch enough fish to sell. Genaro says that he gets a lot of sun every day but he is accustomed to it so it doesn't get in the way of his work. The loan that he is seeking is for working capital and the purchase of assets. His dream is to have his own establishment and to have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
EN EL GRUPO DE LAS CINCO ROSAS HAY CINCO PERSONAS: SILVERIA, ANGELINA, BLANCA LETICIA, BLANCA LIDIA, Y ARGELIA.  LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES SILVERIA C. G..

SILVERIA VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD EMILIANO ZAPATA EN EL ESTADO DE CHIAPAS MEXICO. VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL SEÑOR LUIS Y AHI VIVEN DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS.  SILVERIA TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD. DEPENDEN DE ELLA 3 HIJOS, MARI, RAMIRO Y SU PEQUEÑA JANET DE 2 AÑOS DE EDAD. ELLOS ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA PRIMARIA. SILVERIA NO ESTUDIO, POR ESA RAZON TRABAJA ARDUAMENTE TODOS LOS DIAS INCANSABLEMENTE, POR QUE QUIERE QUE ELLOS TENGAN  MAS OPORTUNIDADES QUE ELLA NO LOGRO TENERLA.

SILVERIA SE DEDICA A LA PANADERIA. SOLICITO ÉSTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR INGREDIENTES COMO SON HARINA, HUEVO LEVADURA, QUESO Y OTROS INGREDIENTES. HA TRABAJADO LA PANADERIA POR 3 AÑOS, Y APRENDIO ESTA ACTIVIDAD CON SU SUEGRA. DICE QUE ÉSTE PRÉSTAMO LA AYUDARA YA QUE UNO DE LOS FACTORES QUE HA AFECTADO A SU ACTIVIDAD ES LOS ALTOS COSTOS DE LOS INGREDIENTES. SUMADO A ESTO, AL NO CONTAR CON UN HORNO PROPIO, LE IMPIDE DECIDIR SOBRE QUE DIA REALIZAR LOS PANES, PUESTO QUE TIENE QUE PRESTAR ANTICIPADAMENTE EL HORNO PARA ASI PROGRAMARSE QUE DIA REALIZARLO. ADEMAS, SILVERIA NO TIENE UN LOCAL, ASI QUE VIAJA A OTRAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS PARA VENDER EL PAN QUE ELLA ELABORA.  UNO DE SUS SUEÑOS ES QUE ALGUN DIA TENGA SU PROPIO HORNO Y ELLA PUEDA TRABAJAR MAS DIAS A LA SEMANA Y ASI OBTENGA MAS GANANCIA Y PUEDA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO PARA SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS Y QUE ELLOS TENGAN UNA MEJOR PREPERACION.  

NOS PLATICA QUE ESTE PRESTAMO LE AYUDARA MUCHO POR LO QUE SI HAY MAS INVERSION MAYOR SERA SU GANANCIA.
EL NEGOCIO QUE REALIZA ES MUY IMPORTANTE PARA ELLA, YA QUE CON LOS INGRESOS QUE OBTIENE PUEDE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA. ADEMAS DE QUE LE SIRVE PARA CONOCER A  PERSONAS DE OTRAS COMUNIDADES Y HACER NUEVAS AMISTADES.

SILVERIA SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA QUE HAYA PERSONA QUE SIN CONOCERLA LE TENGAN CONFIANZA EN DARLE LOS PRESTAMOS Y QUE SE INTERESEN EN SU ACTIVIDAD.
texts.en:
There are five people in the group “Cinco Rosas” (“Five Roses”): Silveria, Angelina, Blanca Leticia, Blanca Lidia, and Argelia. Silveria C. G. is the representative of the group. Silveria lives in the Emiliano Zapata community in the Chiapas region of Mexico, where she has lived for 3 years with Mr. Luis in a common law marriage. Three children depend on her, Mari, Ramiro, and her youngest, Janet, who is 2 years old. They attend primary school. Silveria is not educated, and therefore works tirelessly every day to give her children the opportunities she did not have. Silveria dedicates herself to baking. She requests this loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, cheese, and other ingredients. She has been a baker for 3 years, having learned from her mother-in-law. She says this loan will help her greatly, since one of the factors which has affected her business is the high cost of ingredients. On top of this, since she doesn’t have her own oven, she has to plan ahead to borrow one in order to make her breads. In addition, she doesn’t have her own store, and therefore travels to nearby communities to sell her products. Her dream is to one day have her own oven, so she can work more days of the week. This will allow her to increase her earnings to continue supporting her children with their educations, and to better prepare them for life. She tells us that this loan will help her greatly since, with additional investment, her income will increase. The business she undertakes is very important to her, since this is the means by which she helps her husband cover the household’s expenses. In addition, she gets to meet people from other towns and make new friends. Silveria is very glad that there are people who, without even knowing her, would have confidence in her for a loan and are interested in her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo esta  integrado por  5 Señoras: Beda, Lourdes, Oyuki, Marlen, Monica, Florecita.  Ellas se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, siempre han participado en algunos eventos en su colonia.

Con este credito, la señora Beda P. va a dedicarse a la venta de blancos y zapato por catalogo, la Sra. Oyuki Marlene a la venta de dulces, papas, chicharrones preparados etc., Mónica Esperanza a la venta de ropa americana de primera clase y por ultimo la Sra. Lourdes Rodríguez a la venta de frutas y verduras.

Nuestra acredita Florecita cuenta con 30 años de edad. Florecita actualmente vive en unión libre con un profesor de primaria.  Florecita Marlene tiene 3 hijos los cuales llevan por nombre: Erika (11 años), Claudia (10 años), y Kevin (4 años). Erika asiste a la primaria va en sexto grado, Claudia va en cuarto año y el mas chico va al preescolar. Ella estudia actualmente la secundaria en sistema abierto en el INEA.  Tiene la necesidad de superarse personalmente, profesionalmente y económicamente.  

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar un MODEM inalámbrico, mantenimiento de sus computadoras en su negocio de renta de computadoras con Internet.  Además, ella quiere hacerle mejoría a su vivienda pintarla, cambiarle las puertas y mas que nada mejorar la imagen de su negocio. (Su negocio al lado de su casa).  Ella quiere que la gente la visite con más gusto y se sientan mucho más cómodas.  La satisfacciones que ella siente es de que puede servir a la gente, le gusta tener contacto con su propia comunidad por que así es como se conocen todos.  Quiere dejarles este patrimonio a sus hijos para que salgan a delante y por que no soñar que se tenga un gran “cyber café.”

Dice que esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que les brinda KIVA y la Fundación Realidad.  Espera que sigan apoyándola con más créditos para crecer más junto con ustedes.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of five women; Beda, Lourdes, Oyuki Marlen, Monica, and Florecita. They have known each other for a long time. They have always participated in some events in their neighborhood. With this loan Beda P. will devote herself to selling bedding and shoes by catalog. Oyuki Marlene will sell sweets, potatoes, and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds), etc. Mónica Esperanza will sell American clothes, and Lourdes Rodríguez will sell fruit and vegetables. Florecita, 30, is in a common law marriage with a primary teacher. Florecita Marlene has three children. Erika is 11, Cluadia is 10, and Kevin is 4. Erika is in the sixth grade, Claudia is in fourth, and the littlest child goes to preschool. She is currently studying high school courses in the INEA open system. She wants to improve herself personally, professionally, and economically. The loan will be used to buy a wireless modem and for maintenance of the computers she uses in renting Internet time. Also, she wants to improve her house by painting it and changing the doors. More than anything she wants to change the image of her business. (Her business is by the side of her house.). She wants people to have more enjoyment and comfort when they visit her business. The satisfaction that she feels is from being able to help people. She likes having contact with her own community because that is how they get to know each other. She wants to leave this asset to her children so that they can get ahead and have the dream of a great cyber café. She says that she is very grateful for the support offered by Kiva and the Fundación Realidad. She hopes that they keep helping her with more loans to grow more together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and buy a wireless modem

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour y avoir accédé à 10 fois de suite. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, de l'oignons, de la pomme de terre etc. Elle a comme objectif de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Martine D. is a married, 47 year-old woman without children. She has been a member of the Sainte ANNE1 Village Bank for the past 5 years and has been able to repay 10 consecutive loans. She owns a shop where various products such as rice, oil, sugar, onions, potatoes, etc are sold. Her goal is to increase her savings and help with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carry out her business actvities

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo P. es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa, el crédito lo solicito para comprar la pintura y pintar su carro, debido a que en él se moviliza para realizar su trabajo, él se desempeña como auditor para la institución en la que él trabaja desde hace 12 años.
Tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo el cual ya no depende de él. A don Ricardo se le han otorgado 2 créditos y desde hace 2 años es cliente de nuestra institución Ceprodel, los cuales han sido de mucha ayuda ya que le han permitido invertir en gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ricardo P. works in the mayor’s office in Chicigalpa. The loan he is requesting is to buy paint and paint his car. He uses his car to do his work. For 12 years he has worked for the institution as an auditor. He is 44, married, and has one child who is no longer dependent upon him. Ricardo has had two loans in the two years that he has been a Ceprodel client. The loans have been a great help because they allowed him to pay for personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint for his vehicle and pay for the labor to paint his car

loans.name: Marie Raphael

texts.fr: Marie Raphaël est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle fait de l'abattage et vente de viande de porc. Cette activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui ont permis de s'équiper en mobiliers.
texts.en:
Marie Raphaël is a married, 45 year-old with five children at home. She has been a member of the Village Bank for the past 8 years and has repaid her loans. She is an experienced butcher who sells pork. Her business revenues have been used to buy furnishings.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella was born in 1983 and is married to Ngeh Edwine. She lives in Ntasen quarters, Bamenda, Cameroon. The couple is blessed with two children. Stella lost her father when she was young, thus retarding her education which forced her to abandoned school. Stella joined GHAPE in 2009. She had her first loan of 40,000 FRS which she repaid promptly. Stella plans to invest this new loan in her farm and her usual farm produce. On her farm she grows cassava, beans, cocoyam (taro, a root crop), yams and vegetables. She is sure she will succeed in her business because she has fertile land. Her activity will help the community by increasing the amount of food to the satisfaction of the community. Stella plans to use the profit to pay fees, and to feed and clothe the family. She will also increase the capital of the business so as to challenge her competitors by buying more foodstuffs when the stock from the farm is getting finished. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Haroldo

texts.es: Haroldo tiene 39 años, el se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene 1 hijos de 10 años, por lo que le dedica a el mayor tiempo posible pues todos los días el vive muy contento por tener un medio de ingreso para salir adelante. El logro independizarse a los 26 años de edad, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar por su propia cuenta ya que a base de sacrificios y muchos esfuerzos logro comprar un tramo pequeño en donde ofrece sus productos a los diferentes clientes. Este es el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de mochilas, calzado, pantalones de uniformes, faldas de uniformes, camisas para niños y niñas ya que se acerca la temporada de entrada a clases. El sueña comprar su propia casa y mejorar su tramo.
texts.en:
Haroldo, 39, sells general merchandise. He has been in this business for over 20 years. He devotes the greatest amount of time possible to his ten year old child. Everyday he is happy to have a means of income to get ahead. He was able to become independent at 26. He has always liked working on his own. After a lot of sacrifice and a great deal of effort he bought a small place where he offers his products to different customers. This is the reason for the loan; to buy backpacks, footwear, uniform pants, uniform skirts, and shirts for boys and girls because the time for starting classes is approaching. He dreams of buying his own house and improving his small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of cereals in bulk

loans.name: Gembom Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a widow with five children, and she lives in Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She will invest her loan in the cultivation of crops like yams, cassava, and vegetables, and in the selling of drinks. This is Theresia's second loan; she has been a member since 2008. This loan will help to increase cultivation on her existing farms and improve the farming method to enable her to have better yields and also expand her business. She will also be able to purchase improved seedlings for better results. She plans to use the manure of pigs and fowl for crop cultivation.

With the profits from this loan, Theresia will construct a house for herself and children. She will also pay her children’s school fees and ensure that they are well prepared for school. She would like to purchase more seedlings. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff.

loans.use: To clear cultivable land and increase farm size

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To buy provisions for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes Vive en su casita con su papá, que ya es mayor de edad, ella lo cuida, sus hermanos ya son independientes ya se casaron y viven aparte.

Tiene un pequeño snack donde vende rellenos de papa, postre y arroz, estos productos se elaboran de la siguiente manera; los tres cocidos y aplastados hasta hacerlos puré, rellenados de jigote, hecho con cebolla, zanahoria y carne molida, luego se frie en aceite caliente. Estos productos son consumidos por gran parte de la poblacion a media mañana. 

Es muy conocida por la zona y tiene varios clientes, lleva 5 años con esta actividad y esto le ayuda a mantener su hogar ya que es la unica que corre con los gastos por ser su Papa una persona mayor y que necesita muchos cuidados. 

El crédito que solicita es para comprar verdura por carga ya que cuesta menos, y abarrotes para eloborar los rellenos.

La Sra. Mercedes esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in her small house with her father, who is elderly. She takes care of him. Her siblings are independent, married, and live separately. She has a small snack business where she sells stuffed potatoes, sweets, and rice. She makes these products in the following manner. She cooks the three and crushes them until they are puree. She fills them with hash made with onion, carrots, and ground meat. Then she fries them in hot oil. These products are usually eaten mid-morning. She is well known in the area, and she has lots of customers. She has been doing this for five years, and this helps support her household. She is the only one who pays the expenses because her father is elderly and needs much care. The loan she is requesting is to buy vegetables in bulk because they cost less. She will also buy groceries to make the stuffed potatoes. Mercedes is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora es una cliente que trabajo con Grupo Solidario  "JADES" en el año 2004 por tres secuencias, luego participo como codeudora D. su esposo Nestor quien trabaja con credito individual por 2 secuencias. El señor nestor su esposo en este momento esta en el interior del pais y es por eso que no pueD. renovar su credito para comprar una maquina para tejido nueva, ya que la actual no esta en buenas condiciones y necesitaran por lo menos una mas para poder cumplir con sus pedidos.Es por eso que la señora Teodora decidio solicitar un credito individual con una garantia personal y documentos en custodia D. un minibus pertenecientes al señor Faustino(garante).

La señora se dedica a la elaboracion D. mantas D. lana a mano y con maquina (las mantas las utilizan las cholitas vestimenta tradicional en la mujer D. pollera), sus pedidos vienen D. las tiendas que existen sobre la calle Max Paredes solicitan por lo menos entre 10 a 15 mantas semanales(a maquina y a mano) y tambien solicitan mayor cantidad  a mano cada 15 y fin D. mes.

El destino del credito como ya se explico anteriormente es para la compra D. una maquina D. tejer y asi satisfacer los pedidos D. los clientes.

La Sra. Teodora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
In 2004 Mrs. Teodora participated with Grupo Solidario JADES for three loan cycles. Later, she and her husband, Néstor, secured joint loans for two loan cycles. Néstor has secured individual loans as well. He is away at the moment in another part of the country and for that reason is unable to ask for a loan for the purchase of a new knitting machine. The one they currently use is not in good shape and they will need at least one more in order to fill their ongoing orders. Mrs. Teodora has requested an individual loan, secured by her personal property and with Mr. Faustino as guarantor. Mr. Faustino’s minibus is additional collateral. Mrs. Teodora makes hand and machine-knit blankets. These blankets are used by indigenous women who prefer traditional dress. She gets orders of 10-15 blankets a week (both hand and machine woven) from stores on Max Paredes Street, with a greater number of hand-knit blankets ordered on the 15th and at the end of the month. As described above, the loan will be used to buy a knitting machine to be able to fill her customers' orders. Mrs. Teodora is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A KNITTING MACHINE

loans.name: Maria Marbelly

texts.es: Maria Marbelly tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa interior. Ella tiene 4 hijos y los quiere mucho tiene dos niñas gemelitas.
