She likes this work a lot because it is quite profitable, since in the area where she lives there is no competition and her earnings are good. In addition, it is a peaceful type of work that does not require her to exert herself too much, because her customers come to her house to get the tanks of gas, and at times she gets help from her sisters or her children. She also sells soft drinks and beer, which are in the most demand on the weekends. In the future, Rosa plans to remodel a part of her home in order to open a small store where she can sell her drinks and other foods. This is Rosa's fifth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] and she is sure that she will be very responsible about repaying it, since she wants to keep a good relationship with this lending field partner. She will use the loan she is asking for now to buy tanks of gas, soft drinks, and various cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tanks of gas

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 50 años de edad, tinen 2 hijos menores  de 16 y 14 años de edad, ella es casada su conyugue trabaja en una mina por la selva, ella  vive en  el Distrito de La Tinguiña en casa propia de material noble. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora y venta de productos de belleza, ella se inicio en este negocio hace 5 años.La Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora,  ella tiene sueños y metas , uno de ellos es que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra de zapatos y uniformes para la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, has two, minor children, who are 16 and 14 years old. She is married and her husband works as a miner in the jungle. She lives in her own, substantial, home in La Tinguiña. She goes from house to house selling clothing and beauty products. She began this business 5 years ago. Carmen is a very hard-working person; she has dreams and goals, one of which is that her children become professionals. She will use the requested funds to buy shoes and school uniforms for the next school term.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mr. Long R., 58, is a low-income person who earns a living by operating a farming business. He plants crops and raises pigs, which he sells when they are mature.

Long R. is married and has two children, both of whom are married. His wife is a partner in his business. As Long R. was not available for the photograph, his wife is shown instead.

Long R. is looking for a loan to buy piglets for his pigpen and to buy fertilizer to sustain his crops.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann O. is a married woman and the mother of four teenage children. To earn a living, she raises ducks to produce eggs for a profit. Additionally, she uses the excrement from her ducks to grow a few crops for extra income. She has a partner in her husband who assists with her in the business.

Vann O. will use her loan to buy more ducks as well as a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy more ducks as well as a piglet to raise

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Nheb K., age 55, resides in a village located in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. Here she has her own small business, the main activity of which is to plant crops.

In addition, Nheb K. also cuts and collects palm leaves and turns them into sets of palm roofs for extra profit. From this she is able to earn a daily income of $2 to contribute to supporting the daily needs of her family.

Nheb K. has a good partner in her husband who assists her in conducting her business. She has seven children who are married and have started new homes.

Nheb K. looks for assistance through Kiva’s field partner, HKL. With the loan she will buy a couple of cows to raise their offspring as well as to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows

loans.name: Tuvsanaa

texts.en: Tuvsanaa is a driver and is the father of two. He has lived in the city for the past two years. Tuvsanaa purchased the insulated ger (nomadic tent) blanket because he needed a warm and clean blanket to make it through the rest of the cold winter. He says that he, his wife, and two children have already felt warmer in the weeks that they have had the blanket. About XacBank Eco Products Program: Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C. is 44 years old and she is the leader of this group village bank which consists of four people and which is located in Dong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Ny C. and her husband, Mr. Um Phann, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. Besides farming, Mrs. Ny C. is also a silk weaver and she wants to expand this business.

So, Mrs. Ny C. is applying for a loan to buy more silk to support her business. The loan will help to increase her income and improve the family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Ny C. is the mother of five children, one of whom is an employee in the garment factory, another helps with the silk weaving while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Mrs. Norng P. is highly skilled at planting crops in the village. For extra profit, she also buys mature crops from other farmers to resell. She has another partner in her husband, who appears in the photo. He built a workshop and has some tools that he uses to provide vehicle repair services in front of his house. Mrs. Norng P. has four children. Three of her children are married and live independently, and the other one is single. 

Norng P.’s husband is very busy at his trade because there are a lot of clients who need his service, but he lacks essential tools to perform his service, so Norng P. has requested a loan to buy more tools. She hopes to use any remains from the loan to increase the financing of her rice sales enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more tools for her husband's vehicle repair business

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a driver who lives with his wife and one-year-old child. Their family migrated from Uus Providence a year ago. He chose to take a loan for biofuels because it produces more energy and helps cut down on air pollution. He lamented that the city’s pollution has reached a disaster level and that he felt that he also needed to do something.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city's population live in tents called "gers," with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the ger districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the ger districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
This loan group, which consists of nine people, is lead by Mrs. Sokhom C.. She is 45 years old and she lives in Pech Changva Village, TaK. Province. Mrs. Sokhom C. and her husband, Mr. Hor Tuon, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow rice. They now face a problem because their field has infertile soil, so Mrs. Sokhom C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fuel to support the crops on her farm. Mrs. Sokhom C. is a mother of four childrE.. One of her childrE. is employed in a garment factory and the other three are students in the local school. Mrs. Pho Pha, who is the group guarantor, is also presented in the photo with the village bank loan group members. 

[Editor's Note: Group guarantors are usually clients who have established a credit history. They guarantee the loans of clients who have less credit history, enabling those clients to take out their first loan or a larger loan. If a member of the loan group cannot pay, the guarantor will share some responsibility for the debt.]

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Mr. Chak R. owns and operates his rice-selling business from his home in his village. The business enables him to feed his family. The main operation is to buy mature rice in bulk at reasonable prices and then resell and gain the proceeds. Chak R. was married many years ago to Phan Mean, age 55, who is his family partner who earns a living as a rice grower. She also produces and sells a few cakes to the people for additional income. This couple has two single and three married children. Two are cupcake sellers and others are building workers. In Cambodia, this is the time of year when rice comes to maturity and prices are especially low, so Chak R. is applying for this loan as capital to buy a large amount of mature rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of mature rice to resell.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mr. Heang H. is 53 years old and he lives in Prey Prum Village, Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sao Hay, are farmers who own 1.40-hectare (~ 3.5-acre) on which they grow rice. He and his wife also are pig breeders and wine makers. 

Since their businesses are doing well, Mr. Heang H. wants to expand them, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy ten pigs and pig food. With the rest of the loan, he will to support his wine making business. With the loans, his standard of living is improving and his income is increasing, too. Mr. Heang H. has three children. One of his children is a farmer and the other two are students in the local school. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ten pigs and pig food, and to support his wine-making business.

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en:
Tseren is a chef and father of two. His two children attend the local primary school. He purchased a highly-insulated ger (yurt) covering after searching for a product that would help cut his monthly fuel budget. Since using the product, he has noticed that his fuel costs have gone down considerably.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. 60% of the city population live in tents called "gers," with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the ger districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the ger districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuel.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Koul

texts.en:
The small wooden house and grocery shop located in a commune of Siem Reap Province belongs to Mrs. Koul T., age 36. There, she sells a few cooking ingredients to her neighbors who own houses near hers. Beside this, she distills Khmer wine and sells it to the retailers in the market for extra income. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who sells carving wood. Koul T. is a good mother caring for five teenage children, all of whom are students. They also assist in their parent’s businesses when they are not going to school. 

Koul T. is taking her first loan to accumulate her inventory for her grocery shop. With any remaining money from the loan, she will buy animals and raise their babies.

loans.use: To accumulate inventory for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Munkhtsogt

texts.en:
Munkhtsogt is a driver who lives with his wife and 10-year-old son. He purchased a ger (yurt) insulation blanket to stay warm during the cold Mongolian winter. So far, he and his family have appreciated how warm and comfortable they have been with the covering.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called "gers," with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the ger districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the ger districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
GOTITAS D. AMOR

Esta alcancía cursa su 15avo ciclo, hasta el momento sus doce integrantes han demostrado responsabilidad, muy emprendedores como lo muestran cada uno en sus negocios; tratar D. salir adelante por darles lo mejor a los miembros D. su hogar es su objetivo principal, como son los casos D.: 
Elizabeth es madre soltera D. 32 años, antes D. tener su negocio D. golosinas en casa se dedicaba a lo mismo pero lo hacía en forma ambulatoria andaba en su carreta recorriendo las calles D. su zona. Por las mañanas se dedica a la venta D. menús que acondicionó al lado D. su pequeño módulo D. madera (kiosco) que pudo obtenerlo D. las ventas y créditos que recibió; por lo general los platos que prepara les venden a los choferes y cobradores. Ha mejorado con el tiempo su negocio, le ayuda a criar y darles lo esencial a sus dos hijos D. 17 y 6 años. Surtir su kiosco es lo que necesita para comprar papas fritas, piqueos, gaseosas que son productos D. mayor salida.

Claudia tiene 58 años D. edad se dedica a la venta D. comida más D. 18 años cuando estuvo D. concesionaria para una compañía D. ferrocarriles, donD. le iba bien, posteriormente dejó D. trabajar allí alquilando después un stand al principio tenía regulares ingresos pero después esto cambio debido a los cobros excesivos D. gastos administrativos que le cobraban no resultando rentable las ganancias D. sus comidas.
Esto la llevó a trabajar en lo mismo pero en su propia casa, con este negocio terminó D. educar a su hija a quien la apoya con algunos gastos D. su nieta D. 14 años. Los préstamos que se hizo fue para comprar un par D. mesas y sillas D. plástico para comodidad a sus clientes así mismo requiere D. un pequeño módulo D. madera para terminar D. cercar su pequeña casa hecha D. módulo D. madera.
texts.en:
GOTITAS D. AMOR (LITTLE DROPS OF LOVE) This communal bank is in its 15th loan cycle. To date, its twelve members have shown responsibility and entrepreneurship in their various businesses. They make the effort to succeed and proviD. the best for their family members, which is their main objective in life. Among them are: Elizabeth, 32, is a single mother. Prior to having her business selling sweets, she was in the same line of work but she did it as a peddler; she pushed her cart along the streets in her neighborhood. In the mornings, she sells prepared meals next to her small wooden sales stall (kiosko) that she set up thanks to her profits earned and loans obtained. In general, her dishes are bought by public transport drivers and bill collectors. Her business has improved over time and its earnings help her to raise and proviD. for her two children, who are 17 and 6 years old. She needs stock items for her sales: potato chips, meat skewers, soft-drinks, which are her best sellers. Claudia, 58, has sold prepared meals for over 18 years. She began by having the food concession at a railway company; she did well there. Afterwards, she left employment there and leased a stand. At the beginning, she had steady income but later, due to the excessive administrative costs that she had to pay, her meals stopped being profitable. This led her to set up the same kind of business in her own home. This allowed her to complete paying for her daughter’s education and to help her with some of her 14-year-old granddaughter’s expenses. Her previous loans were used to buy plastic tables and chairs to proviD. better comfort for her customers. She now needs funds for a small, wooden, modular unit to finish fencing the yard of her house, which is maD. of a pre-fab wood modular unit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey S. is 57 years old. She was married many years ago to Mr. Choun Sour, age 60, and they both earn their daily income by growing rice. This old couple is blessed to five single children, all of whom work at different occupations. 

At the beginning of year, the rainy season for rice has recently passed and the dry season for rice is approaching. Srey S. lacks some essential supplies that she needs to grow a rice crop. Therefore, she has applied for a loan of $700 USD to buy fertilizers and crop seeds. In addition, she will use some of the loan to build a shop and begin selling groceries for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and crop seeds.

loans.name: Shashnay

texts.en:
Shashnay is a teacher and has lived in Ulaanbaatar’s ger districts for the past 6 years.  She purchased an eco stove for her family so that they could cope better with the harsh winter.  So far she feels that the stove has kept her significantly warmer at night and she feels good about polluting less by burning less fuel. 

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: purchase of an energy efficient heating stove

loans.name: Sarantstsralt

texts.en:
Sarantstsralt is the mother of two children and a local seamstress. She has lived in the city for about 4 years. She was concerned about the effects of  pollution on her young children. She wanted to reduce the pollution from her house and reduce the amount she spends on heating fuel. So far she has been very happy with the new ger (yurt) insulation.  

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: purchase of a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mr. C. is 35 years of age and currently lives with his wife in a wooden house in a village in Kompong Tom province. C. owns a rice milling machine and provides a rice milling service in the village. He and his wife have also built a small stall where they breed many pigs which they sell when mature. C. always uses the leftovers from his rice milling to feed his pigs. C. requests a loan to purchase parts to replace the broken part of his house. (Mr. C. was not available when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase parts to repair his house

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
VIRGEN DEL CARMEN


Las diez mujeres D. esta alcancía comunal trabajan muy duro día a día con la finalidad D. salir adelanD. buscando el progreso en sus vidas y a los suyos.
Elita se dedica al servicio D. lavado D. carros hace quince años, son mayormente los camiones D. carga que solicitan este servicio, sus hijos le ayudan en esta labor. También trabaja en la chacra D. su padre sembrando alfalfa, ganancias que son compartidas. Recibió créditos que invirtió para abonar la tierra, comprar semillas contratar peones para limpiar la tierra, el negocio D. alfalfa es rentable cuando es su temporada. 
D. igual modo renovó en mangueras nuevas, tubos, detergentes, escobillones, franelas. Otro ingreso que tiene es la venta D. cafés, menús y gaseosas llegó a instalar unas mesas y sillas que lamentablemente fue destruido por unas piedras que cayeron en épocas D. lluvias trayendo pérdidas. Su negocio es D. ayuda para terminar D. educar a su hijo D. quince años quien aún estudia en el colegio.
El crédito que requiere es para pagar los trámites D. titulación a su hijo quien estudió la carrera D. agropecuaria. 

Jessica es una mujer muy emprendedora empezó a vender abarrotes en su casa esto lo hizo con los pagos que recibió su esposo por tocar en las fiestas patronales. Ella invierte las ganancias en comprar mercadería, es así que hoy es una pequeña tienda surtida D. verduras, abarrotes y frutas. Seguir implementando más su tienda con otros productos es lo que quiere Jessica lo que a futuro comprará un pequeño terreno cerca D. la capital para facilidad D. estudios universitario a su hijo quien tiene 13 años. El actual negocio apoya a su esposo en algunos gastos.
texts.en:
VIRGEN DEL CARMEN Group

The ten women in this community bank work very hard day after day with the goal of advancing themselves, looking for progress in their lives and their families' lives.

Elita has worked washing cars for 15 years; for the most part, trucks that carry cargo request this service. Her children help her in this work. She also works at her father's farm, planting alfalfa, and the earnings are shared. She received loans that she invested to fertilizer the land, buy seeds, and hire workers to clear the land. The alfalfa business is profitable in its season. In the same way, she invested in new hoses, tubes, detergents, brooms, and flannel cloths.She has another source of income from the sale of coffee, daily special menus, and soft drinks; she got as far as installing tables and chairs, which unfortunately were destroyed by some rocks that fell during the time of the heavy rain, bringing losses. The goal of her business is to help finish educating her son of 15 years, who is still in secondary school. The loan that she is requesting is to pay for the graduation expenses for her son, who is studying land and cattle management.

Jessica is a very enterprising woman. She began to sell groceries in her house with the earnings her husband received for playing in the saints' day festivals. She invested the earnings is buying merchandise, thus today she has a little store supplied with vegetables, groceries, and fruit. What Jessica wants is to go on stocking her store with other products. In the future she will buy a little piece of land near the capital to facilitate the university studies of her son who is 13 years old. Her present business helps her husband with some expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay son's graduation expenses

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin N. is a temporary laborer who is always hired by people to do everything they need, including building a house or harvesting mature crops. He has a partner in his wife (she is pictured), who stays at home to raise a few pigs to earn a living. Additionally, the family sometimes grows a rice crop. Chin N. will use his loan to buy an additional hog for his wife to breed and some fertilizer for his rice planting.

loans.use: To buy a hog and fertilizer.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em L., 28, is a grocery seller who has been operating in this sector for a long time. She has a partner in her husband, who helps be responsible for the family by working as a requirement laborer (casual laborer). He is hired by his village to deliver batteries to the charging location for a fee. Em L. is taking out her loan to increase her grocery inventory for her store. The family lives with two kids who attend the public local school.

loans.use: To add to her grocery inventory for her store.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Раджабова Садбарг проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Раджабова Садбарг торговлей занимается более 4 лет. Она покупает, перерабатывает и продает национальный вид табака "нос" В переработке табака ей помогает сын. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sadbarg R. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She has been working as a trader for more than four years. She buys, processes and sells the national tobacco product, known as "nos". Her son helps her with the processing the tobacco. She is applying for credit in order to increase the turnover of her business.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase business turnover

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita V., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Antonio, they are blessed in their union. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while selling Ready-to-wear clothing for 10 years now.

Margarita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store and Ready-to-wear clothing business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries to replenish her variety store’s current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her own mini-mart someday.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To restock her grocery inventory

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae M. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Mae is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mae owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the market. She also has a tricycle that provides transport in the local community. Mae has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.ru: Сангов Курбоназар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сангов Курбоназар животноводством занимается более 12 лет. Он одновременно занимается растениеводством. Сангов Курбоназар откармливает и продает скот. Он сажает разные полезные растения для кормления скота. Целью кредита является закуп скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonazar S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 49 years old, married, with four children. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than twelve years. Additionally, he grows crops. Kurbonazar S. raises and sells cattle, and also cultivates various crops to feed his livestock. The goal of the loan is to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace J., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life.  She has been managing her health care product business for 12 years now.

Grace has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her health care product business.   

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 45,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional quantities of health care products, as well as incorporating more varieties of products into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her adopted child’s future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy a variety of health care products for her inventory

loans.name: 02 Group

texts.en:
Huyền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1977. (id: 010117090067). She is married and has two children. She lives in Dai Bi village with her husband and her children. She sells beverage (coca cola, beer, fruitjuice). She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has been taking part in SEDA for five years and repays ontime. This time, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 vnd. She hopes she has a life better.
 About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Vinh Thị Thành Nguyễn is 29 years old. (id:010117090048). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.
 Mai Thị Nguyễn is 35 years old. (id: 010117090065).She is a tailor. She sells clothes in the market, too. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy clothes.
 Lê Thị C. is 40 years old. (id: 010117090058). She sells fish in the market. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: To use for her small business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is from the village of Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing habal-habal motorcycle services to the local community. (A habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers.) Mary Jane is just starting this business.
In 2010, Mary Jane joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her transport vehicle in order to improve her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Mary Jane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her transport vehicle

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Mrs. Lonh Y., 58, and her husband, 65, are both rice cultivators in their village. They have three children, all of whom are married and live independently. Lonh Y. is requesting a loan to support her in growing a variety of crops.

loans.use: To grow a variety of crops

loans.name: Phương's Group

texts.en:
Phương Thị T. N. (ID 010117090028) is 36 years old. She lives in Dai Bi, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two school-aged children. She sells fish and shrimp in the market and has been doing this for four years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.
Phương Thị T. N. is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Phương Thị T. N. has been a member of SEDA for five years and has always made her repayments on time. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,250,000 VND from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,194,000 VND, which will be used to support her business.

About the other borrowers in her group
Tớm Thị C. (ID 010117090030) is 54 years old. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Hồng Thị N. (ID 010117090029) is 34 years old. She is a tailor who wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy a sewing machine and cloth.
Hà T. Đỗ (ID 010117090032) is 40 years old. She breeds pigs and fish. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy pig and fish food.
Nhạn Thị N. (ID 010117090031) is 50 years old. She sells pork in the market, and also has a store. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: To support her business

loans.name: Genesis

texts.en:
Genesis C. is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Genesis owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as snack food, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Genesis is just starting this business.
In 2010, Genesis joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha N., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Savang Sang, 39, (pictured together) have been married since 1994 and have one daughter who attends school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Chantha has been a construction worker for seven years and he works in his village. Mrs. Savang Sang has been selling Cambodian cake in her village since she was young. The house where they live has broken down in some parts so Chantha is asking for his first loan of $500 USD to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Tuburan Villaflor Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Olivia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Olivia works in someone else's business venture in the food sector operating a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving foods to customers in the local community. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Olivia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used for additional capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Olivia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en:
Lanh Thị Nguyễn is 31 years old. ( id: 010117140035). She sells clothes in the market. She was married and has one child. Lanh lives in Xom Ngoai village, in Uy No Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. Lanh is the group leader of a 5  member loan group offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She has taking part in SEDA loans for 5 years and repayed each loan on time. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.750.000 VND from SEDA. Lanh is now requesting a new loan of 6.322.000 VND ( or 345 USD) which will be used to support her clothing sales business.

 About the other borrowers in her group: 
Hà Thị Hoàng is 27 years old. ( id: 010117140039). She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND( or 385 USD) to invest in her glass and aluminum shop.
Liên Thị Đỗ is 54 years old. ( id: 010117140038). She has a bicycle repair shop. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND( or 270 USD) to buy bicycle parts to resell.
Linh Thị Nguyễn is 44 years old. (id: 010117140002). She sells sugar cane in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND( or 295 USD) to inprove her small business.
Hiền Thị Hoàng is 40 years old. ( id: 010117140004). She sells from her shop every morning. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND( or 345 USD) to buy equipment including table, chairs, bowls, etc for her business..

loans.use: to support her business

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs.Ya C. contributes to her family finances by raises pigs. Her partner and her husband owns an old grinding machine and provides a rice-milling service. Ya C. will use this loan to buy mature rice to mill and sell at a profit. She has four teenage children who no longer attend school and are part time laborers.

loans.use: To buy mature rice to grind and sell

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs.Han A. (pictured here), age 31 and her husband, Mr. Khorn Porm, age 32, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have 2 sons. 

Mrs. Han A. has been a silk weaver since she was s15 years old, a skill she learned form her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turns sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been farming and raising cows for 15 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to Teresia Mwenda. They have two children, one who is in school and the other who is only two years old.  John  ventured into the property market in 2007 and he has build houses for low income earners in Naivasha town where he charges very low rents.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  John has repaid his first loan which he used to add two more housing units on his piece of land.  He plans to use the cash from this second loan to buy more iron sheets which will help him complete two other housing units still under construction.

He sees himself in this house rental business for some time to come. His plan is to complete building several more rental units on this piece of land.  He also plans to buy another parcel of land where he will build more rental units in the future.

loans.use: To buy more iron sheets to complete rental houses under construction

loans.name: Musa Barusi

texts.en:
Musa Barusi G. is from Migori town. He is 36 years old, married to Joyce Anzemo, and has four children.
Musa is a farmer and is mainly involved in planting pineapples. His clients are mostly other farmers and he has a stand in the market from which he sells to the local community. He is looking for a loan through Kiva partner, KADET, to enable him to buy more fertilizer. With the profits made from his business, he plans to expand his business to a larger scale, and even diversify to livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov C., 34, is a widow who lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has three children – two sons and one daughter. Two of them have full-time employment and the other stays at home.
Pov has been selling pickled fruits for more than three years. Her main source of income is from her children’s salaries. They do not have their own transport so they frequently spend a lot of money on travel costs. Therefore, Pov is asking for her first loan of $1,000 USD in order to buy a motorbike for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 33-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and two children. He has been working in agriculture since 2004. He plants fruits and vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, apples and mint, as well as other products depending on the season. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase seeds and repair his car. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. 
His customers are his friends and neighbors, as well as fruit and vegetable shops. He decided to start his business because it was his family’s business. In the future, he hopes to improve his work and maybe buy a bigger piece of land for growing his fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and repair his car

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda A. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Bernarda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling her own caught seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Bernarda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Bernarda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bernarda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Mr. Ul P. is highly skilled at connecting electricity lines. He is a skilled electrician who has worked in a small firm for many years. He is also hired for a fee by citizens to connect new electricity lines. In addition to his earnings, he relies on his wife's income from selling used clothes. She rents a small shop inside the market from which she operates her business. She hopes to own a shop and therefore reduce the amount she has to pay in rent. For this reason, Mr. Ul P. is applying for a loan of $800 USD to buy his wife a proper kiosk in the market. (Mr. Ul P.'s wife is shown in the photo above.)

loans.use: To buy a proper kiosk in the market for his wife

loans.name: Shadrack Ouma

texts.en: Shadrack is a 29-year-old tailor who operates his business (Shalo Dressmaking) in the Ngara area of Nairobi. He has been in this business for twelve years and says the business environment is good. He is requesting a second loan of 55,000 KES after successful completion of a first loan from the Kiva field partner, Faulu Kenya.  This loan will be used to add to his stock of fabric and to buy a sewing machine. A father to two, Shadrack hopes to establish an exhibition center in the future and have a stable family. He describes himself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: Add stock of fabric and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes L. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is 68 years old. Gertrudes is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, as well as snacks, candies, noodles, eggs and so on in the local community.  Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $66 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for workers' wages. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay workers' wages

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak S., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Ros Seng, 31, live along National Road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have a two-year-old daughter. Vannak was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead. 

Vannak has been driving a taxi for four years; he carries garment factory workers to work and back. His wife stays at home to take care of their daughter. His van broke down, so he can't continue his business.  

Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $300 to repair his van. Then he will be able again to provide transportation.

loans.use: To repair his van.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario P. is from the city of San Antonio, Ozamiz City. He is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Dario owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, eggs, salt, sugar, candies, some food for snacks and so on in the local community. Dario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $228 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Dario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 15,348 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 5th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. Chek K., 46 years old, is a good father blessed with three children. His three grown children are in school. His wife (pictured here), Loeung Ra, 43, is a pig breeder. To earn a living, Chek K. owns and uses an old machine to mill nearby farmers' rice for a fee. Chek K. saw that his wife’s pig-raising business was going smoothly and the income accruing frequently. So, he has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester R., 43, is making sure that her family has what they need. She is living with her two children, and she makes sure that she earns enough so that her family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own food stall for quite some time now, offering mami, bulalo and lugaw (native Filipino noodles, beef marrow soup, and savory rice porridge respectively).

Ester has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her food business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 9,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional quantities of ingredients needed for her recipes. Ester dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she will have more patrons, and have the means to give her children a bright and stable future.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Sok-Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-heng D., 28, (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Oeur, 29, have been married since 2000. They have three children: two daughters and one son. Two of them attend school and other one is still young. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sok-heng has been selling fish since she was married. Her husband is a construction worker. In the past he was a truck driver. Sok-heng buys fish from the villagers and transports them with her motorbike to sell at Phnom Penh market. Because her motorbike is so old, she is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to carry fish to market.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn F., 32, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Elias F., a vendor, she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own vegetable stall for quite some time now.

Ailyn has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her vegetable-selling business.     

Now with your help, Ailyn would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional quantities of vegetables to be incorporated into her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she will have more customers and more vegetables to sell.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of vegetables

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He has been running his boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business for the past year, and he also sells knife sharpeners to earn additional income. With the 15,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase another motorbike to have a well-established transport business. He hopes to have a stable source of income and a happy family someday. Anthony describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married to Elizabeth Waithera, and they have four children, two employed and two still going to school.  He has been running a butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his second loan after paying off the first loan well.  He plans to buy more goats which he will raise and slaughter, providing him with a cheap means of getting meat to sell.

His future dream is to expand his shop and open other outlets within Naivasha town.  This will increase his income and also enable him create employment for other people in the town.

loans.use: Buy more goats

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan E., 53, is from the village of Ppblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental, where he is the married father of two adult-aged children. To make a living, Hernan works in someone else's business venture, providing masonry services in the local community. Engaged in this business for over five years, he earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hernan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC, Hernan is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Kemisa

texts.en: Kemisa is a Nairobi-based businesswoman who runs a salon in the Kibera area. Operating in a good business environment since 1985, Kemisa has carved her own market in Kibera and says that her customers are reliable. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy equipment for her salon. A mother to four teenagers, Kemisa hopes to own land and houses, enlarge the business, employ many and educate children. She describes herself as hardworking, dependable and responsible.

loans.use: Buy equipment for the salon

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daina Atieno

texts.en:
Daina M., 38, is from the town of Migori, in Nyanza province, where she is married to Dan M., a teacher.  They have four children, the eldest already in college.  

Daina runs a retail shop with a huge clientele, as hers is the only store around the neighborhood. She is requesting a loan through Kadet Ltd. to boost her business by adding more stock including soda, cooking fat, tissues and others.  Daina plans to expand her business to wholesale and also start a money center where people send and receive money through a local phone subscriber, Safaricom MPESA services.

loans.use: To buy five crates of soda, cooking flour, and tissues to add to her stock

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en:
Urbana R., from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur, is 45, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Urbana owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as candies, coffee, milo, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Urbana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Urbana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, Urbana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This loan will her fourth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 32 year old married man with two daughters who are both attending school. He has been running “Vangulo”, his salon and barber shop, for the past four years. His other source of income is from renting houses.

With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase a blow dryer and a shaving machine. He hopes to own his own plot of land someday and to open more salons and barber shops in Kingstone. Douglas describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and a shaving machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion A., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Reynaldo A., an Overseas Filipino Worker, they are still going strong in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Asuncion has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 24,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to replenish stocks in her store’s product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for the bright future of her children.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stocks in her store’s product inventory

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mr. Phal H., 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Yun Oeun, 45 years old (pictured together), live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers, three attend school, and the other one is still young.

Phal has been driving a motor taxi for ten years, while his wife has been growing rice for twenty-eight years. His wife hopes to supplement that with another pig-raising business, so Phal is applying for his first loan of $500 in order to help his wife purchase pigs to raise and build a pigpen.

loans.use: To help his wife purchase piglets to raise and build a pigpen

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon L., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Henry L., an employee, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own junk shop for quite some time now.

Corazon has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her salon business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to purchase more junk supplies which in turn will be sold to bigger foundries and manufacturers. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education, so that they can have degrees and have good stable jobs once they’re grown.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more junk supplies which in turn will be sold to bigger foundries and manufacturers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma L. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old and is married. Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different kinds of product such as candies, shampoo, some food for snacks, biscuits (cookies) ,sugar, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina S., 55, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Jess S., a chef, she is blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn S. that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own eatery for quite some time now.

Perlina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her eatery.

Now, with your help, Perlina would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and will be used to buy raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

Perlina dreams that her business will continue to grow S. that she can have enough money for her children to finish their education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed for her recipes

loans.name: Jorgan

texts.en:
Jorgan D. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old and is single.

To make a living,Jorgan owns and operates a business venture in service sector operating a specialized service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue the main source of income comes primarily from operating a jewelry repair shop in the local community.He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jorgan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Warlito J.

texts.en:
Warlito J. Q. is from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City. He is 26 years old and is married.

Warlito J. operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Warlito J. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Warlito J. is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
The photo shows Mr. Kong K., 43 years old, who is a professional Khmer musician, a skill he learned from his grandparents, who died of senility years ago. He is always hired by people to play music for their wedding parties. In addition, his wife buys fish from her wholesale supplier and retails it for a profit. The couple now has four single and two married children, three of whom are industry employees in Phnom Penh.

Kong K. has been facing the fact that he doesn’t have adequate water to use. To solve this problem, he decided to request a loan to hire a laborer to dig a well for his family use. With the rest of the loan he will decorate his old house that frequently needs repair.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a well

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a 30-year-old married man with one child who attends school. He sells used clothing to residents of Embakasi and employs one person. His other source of income is from managing transport vehicles. Previously he was employed at Roto.

With the loan, Tobias hopes to use KES 28,000 to stock up on used clothing and purchase chains and hinges with KES 2,000. He hopes to open a textile shop in the future and to own a good home.

Tobias describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes, hinges and chains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora B. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Teodora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as coffee, cocoa, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Teodora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Pictured together are Mr. Leak P., age 43, and his wife, Mrs. Mach Oeun, age 41, who live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have six daughters, three of whom are married and live outside the family home and other two attend school.

Leak has been driving a motor taxi for ten years while his wife stays at home and does housework. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer), because a Tuk Tuk is able carry more goods and people than a motor taxi.

Therefore, Leak is asking for his first loan of US$1,100 in order to buy a Tuk Tuk for his purpose.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn M. is a 41-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province. She was busy working on the farm when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead. The family has four teenage children.

Oeurn M. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. On her land she grows different kinds of crops which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. She also takes time to go with her husband to fish in and around the river.

Oeurn M. is taking out her loan to buy a water pump to irrigate her crops.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her field

loans.name: Bernard Kiiru

texts.en:
Bernard is a Nairobi-based businessman who runs a barber shop in Nairobi. He has been in this business for eight years and says that since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save consistently.

Bernard is requesting a fourth loan of Kes 60,000 to upgrade and lift the standard of his kinyozi (barber shop). Bernard hopes to have the best kinyozi in the area. He describes himself as persistent.

loans.use: To upgrade his barber shop

loans.name: Mary Mwikali

texts.en:
Mary is a 33-year-old businesswoman who operates a grocery that sells products wholesale. She deals with potatoes and vegetables and employs two people. She describes her business environment as competitive.

Mary is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy twenty bags of potatoes, two sacks of kale and four sacks of peas. She says that since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to plan.

Mary hopes to have a stable lifestyle and to grow her business to world class standards. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, kale and peas

She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mr. Kem K. is 37 years old and has been a fisherman along the river for more than ten years. He is married to Mao Dy, 40, who is a fish seller. He always gives the fish that he catches to his wife to sell at the local market for a profit.

Kem K. has a piece of land and he hopes to cultivate crops on it, but he lacks some supplies. Therefore, he requests a loan to buy fertilizer and seed to grow.
